loans.name: Ivonne Veronica

texts.es:
Ivonne de 21 años, (en la foto aparece en su casa) es una joven emprendedora que le ha gustado trabajar para obtener su propio dinero. En la actualidad trabaja vendiendo ropa y artículos. 

El horario que tiene no está definido ya que trabaja vendiendo ropa como comerciante. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas por eso trabaja todos los días. Vende pantalones, camisas, blusas etc. Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ivonne, 21 years old, is a young entrepreneur who likes to work to earn her own money.  In the picture she appears in her house.  Currently she works selling clothes and other articles. 

She does not have a defined schedule since she works as a clothing salesperson.  She has many aspirations with her sales, and so she works every day.  She sells pants, shirts, blouses, etc.  In order to continue her business, she wants to buy clothing with the loan and thus be able to continue working.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Paula Alejeandra

texts.es:
Desde hace 2 años Paula Alejandra se dedica a la cría de cerdos para realizar un ahorro y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Para continuar y mejorar su negocio Paula necesita mejorar los corrales de sus cerdos, adicionalmente necesita comprar mas animales y cuido para poder venderlos a mejor precio
texts.en:
For the past two years, Paula Alejandra has been raising pigs so that she can save up money in order for her family to have a better quality of life.

In order to continue and improve her business, Paula needs to repair her pigpens. She also needs to buy more animals to raise so that she can sell them at the best price.

loans.use: Purchase pigs & repair pigpens

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: La señora María L. tiene tres años  poniendo uñas postizas en el interior de su casa, y aunque esto surgió como pasatiempo le resulto muy útil al generar de  una forma segura y practica tener  ingresos para su familia,  debido que las uñas las pone en su misma casa no descuida a sus hijos. La señora María está solicitando un crédito con nosotros debido a que ella desea invertir en dicho negocio porque quiere brindarles a sus clientas accesorios nuevos e innovadores para que sigan asistiendo y a la vez la recomienden. Ella planea pagar este crédito con sus ingresos de operaria, y aunque es separado su ex esposo aun le ayuda con los gastos de los niños y así ella no se preocupa  tanto por los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos y se concentrara en pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María L. has been attaching artificial fingernails for three years at home.  Although this started as a hobby it turned out being a useful, sure way to generate family income because she attaches the fingernails at home and can watch over her children at the same time.

María is asking for a loan from us because she wants to invest in said business because she wants to provide her customers with new and innovative accessories so that they will continue to come and to recommend her.

She plans to repay the loan with profits she’d earn and, although separated from her husband, her ex-husband still helps her with the children’s expenses so she’s not too concerned about her household or her children’s expenses and can concentrate on repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy women's accessories.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: Eliseo, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y amable, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para poder forjarse un buen futuro. Cuando los primeros rayos de sol llegan al poblado de Punray (Pueblo de la provincia de Tarma), Eliseo en compañía de sus queridos padres, sale a trabajar sus tierras, las cuales quedan a una hora de camino. Sus tierras son muy fértiles, motivo por el cual la papa, arveja y maíz que siembra son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eliseo, age 21, is a simple and friendly young man who lives at the home of his parents. What he desires most in life is to work hard so that he can create a better future. As soon as the first rays of sunlight reach the town of Punray (located in the province of Tarma), Eliseo and his loving parents leave their home to go work on their land, which requires an hour-long walk. Their land is quite fertile, which helps them grow potatoes, peas, and corn of good quality. What he enjoys most about his work is planting the land with great care. Eliseo has been farming for two years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigating his land. Going forward, he hopes to buy additional land so that he can increase his crop yield.

This is his first loan with MFP. Eliseo does not want to fall behind on his payments due to a lack of funds, so he saves what he needs to meet his obligations. In his Communal Bank, he is a responsible member who is respected by the others in his group. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Zela de 28 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Dionisio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden aquejar sus plantas, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas para sus sembríos, ya que desea que sus cultivos sean más productivos.
texts.en:
Dionisio, age 49, is a simple hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his beloved daughter Zela, age 28. What he desires most is to work hard so that he can get ahead in life. Dionisio continues to plant his fields with great effort since they are the main source of sustenance for his family. His products are in great demand at the wholesale market in Tarma, where he has a reputation for producing good quality crops. This helps him to sell at very good prices. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and protecting them from insects that could damage them. Dionisio has been farming for 35 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting heavy sacks of potatoes since the work is tiring. Going forward, he hopes to purchase a car to make transporting his products much easier.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Dionisio knows that the funds will be beneficial in developing his business. In his Communal Bank, he is a cheerful member who always keeps the meetings organized. The loan of 500 PEN that he requested will be used to purchase compost and insecticides for his crops so that they will be more productive.

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Angela de 33 años, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para mujeres y varones. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 17h00pm en su negocio. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años que aun estudian y quiere darles una mejor educación. Para seguir con su negocio quiere comprar mercadería variada con el préstamo como pantalones, blusas, vestidos. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su mercadería.
texts.en:
Angela is 33 years old. She has a business selling clothes for women and men. Angela works in her business from 9am to 5pm.

She has many aspirations for her business. Angela has two children, ages 10 and 8, attending school and wants to provide them a good education. To continue her business, she wants to use this loan to buy varied merchandise such as trousers, blouses, and dresses. In the future she wants to have a well-stocked inventory.

loans.use: Purchase  trousers, blouses, and dresses

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, de 39 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Herlinda de 42 años y sus dos queridos hijos Paty de 15 y Melina de 9 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Aunque es muy trabajador, Armando sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz y arveja, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de la plaga, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, tiene el deseo de comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, también comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Armando, age 39, is a simple hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife Herlinda (age 42) and their two beloved children, Paty (age 15) and Melina (age 9). Armando wants to provide his children a better quality of life. Since he is an extremely hard worker, Armando knows that he must invest all of his efforts to achieve success in life. He grows potatoes, corn, and peas. Once the harvest season arrives, he brings his products to the wholesale market in Tarma to sell to his customers. They are knowledgeable of the quality of his crops, which explains why they are bought up so quickly. What he enjoys most about his work is protecting his crops from disease. Armando has been farming for twenty years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting his crops to market to sell since the sacks are very heavy. Going forward, he wants to buy additional farmland so that he can increase his planting.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Armando knows that he must submit his payments on time so that he can access subsequent loans. He is an active participant in his Communal Bank. The loan of 3000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy potato and pea seeds as well as compost and insecticides.

loans.use: Purchase compost, insecticides, and seeds for planting potatoes and peas

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma H.  agradece nuestra colaboración en el anterior crédito debido al cual pudo techara la parte trasera de su casa, así como también impermeabilizar algunas partes de la casa lo que genero una mayor comodidad  para su familia. Ella está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo esta vez para hacer una mejora interna a la casa ya que desea poder poner el vitropiso para que su casa sea más confortable, ya que el principal deseo de la señora Norma y su esposo es poder brindarle a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio. La Sra. Norma planea pagara dicho crédito  con la ayuda de su esposo ya que él se hará cargo de los gastos de la casa para que ella utilice a plenitud sus ingresos de secretaria para pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma H. is grateful for our previous loan that she used to install roofing on the rear part of her house as well as waterproof parts of the house; this produced greater comfort for her family.

She is once again asking for a loan this time to do some interior improvements in the house.  She wants to install ceramic tile flooring so that the house will be more comfortable because Norma’s and her husband’s main wish is to provide their children with a better inheritance.

Norma plans to repay the loan with help from her husband.  He will take over paying household expenses so that she can use her entire salary as a Secretary to repay the loan.
.

loans.use: To install ceramic tile flooring.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Ramona se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. La mayoría de sus clientes son regulares, pues frecuentemente consiste llegan a buscar los diferentes productos que le solicitan. Hace más de 32 años que tiene este negocio, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona  responsable y que ha salido adelante con estos financiamientos. El crédito es para la compra de sabanas, cosméticos, ropa en general, lentes, gorras entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Ramona sells general merchandise. This is not the first time she has received financing. Most of her customers are regulars who come by on a frequent basis in search of different products. Ramona has been in business for more than 32 years. She is always known for being a responsible person and has been able stay ahead as a result of these loans.

This loan will be used to buy bed sheets, cosmetics, clothing, sunglasses, hats, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy bed sheets, cosmetics, clothing, sunglasses, hats, and other items

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elías, de 65 años, es un hombre que siempre a luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Desde muy joven Elías aprendió de sus padres a trabajar en la chacra, todos los días ayudaba en el trabajo, ya que era consiente que de ello dependía el bienestar de su familia. Actualmente tiene sus propias tierras donde siembra papa, arveja, habas y maíz, productos que cultiva con muchas ganas, ya que sabe que ahora de está actividad depende su bienestar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras y así tener más tierra para cultivar. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlos, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su banco comunal en donde es un socio muy solidario y responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien estos meses.
texts.en:
Sr. Elías is a 65 year old gentleman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. He lives alone in his own home. What he wants most is to have a peaceful retirement. At a young age, Elías learned from his parents how to work on their farm. Every day he helped with the duties, so he was aware of everything that contributed toward the welfare of their family. He currently has his own farmland where he grow potatoes, peas, beans, and corn. Elías grows these crops with great vigor because his livelihood depends on their harvest. What he enjoys about his work is caring for his crops because he feels pleased when the harvest is large and abundant. Elías has been farming for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying his harvest to the market in Tarma, the place where he sells, because the sacks are extremely heavy. Going forward, he wants to buy additional farmland to cultivate.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Elías knows that he must submit his payments on time and is determined to do so because he does not want to create problems for his Communal Bank. He is a very supportive and responsible member. The loan of 1500 PEN that he requested will be used to buy seeds for planting potatoes and peas. These products have been selling well in recent months.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting potatoes & peas

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Marta Irene se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que siempre llegan camiones repartidores a dejar los productos, por lo que ella recorre los diferentes mercados pues cierto productos los encuentra más favorable en los mercados, así todos los días se levanta muy temprano para ofrecerles a sus clientes su gran variedad de productos. Actualmente ella está solicitando el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en:
Martha Irene has been selling general merchandise for more than ten years. She has two dependent children. Delivery trucks are always arriving to drop off her products. Martha also travels to different markets because certain products are more affordable there. She wakes up early every day so that she can offer her customers a wide variety of products.

Martha is currently requesting a loan to use as operating capital so that she can buy candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents, basic grains, and other products.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents, basic grains, and other products

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio, de 41 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elida de 35 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Epifanio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden aquejar sus plantas, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa, arveja y habas, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Epifanio, age 41, is a kind and hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his wife Elida, age 35, and their four beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Epifanio invests a great deal of effort planting in his fields, which are the main source of sustenance for his family. His products are in great demand at the wholesale market in Tarma and he has earned a reputation for producing crops of good quality, thus enabling him to sell at very good prices. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and protecting them from insects that can have a negative impact. Epifanio has been farming for 26 years and considers the most difficult part to be tranporting sacks of potatoes, peas, and beans because they are extremely heavy and the work is tiring. Going forward, he hopes to buy additional farmland so that he can increase his production.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Epifanio knows that the loan will be beneficial to the development of his business. In his Communal Bank, Epifanio is a cheerful member who always tries to keep the meetings organized. The loan of 2500 PEN that he requested will be used to buy compost and insecticides to help keep his farmland productive.

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, juices, sodas, and household products

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina, de 60 años, es una mujer generosa y buena. Es separada, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos mayores, de los 6 que tiene en total. Esta emprendedora madre de familia, toda su vida ha trabajado arduamente en diversos negocios, pero hace 10 años se estableció en un lugar muy concurrido. En donde a partir de las 4 de la tarde vende café y panqueques calientes hasta 11 de la noche. En este negocio le va muy bien, pero llegada las 5 de la tarde sola no se abastece, por ello últimamente trabaja con la ayuda de su sobrina y otras veces de su hija. Trabajando de esta manera ha logrado educar a sus hijos y construir una parte de su casa, por lo que se siente realizada. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho; por lo que es independiente y muy rentable. Por ello, se aferra a su trabajo y de ese modo logre construir un cuarto más en su casa y lo alquile, para captar  otros ingresos a su economía. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a sus dos compañeras de crédito con quienes trabaja todo este tiempo, ya que este aporte le permite continuar trabajando en busca de su progreso. Agripina, cada fin de semana invierte en mercadería como harina, aceite, azúcar y balones de gas para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará estas mercaderías para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Agripina, age 60, is a generous and good-natured woman. She is separated from her spouse and lives in her own home with two adult children. Agripina has six children in total. This enterprising mother has worked hard all of her life in various businesses, but for the past ten years, she has established herself in a very busy place. Starting at 4pm, she sells coffee and warm pancakes until 11pm. Her business is doing very well, but when 5pm arrives, there are times when she runs out of supplies. Lately she has been working with her niece as her assistant and sometimes with her daughter. By working in this manner, Agripina has been able to provide her children with an education and build part of her home, which makes her feel like she has accomplished something. She enjoys her business because it is profitable and allows her to be independent. For this reason, Agripina continues to work so that she can add another room to her house which she will make available for rent. This will help generate additional income.

She is receiving her eleventh loan from MFP. Agripina promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint two of her fellow group members with whom she works with all the time. These funds will allow her to continue working and making progress. Each week, Agripina invests in merchandise such as flour, oil, sugar, and tanks of gas for her business. For this reason, she will use this loan to buy these products so that she can continue working.

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, sugar, and tanks of gas

loans.name: Mirna Lorena

texts.es: Mirna tiene 52 años, es madre casada. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Su esposo y su hijo son quienes se encargan de transportar a ciertos niños a sus diferentes colegios, por lo que tienen que asegurar a sus clientes un buen servicio. Por lo que ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será invertido en la compa de llantas, repuestos y mantenimiento.  Su deseo es crecer con su negocio, y así poco a poco obtener más clientes para su negocio.
texts.en: Mirna is 52 years old, married, and a mother. Her economic activity is offerting a transport service. For more than 5 years she has dedicated her time to the business. She has always been a very determined woman and she really enjoys her work. Her husband and her son are the drivers, taking children to their different schools, and they have to be able to assure their clients of a good service. Mirna is seeking this loan as working capital, which will be invested in the purchase of tyres, repairs and general maintenance. She would like to expand her business, little by little gaining more clients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda, de 52 años es una mujer muy jovial. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio de 60 años y sus hijos 5 hijos de los 7 que tiene en total. Con quienes juntamente trata de salir adelante. Por muchos años Hermelinda, trabajó preparando buffets para todo tipo de eventos. Pero hace 2 años, en sociedad con su hijo emprendieron el negocio del Internet  en el ambiente de su casa. Se iniciaron con solo 2 maquinas y al poco tiempo 2 más y hoy tienen 10 cabinas para este fin, y una para el control de las horas de las maquinas. Desde entonces, no dispone de mucho tiempo libre, y sus ganancias son muy alentadoras y eso le motiva a seguir trabajando con el mismo dinamismo, pero también se llena de mucho temor en  invertir más; por lo que en su barrio hay mucha delincuencia. Esta contenta de ser un apoyo y pilar para su hijo, por ello se propone construir el segundo piso donde trasladen su negocio y le sea más seguro su negocio. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP y pertenece  a un grupo de crédito muy pequeño conformado de tres personas, pero si todas son muy responsables, por lo que se siente orgullosa de trabajar con ellas. Asimismo promete pagar puntualmente. De obtener el crédito Hermilinda, comprará una impresora, para renovar la que tiene en uso, de este modo continuar trabajando con las anhelos de sobresalir.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, aged 52, is a very jovial woman. She lives in her own house, together with her husband Antonio, aged 60, and 5 of their children - they have 7 in total. They all try to succeed together.

For many years Hermelinda worked preparing buffets for all sorts of events. 2 years ago, however, she and her son started an Internet cafe in their home. They started with just 2 computers, before long had 2 more, and today they have 10 booths available, plus one more computer to manage the timetabling of the machines available. This now takes up most of their time, and the profits are very encouraging, which motivates them to keep working with the same dynamism that got them started. Hermelinda is nervous about investing more, however, because there is a lot crime in their neighbourhood. She is happy to be able to provide support to her son, and she proposes building a second story onto their home, which they would move the business into, and which would be more secure. 

This is Hermelinda's 11th loan with [field partner] MFP. She belongs to a small group of 3 borrowers, who are all very responsible women, and Hermelinda is proud to work with the others. By the same token, she promises to make her repayments on time. On obtaining the loan, Hermelinda will buy a printer, and continue her work with the same drive to improve.

loans.use: Comprar una impresora.

loans.name: Miss Group

texts.es:
El grupo Miss está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellos son Alcira R., Erika  S. y Luvis Enrique C.. La coordinadora es la señora R. quien desde hace cinco años vende frutas, verduras y pollo.
Ella con el crédito comprar pollo (piernas, alas, pechuga, etc.) 
S. se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y C. vende frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The Miss Group consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising individuals: Alcira R., Erika S., and Luvis Enrique C.. The group coordinator is Sra. R., who has been selling fruits, vegetables, and chicken for five years.

She will use her loan to buy chicken (legs, wings, breasts, and other parts).

Sra. S. sells used clothing. Sr. C. has been selling fruits and vegetables for seven years.

loans.use: Purchase chicken to sell

loans.name: Samaritano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Samaritano está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellos son Virginia R., Dina Arelys López y Osmar Antonio Alegría. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora R. quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales de pollo y cerdo.
Ella con el préstamo invertirá en maíz, cerdo y pollo. 
López comercializa frutas y verduras y Alegría tiene una pequeña pulpería, ellos invertirá el crédito en productos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The group “Samaritano” (Samaritan) consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising individuals:  Virginia R., Dina Arelys López, and Osmar Antonio Alegría.  The group coordinator is Sra. R., who prepares and sells Nicaraguan tamales containing chicken and pork.

She will use her loan to invest in corn, pork, and chicken.

Sra. López sells fruits and vegetables, while Sr. Alegría manages a small grocery store.  They will invest their loans in products to restock their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase corn, pork, and chicken

loans.name: Maryury Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maryury, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas desea diversificar y no vender solamente un producto. Maryury nos cuenta, que gracias a los esfuerzos y al apoyo que siempre le ha brindado Fundación León 2000 y Kiva cuenta con este medio para realzar las compras de sus productos. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.  Ella sueña siempre tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado, que brinde estabilidad económica a ella y su familia en general.
texts.en:
Sra. Maryury sells clothes. She wants to increase her sales, so she does everything she can to diversify her inventory and not sell just one product. Maryury says that she is grateful for all of the efforts and the support that Fundación León 2000 and Kiva have always given her so that she can acquire her products.

She is currently requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise. Maryury has always dreamed of having a large store in the market, which would provide financial stability for herself and her family.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire merchandise

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La unión hace la Fuerza está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Mayra P., Mercedes L. y Victoria V.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora P.  realiza y vende delantales y gabachas desde hace varios años.
Ella con el crédito comprara telas, cintas, hilos entre otros materiales que necesita.
Mientras L. tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular a base de comida frita y Victoria Vásquez se dedica al comercio de productos varios como pulseras, ropa, collares etc.
texts.en:
The group “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Unity is Strength) consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising women: Mayra P., Mercedes L., and Victoria V.. The group coordinator is Sra. P., who has been producing and selling aprons and smocks for several years.

She will use her loan to buy fabrics, ribbons, thread, and other materials that she needs.

Sra. L. manages a “fritanga”, a popular type of restaurant that sells fried food. Victoria Vásquez is a merchant who sells various products such as bracelets, clothes, necklaces, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, ribbons, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Erick Jarling

texts.es: El señor Erick Jarling Sánchez, habita en el municipio de la Concepción, junto a su esposa la cual labora como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos tienen un hijos de dos años que necesita de su cuidado y apoyo , don Erick  sueña en un futuro  poder comprar un camioneta aunque sea de segunda mano para no estar pagando cada vez que sale la producción de pitahaya ; ya que esto le genera costo a él , el señor tiene doce años trabajando el cultivo y la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas y robo del mismo producto , ya que cuando realizo la venta logro pagar su crédito en tiempo y forma , pero no logro comprar los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para que la pitahaya tengan un buen tamaño , color y sabor  . Necesita que se le apoye para poder realizar la compra de estos productos para inducir la planta.
texts.en:
Mr. Erick Jarling Sánchez lives in the town of Concepción with his wife who works as a housecleaner in order to help him cover household expenses.  They have a two-year son who needs their care and support.

Erick dreams of being able to buy a second-hand truck in the future so he doesn't have to rent one every time he harvests pitahaya (cactus fruit), which generates considerable cost for him.  He has been growing his crop for over 12 years and the most significant difficulties he has run into are plagues and theft.

He has been able to pay back his loan on time but was unable to buy fertilizer and other necessary supplies to grow the pitahaya to proper size, color and flavor.  He is in need of financing in order to buy these products and begin planting.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y credo que se comercializa por lo general los fines de semana. Además realiza pinolillo bebida típica hecha con maíz y cacao.
Ella con el crédito comprara materia prima para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman who makes Nicaraguan tamales, a traditional dish made of corn and pork.  She usually sells on the weekends.  In addition, she produces “pinolillo”, a traditional beverage made of corn and cacao.

Patricia is requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase pork, corn, potatoes, tomatoes, and other supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 47 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su pareja, que es fabricante de baterías  y sus dos hijos; y solo se hace cargo de la menor pues el mayor trabaja y se mantiene; juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Desde hace tres años, esta emprendedora mujer decidió instalar en su casa el peculiar negocio de alquiler de lavadoras a sus vecinos, y esta muy satisfecha pues el negocio le genera regulares ganancias pues no tiene competencia. No se arrepiente de invertir la liquidación que obtuvo como trabajadora de una empresa para empezar con este trabajo que le permite criar con tranquilidad a sus hijos.  Aunque el trabajo es algo difícil ella afirma convencida que nada es fácil en la vida y lo mejor se logra con mucho sacrificio; además la pequeña carretilla que tiene le facilita el traslado, de las cinco lavadoras que ostenta, hasta las casas de sus clientes. Además paralelamente a esta labor también se desempeña como criadora de cuyes de buena raza; y  ha instalado una gran jaula en el patio de su casa, y no solo los comercializa si no que también prepara en actividades que ella misma realiza. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio de lavado de autos. 

María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de una lavadora más pues quiere mejorar su negocio, además desea progresar y emprender un nuevo negocio.  

Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
María, age 47, lives in her own home with her partner, who manufactures batteries, and their two children. She takes care of the younger child, since the older one works and is self-reliant. Each day María and her family strive to move forward together.

Three years ago, this enterprising woman decided to start a business from her home renting out washing machines to her neighbors. María is very satisfied with her business because it generates steady income and does not face any competition. She has no regrets investing her severance pay from her job working for a company. By starting this business, she is able to take care of her children peacefully. Although the work is difficult, María says that nothing is easy in life and the best things are only achieved through great sacrifice. However, the small hand truck that she owns makes it easier to deliver the five washing machines in her inventory to the homes of her customers. In addition to this business, María raises guinea pigs of excellent breed. She has a large cage set up in the patio of her house. Not only does she sell her products, but she spends time preparing her activities in advance. In the future, she hopes to start a car wash business.

María plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of another washing machine to improve her business. She wants to keep progressing so that she can start a new business.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad in the eyes of those who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress.

loans.use: Purchase another washing machine for her rental business

loans.name: Verónica Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señorita. Verónica A. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector  Loma de la Cruz en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad posee una belleza natural y arquitectónica, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señorita. Verónica es soltera, tiene 26 años de edad y es madre de un un niño de 4 años de edad, vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, sus padres se dedican al comercio de ganado y con su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señorita. Verónica se dedica a la venta de joyas goldfiel, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, sus productos lo vende recorriendo por la ciudad, sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de más joyas para incrementar mas su negocio. Su meta es tener un almacén  de venta de joyas.
texts.en:
Srta. Verónica A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia”. She lives in the Loma De La Cruz sector of the city of Cuenca. This city possesses both natural and architectural beauty. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. The great food captivates the palates of both locals and foreigners.

Srta. Verónica is 26 years old, single, and the mother of a four year old son. She lives with her parents who share in the household expenses. Her parents are livestock traders who were able to build their own home as a result of their work.

Srta. Verónica has been selling the Goldfield line of jewelry for the past five years. She sells her products by traveling througout the city. Verónica works Sunday to Sunday, but without a set schedule.

She is receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank. Verónica will invest in the purchase of more jewelry so that she can increase her business even more. Her goal is to open a shop where she can sell jewelry.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Aracely Sulay

texts.es:
La Señora Aracely A. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad posee  una gran belleza natural y arquitectónica, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señora. Aracely tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Aracely se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la venta de productos Yanbal, esta actividad  la realiza hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos de la marca Yanbal. Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Aracely A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia”. She lives in the Uncovia sector of the city of Cuenca. This city possesses both natural and architectural beauty. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. The great food captivates the palates of both locals and foreigners.

Sra. Aracely is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 14 and 9). The older child is a high school student while the younger one attends school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard. They do not own a home, so they currently live in a rental property.

Doña Aracely is devoted to the household duties and selling Yanbal products. She has been in this business for three years and works Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule.

Aracely is receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of more cosmetics from the Yanbal line. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase Yanbal cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Aura Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. Aura A. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad posee una gran belleza natural y arquitectónica, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Aura vive en unión libre, tiene 32 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos de 15, 7 y 5 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Aura es comerciante de ropa, artículos de plástico y cosméticos de la marca  Esika, vende sus productos todos los días y sin ningún horario fijo.

Se encuentra en su cuarto de crédito que se encuentra en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería para continuar con sus negocios. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia”. She lives in the Uncovia sector of the city of Cuenca. This city possesses both natural and architectural beauty. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. The great food captivates the palates of both locals and foreigners.

Sra. Aura is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 15, 7, and 5). The oldest child is a high school student while the two younger ones attend school in the city. Her husband works as an employee for a private business. They do not own a home, so they currently live in a rental property.

Doña Aura is a merchant who sells clothing, plastic goods, and cosmetics from the Esika line. She sells her products every day, but does not work on a set schedule.

Aura is receiving her fourth loan from the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of more merchandise to continue her businesses. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, plastic goods, and cosmetics

loans.name: Yoconda Monserrate

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Yoconda, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 11, 8 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores ya están en colegio y el de 8 años en escuela. Su esposo es técnico en refrigeración.

Se dedica al comercio vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 recorre con sus productos por su barrio y también vende en el campo donde vive la mamá, deja a crédito y  cobra en dos pagos cada quince días, o por semana de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes,  nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que antes vendía cosméticos Avon pero se retiro de eso porque tuvo problemas con su embarazo y después mejor se dedico a la venta de ropa, su mercadería la  compra en Guayaquil porque allá es más barato.
 
Este crédito es justamente para ir a Guayaquil a comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas de vestir. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro  ciclos y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan para sacar su negocio adelante. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Chicas Fresas” meets every fifteen days in the San Pablo neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is one of the poorest neighborhoods in the city.

It is here one can find Sra. Yoconda. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children (ages 16, 11, 8, and 3) that resulted from her relationship. Her husband works as refrigeration technician.

Yoconda sells all types of clothing as a door-to-door saleswoman. She begins her work every day at 8:30am by traveling through her neighborhood with her products. Yocanda also sells in the neighborhood where her mother lives. She extends credit and collects payment in two installments every fifteen days or weekly based on the needs of her customers. Yoconda says she has been in this business for two years. She previously sold Avon cosmetics, but quit because she experienced problems with her pregnancy. Afterwards she decided to sell clothing. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil because the prices are cheaper there.

This loan will be used on her next trip to Guayaquil in order to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and other types of garments. Yoconda has participated in four loan cycles with her Communal Bank. She likes being given the opportunity to move her business forward. Her dreams include having her own warehouse.

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, blouses, and other types of garments

loans.name: Zoila Ramona

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Zoila, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores de adad y tres de 15, 13 y 7  años los mismos que estudian uno de los mayores en universidad las dos chichas en colegio y el menor en escuela.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo, vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. allí mismo tiene un bazar y un bar que lo abre solo en temporada de clases ya que está cerca de un colegio. En sus diversas actividades  trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 23h00, sus hijos  le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, artículos de bazar entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Chicas Fresas” (Uptown Posh Girls) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s San Pablo neighborhood, a crowded, marginal urban zone in the city.  The members are very kind and hard working.

We found Zoila, 40, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has five children, two adults and three who are 15, 13 and 7 years of age and in school. One is in university, the two girls are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.

She has a grocery store where she sells foodstuffs, rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.  She also has a kitchen supplies store and snack bar that she only opens during the school year since it’s near a school.  She works every day from 6am until 11pm at her various activities.  Her children help her.  She buys her products in downtown Portoviejo although most of her stock is delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and kitchen supplies, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because she’s made many friends in the group.  Her goals are to continue forward with the loan and that the store grows more every day.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en:
Darisuren, 48, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a nomadic tent, on a small plot of land that was loaned to them by the government. She wants to own her own land and build a house where they can have a comfortable life.

Darisuren has made felt-related crafts since 2008, after attending a vocational school.  As an experienced tailor, her business is stable and she has many customers.  She is a hard worker with a lot of initiative.  Darisuren wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of 1,350,000 MNT to purchase more felt and other materials. 

Her husband has worked as a school janitor since 2009.  Her older son is employed by a beverage company and her younger son attends school.

loans.use: To purchase more felt and useful materials

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
El señor José Alberto  R. está solicitando este préstamo para poder construir una barda alrededor de su casa ya que vive en una área que aun no esta tan poblada y el esta preocupado por la seguridad de su familia. Básicamente utilizara este crédito para contratar a la persona que la construya así como para pagar el material que se utilizara.  Debido a que él y su esposa la Sra. Erika Amelia Hernández trabajan será más cómodo pagar este crédito, porque los dos desean tener un mejor patrimonio que ofrecerles a sus hijos así como brindarles seguridad y comodidad.
El planea pagar este crédito con sus ingresos de guardia en el cual ya tiene una antigüedad de dos años.
texts.en: Señor José Alberto R. is requesting this loan so that he can build a fence around his house.   He lives in a sparsely populated area and he is worried about the safety of his family.  He will use the money to hire someone to build it and to pay for the materials. Because he and his wife, Señora Erika Amelia Hernández, both work, it will be easier for them to pay off the loan.  They both want to be able to offer their children a better inheritance as well as safety and comfort.  He plans to make his payments with his income as a guard, a job he has had for two years.

loans.use: To build a fence

loans.name: Medardo Daniel

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

Don Medardo  es socio fundador del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y por que las compañeras del grupo son muy responsables. Tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aun viven con ellos, la menor de sus hijas estudia en  Universidad y la mayor es maestra. Su esposa  es ama de casa.

Tiene un puesto en el mercado en el cual vende mariscos, son varios años que lleva en su negocio y trabaja todos los días parar sacar a su familia adelante y  darles a sus hijos una buena educación para su futuro. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 13h00, el marisco los compran en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado para la venta diaria. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir trabajando para  darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the community of San Pablo in the city of Portoviejo the communal bank named Chicas Fresas meets every two weeks.  It is a highly populated suburban region of the city and the members are very kind and hardworking individuals.

Medardo is a founding member of the communal bank and he likes to be a member because interest is lower than other loan institutions and because the members of the group are very responsible. He is 56 years old, married, and he has children who are grown but they still live with them. The youngest daughter is in university and the eldest is a teacher. His wife is a housewife. 

He has a stand in the market from where he sells seafood. He has been in business for many years, working every day to provide for his family and to give his children a good education for the future. He works every day from 6am to 1pm. He buys the seafood in the same market from the wholesalers.

This loan will be used to purchase fish for daily sales. His dream is to enjoy good health and to keep working in order to provide his family with the best.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Evelin Jasmin

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

La señora Evelin es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene  28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de 10 y tres años de edad, el mayor esta en el último año de escuela. Su esposo es maestro.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, también vende artículos para el hogar a través del sistema de cartillas, esto es por pedidos que le realizan los clientes por anticipado. Trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas al dia, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y artículos para el hogar. Sus sueños son tener un buen trabajo y tener un bazar en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “Chicas Fresas” (Uptown Posh Girls) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s San Pablo neighborhood, a crowded, marginal urban zone in the city.  The members are very kind and hard working.

Evelin, 28, is a founding member of the communal bank; she’s its Secretary and likes it because of the ease in obtaining loans.  She’s married and has two children who are 10 and 3 years of age; the oldest is in the last year of elementary school.  Her husband’s a Teacher.

She sells all kinds of clothes door to door.  She also sells items using the “cartillas” system (similar to lay-away; customer signs up for an item and makes small payments toward it until payment is complete and item is handed over) for items that are ordered ahead of time.  She works every day for about five hours daily.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil every two weeks or once a month depending on need to buy her merchandise.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing and articles for the home.  Her dream is to have a good job and a general store downtown.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothes and articles for the home.

loans.name: Jorge Egas

texts.es:
Jorge de 43 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene un negocio de cerrajería. Comenzó aprender como ayudante en un taller desde los 18 años. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que tiene mucha clientela porque lo conocen por el sector donde vive como el cerrajero. Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo hierro y así hacer mas puertas, ventanas, ensamblados etc. En el futuro quiere tener mejor ubicado el local.
texts.en:
Jorge is 43 years old and he is a hardworking man. He has a blacksmith business. He started out learning as an apprentice in a shop when he was 18 years old. 

He has great aspirations for his business especially because he has many clients that know him as a blacksmith in the sector where he lives. With his loan he wants to purchase steel to make doors, windows, and assemblages in order to keep up his business. In the future he wants to have his business in a better location.

loans.use: To purchase steel.

loans.name: Nora Lucia

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nora, tiene 61 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos pero uno falleció hace algún tiempo atrás, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad  e independientes. El marido es mecánico automotriz. 
Tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende papel higiénico, pastillas, alcohol, algodón, artículos de higiene personal entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que lleva en su pequeño negocio ya por seis años y que gracias a Dios le ha servido para poder ganarse el sustento diario. Sus productos los compra en el centro de la ciudad en una distribuidora.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de sus productos y así poder seguir ganándose la vida decentemente. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por la unión que hay en el grupo y como las dirige la promotora. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener salud que es muy importante.
texts.en:
In the community of San Pablo of the city of Portoviejo the communal bank named Chicas Fresas meets every two weeks. It is a highly populated suburban region of the city and the members are very kind and hardworking. 

Here we meet Nora. She is 61 years old and she is married common-law. She has six children, although one passed away some time ago. All of her children are adults and independent. Her husband is an automotive mechanic.

She has a small business located in his house from where she sells bathroom tissue, medicines, rubbing alcohol, cotton, personal hygiene products and other items. She works every day from 8am to 8pm. She says that she has had her business for six years and thank god because it has been a way to earn a daily living. She buys her products in the downtown area of the city from a distributor.

This loan will be used to purchase more products to continue to earn a daily living. This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank and she appreciates the unity of the group and how the facilitator supports them. Her dream is to keep up her business and to enjoy good health, which is very important.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business buying and selling firewood/charcoal. Her husband Paulino, who is 58 years old, works as a construction worker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 18 and 36 years old. Three of their children have their own families and one has her own job and helps her parents run the business. Lydia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lydia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, to buy firewood and charcoal for resale so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Lydia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

In the accompanying photo, Lydia poses with the stacks of firewood that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and charcoal to resell

loans.name: Angela Divina

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la tesorera del mismo y le gusta por la ayudad que le han dado para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 55 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero  de una relación que tuvo hace tiempo tiene dos  hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos viven con ella.

Tiene un bazar y papelería en su casa en el cual vende artículos para regalos y todo en útiles escolares, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta la noche ya que como su negocio lo tiene en su casa no se le hace incomodo atender hasta tarde, ya son  tres años que ella se dedica a esta actividad  y le a permitido ganarse la vida honradamente, está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir ya que a través de los créditos ella puede financiar su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar útiles escolares y artículos de bazar. Sus metas son seguir adelante y seguir en su negocio  muchos años más.
texts.en:
In the community of San Pablo of the city of Portoviejo the communal bank named Chicas Fresas meets every two weeks. It is a highly populated suburban region of the city and the members are very kind and hardworking. 

Angela is a founding member of the communal bank and she is the treasurer of the group. She appreciates the bank for the support they have given her in making her business a success. She is 55 years old and she is single. But she has two children from a previous relationship. They are both adults but one still lives with her.

She has a general merchandise and office supplies store. She sells gift items and all kinds of school supplies. She works every day from 7am until night. Her business is located in her house so she doesn’t find it inconvenient to work late. She has had her business for three years and through it she has earned an honest living. She is very thankful to Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) because it was with those loans that she was able to finance her business. 

This loan will be used to purchase school supplies and general merchandise. Her goal is to come out ahead and to keep her business running for many more years to come.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and general merchandise.

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Ma. Editha is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by selling charcoal and operating a general store. Her husband Diocelindo, who is 48 years old, works as a construction worker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are between 18 and 24 years old. Ma. Editha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Editha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to buy a stock of charcoal and goods for the store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Ma. Editha is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman who lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Salvador, Jr., who is 47 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 20 and 24 years old. Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,500 to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for her children’s education and for better living conditions. Helen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan L. is 52 years old, divorced, and has one adult child.  She resides in Phnom Penh City. She has been in the farming business since 1999 and earns approximately $3 a day to use for her daily expenses. Chan L. currently lives with her married daughter who is a sewing worker; her son-in-law is an ice seller. She is concerned that she often relies on her children for support. Her son-in-law intends to invest more capital in his ice business. Therefore, Chan L. is requesting a loan to help her son-in-law buy more ice to sell to his regular customers.

loans.use: To purchase ice

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S. (in the photo) and her husband, Vuthy Chak, live on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have four sons and three daughters  – three of them are married, one is a teacher, one has full-time employment and the others are in school.  

Saroeun is a weaver. Her husband is a teacher. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a bakery and buying and selling dried fish. Her husband Narsiso is 59 years old. They have five children who are 25 to 33 years old. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 26,000 as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future family and business needs. Teresita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Vannoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannoeun P. is 38 years old and her husband, Mr. Bunly Ouch, is 48 years old.  They have been married since 1992 and have three children – one son and two daughters, all of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One about 18 kilometers from Phnom P. City. 

Mrs.Vannoeun P. is a scarf weaver. Her husband is a soldier. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase cotton thread for her business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread for scarf weaving business

loans.name: Sengthai

texts.en:
Mr. Sengthai S. and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Yun, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have two children. 

Mr. Sengthai S. used to drive a motor taxi. In November 2009, he applied for a Kiva loan to purchase a Tuk Tuk. But, now his Tuk Tuk is old and is broken in some parts, so he is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase new Tuk Tuk to replace the old one. Sengthai will then be able to continue his Tuk Tuk business. 

Photo: Mr. Sengthai S. and his wife

loans.use: To replace his Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun Y. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sambath Sin, live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have a young daughter. 

Bunthoeun is a mason, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He asked for a Kiva loan to build his house. He now hopes to fill the land and pour the concrete foundation. That’s why he has applied for a second loan of $ 1,200.

loans.use: To fill the land and pour foundation for home

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mr. Vanna S. is 53 and his wife, Mrs. Sokun Man, is 51 years old.  They live in a village across the Mekong River, about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have seven children – five sons and two daughters. Five are married, four live outside the family home, one has full-time employment and another one is in school. 

Vanna is a construction contractor. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase additional construction materials for his business. 

Mr. Vanna S. and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokea M. and her husband, Mr. Sorphea Srun, live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children – two sons and one daughter.  All of their children attend school. 

Sokea is a vegetable farmer and raises pigs at home. Her husband assists her in the business. Sokea had asked for a Kiva loan once before.  She hopes to continue her business raising pigs, hence she is asking for another loan of $700 to purchase more piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Somphoas

texts.en:
Mrs. Somphoas V. is 33 years old and her husband, Mr. Chanveasna Mut, is 36 years old.  They have been married since 1994 and have three children  – two sons and one daughter.  Two of them are in school and one is still too young for school. The family lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Somphoas stays at home and does housework. Their main source of income is her husband’s salary.  He is a journalist. Somphoas is asking for a loan of $1,000 to fill in the land around her house and to connect her house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: To fill in land around house, and connect to electricity

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly K. is 23 years old and her husband, Mr. Samnang Un, is 29 years old.  They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Somaly sells Nom Pum in her village. Nom Pum is a kind of Cambodian cake. Her husband is both a lotus farmer and a fisherman. She assists him in the farming business when she is free.

Somaly is asking for her first loan of $700 to help with her husband’s farming and to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: To farm and buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy N. is 41 years old.  He is a widower and has only one daughter. He lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chanthy sells flowers and bananas at the market. He grows the flowers himself and buys banana from fellow villagers to resell. His daughter assists him  in the business. 

Chanty is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to build a new house to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house to live in

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a motorcycle repair shop and a food production sales business. Her husband Nestor, who is 49 years old, works as a Bantay Dagat coast guard to earn his living. They have 10 children who are between 4 and 25 years old. Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy additional tools and equipment for her shop so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of her business. Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional tools and equipment for her repair shop

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon San and her husband, Mr. Phin Mao, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children – three sons and two daughters. Mr. Phin Mao is a flower farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is free. 

Yon previously ran a beauty business from home, but she transferred the business to her daughters.  She now assists her husband in the farming business.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fishing and livestock. Her husband Eduardo, who is 48 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have five children who are between 5 and 16 years old. Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alicia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to use as additional capital for maintenance of her fish ponds so that she can continue to save up for her children’s education & house improvements. Alicia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Mrs. Loun C., 46, is single. She lives with her sister along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Loun is a farmer. She grows vegetables on her farmland in the village where she lives. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to build a shelter to shade her vegetables from sunlight.

loans.use: To build shade shelter for vegetables

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthan O., 53, is a widow with five children – four sons and one daughter. Her four sons work for a publishing shop and her daughter is a cleaner at a hotel in Phnom Penh City. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.   Chanthan is a weaver. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for children to ride to work

loans.name: Chhavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhavy D. (was in the photo) is 44 years old and her husband, Mr. Punleu Sun, is 39 years old.  They sell silk and cotton products. They buy them from weavers in the village and transport them to sell in other villages and districts. This couple is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase more silk and cotton fabrics for resale.
