They have been married since 1999 and have four children – one son and three daughters, all of them are in school.

loans.use: To purchase silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating fishing and fish vending businesses. Her husband Benito, who is 45 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 15 and 24 years old. Isabelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Isabelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for education and home repairs. Isabelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San K. and her husband, Mr. Phat Phoung, have been married since 1987.  They have five children – three sons and two daughters. They are living in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

San is a vegetable farmer. Her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for farm

loans.name: Miurel Karina

texts.es:
Miurel C.  de 22 años de edad soltera, labora para El Hospital Auncion de Juigalpa como despachadora de la Farmacia desde hace dos años y medio, es una persona responsable, honestas y dedicada. 
Solicita el apoyo de Kiva, para   ampliar su casa  construccion de un muro costado oeste que es una parte del terreno que se encuentra sin construir aproximadamente 1/2 metro, ademas desea cambiar parte del techo de la casa antes que entre el invierno, agracede mucho a Kiva ya que con el credito anterior pudo construir un porche el cual le da realce a su casa de habitacion.  

Su mayor sueño es terminar de realizar las mejoras que le hacen falta a la construccion de la casa en la cual habita junto a su mama y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miurel C. is 22 years old, single and works at the Asuncion de Juigalpa Hospital as a pharmacy despatch clerk.  She has been working there for two and a half years and is very responsible, honest and dedicated.

She plans to use the Kiva loan to expand her house by building a wall along the west side on 1/2 meter of unbuilt land.  She also wants to change part of the roof before winter sets in.  She is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan she used to build a porch to enhance the look of her house.

Her main goal is to finish the home improvements being made throughout the house where she lives with her mother so she can give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To build a wall and change the roof of her house

loans.name: Rufio

texts.en:
Rufio is a married man who lives in Bago, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by operating three business ventures: pig-fattening, meat-vending and farming. His wife Edna, who is 51 years old, works as a teacher to earn her living and helps in her husband's business activities. They have three children who are between 20 and  26 years old. Rufio joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rufio has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for his 11th loan, he is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase feed, hogs & fertilizers so that he can to save up for his children's education and family needs. Rufio is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase feed, hogs & fertilizer

loans.name: Luiz Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 59 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa ella cuida a los niños cuando el esta trabajando y de esta manera se apoyan mutuamente, tiene 2 hijos, labora para Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace 14 años como policia Municipal.    
Solicita este financiamiento con  el apoyo de Kiva a quien agradece mucho por ayuarlo de esta menera; el objetivo del credito es mejorar la casa reparacion del techo y repellar las paredes de la casa.  
Su mayor sueño es terminar de realizar todas las mejoras a la casa para que su familia tenga un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Luis is 59 years old and his wife is a homemaker who takes care of their children while he is working at the Town Hall in Juigalpa.  He has been employed there as a municipal policeman for 14 years.  They have two children.

He is requesting financial support from Kiva and is very grateful for this help.  His goal is to make home improvements by repairing the roof and water-proofing the walls of his house.

His dream is to finish all the improvements so his family can live in a more dignified environment.

loans.use: To make home improvements

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Mrs. Rany T. is 24 years old and her husband, Mr. Chabb Lun, is 26 years old.  They have been married since 2009 and have no children yet. A young nephew (pictured with Rany) is living with them. They live in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Rany and her husband are garment factory workers.  Her mother has a clothes selling business.  She is requesting a loan of $600 to help her mother expand that business by buying clothes for resale.

loans.use: To help her mother expand her clothes selling business

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 25-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a bakery and a cosmetics sales business.  She lives in the municipality of Rizal, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loan from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her bakery and cosmetics sales businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,700. Melody is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund the operation of her businesses. This will be her second loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melody aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom A. is 29 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophal Pheap, is 28 years old.  They live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2005 and have two young daughters.  

Mom stays at home and takes care of her daughters. The main source of income for her family is her husband’s salary, who works as a driver for a company.

Mom is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to build a kitchen and a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To build a kitchen and a restroom for family use

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal G.  de 43 años de edad es casado, labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde 9 años como maestro de obra, tiene 1 hijos el cual se encuentra estudiando actualmente el 3er año de secundaria. 
Necesita este financiamiento con el objetivo de cambiar el techo, embarldosar ya que la casa es de tierra, y pintar el frente y la sala de su casa, esta muy agradecido con el apoyo de Kiva con financiamiento, pues por medio de estos ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.  
Sueña con ponerle ceramica a toda la casa para asi brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia y  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vidal G. is 43 years old and married.  For nine years he has worked as a building foreman for the city hall of Juigalpa.  He has one son who is currently in third year of secondary school.

He needs financing in order to change the roof of his house as well as put in flooring and paint the outside and living room.  He is very grateful to Kiva for the loan which will enable him to make these improvements little by little.

His dream is to put ceramic tile on the house for family safety purposes and to improve living conditions.

loans.use: To make home improvements

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng K. is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Loemkhorn Touch, is 45 years old.  They have been married since 1989 and have five children  – two sons and three daughters. The family lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Heng K. and her husband are farmers. Mr. Loemkhorn Touch also does construction work when he is free. They are in the process of building new house to live in, but it is not yet finished. Hence she is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to finish building their house.

loans.use: To finish house building

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Mrs. Soksan P. and her husband, Mr. Chheang Chhum, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Soksan is a weaver. Her husband has just started a new business, he is a construction worker. 

Soksan hopes to supplement their income by starting a new business raising pigs. She will be able to earn extra income from selling the pigs when they grow big enough. Hence she is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Hermes Gregorio

texts.es:
Herme Gregorio  de 58 años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, es una persona respondable, humilde y lo mas importante es un trabajador permanente; labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde  hace  diecisiete años actualmente se desempeña como operario de limpieza, ha venido mejorando su vivienda con creditos mediante afodenic.  

Solicita la ayuda de Kiva ya que pretende repellar las paredes internas de su casa y la construccion de un cuarto de  4 mtros x 4mtrs y asi tener mas comodidad para su familia. 

Su mayor sueño es dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos que actualmente es la casa con buenas mejoras y que no les falte el pan de cada dia
texts.en:
Herme Gregorio is 58 years old and has two adult children.  He is a modest, responsible person who believes a permanent job is the most important thing in life.  He has worked for the City Hall of Juigalpa for 17 years as a janitor.  He's been able to make home improvements with the loans he's received through Afodenic.

He is requesting support from Kiva to water-proof the inside walls of his house and to build a 4 meter x 4 meter room so his family lives more comfortably.

His dream is for his children to receive a good inheritance, meaning the house with significant improvements, and food on the table everyday.

loans.use: To make home improvements; water-proof the inside walls

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam D. and her husband, Mr. Kem Sam, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1979 and have seven sons and two daughters. Four are married and live outside the family home, one is a construction worker, one has full-time employment and the others are garment factory workers.

Seam and her husband produce rice wine and raise pigs. She is also a weaver. Seam has previously applied for a Kiva loan.  She now is requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her son, who has full-time employment, to get work.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike for son to go to work

loans.name: Ma. Magadalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magadalena is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  videoke and a general store. Her husband Pedro, who is 40 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 11 children who are between 1 and 21 years old. Ma. Magadalena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Magadalena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,600 uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital for business and buy stocks for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ma. Magadalena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. Lucia planted bananas on her land and now grows and sells banana cue (caramelized fried bananas) in her neighborhood. She also makes other delicacies like rice cakes. Aside from selling food, she also grows pigs in her backyard. She and her husband also decided to invest in a billiard hall. Lucia works hard and hopes to have a stable business.

Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP  to invest in expanding her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna P. (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Buntit Roath, is a farmer. They have been married since 1993 and have one daughter. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Vanna is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Sothorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothorng C. is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Kunthea Chuy, is 34 years old.  They have been married since 2004 and have three children  – one son and two daughters, all of them are still young. The family lives about 16 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Sothorng C. is a garment factory worker. She is asking for first loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives (make new roof).

loans.use: To make new roof for house

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa T. H. is a 36-year-old widow  with 2 children.  For three years, she has been running a shop that sells biscuits and paper products for funeral rites and holiday celebrations (a traditional Vietnamese business).  Her shop is very crowded with customers, especially in the July with the lunar calendar events. Every month, her shop generates 3,500,000 VND in profit, which she uses to manage her family's expenses and pay school fees for her children.  

With the loans from our credit program since 2006, Hoa T. H. has invested effectively in expanding her business.  She is now requesting 8,066,000 VND to buy more sweets and biscuits to meet the demands of her customers.

Hoai T. D. is 38 years old. She is running a tailor shop.  She is in need of 8,066,000 VND  to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy sweet and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Nazhipbek

texts.en:
Nazhipbek M. is married and has three children. He was born in Kum-Aryk village in a large family and spent most of his time helping his parents in the household, pasturing cattle in the mountainous areas with native grasses, and helping his mother with milking the cows. 

After graduating from secondary school, Nazhipbek devoted his life to breeding animals. He stayed with his parents in his native village and takes care of them. Gaining a wide experience in this activity, the start up of his own business was successful. With the initial capital of 15,000 KGS, he managed to earn about 2,500 KGS each month. 

Taking into account that farming is the major means of subsistence for Nazhipbek’s family and his elderly parents, he spends a lot of time improving his farm. Being a persistent and hard-working man, he has developed his farm and presently has three milk cows and twenty sheep.  With the revenues from this activity, Nazhipbek  was able to pay for the education of his elder children, who study in the capital of Bishkek.  


Nazhipbek plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden his livestock business. In the future, he dreams of building a big house for his children and grandchildren. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  soft drinks retailing, motorcycle transport and farming. Her husband Fermin, who is 54 years old, works as a miner to earn his living.  They have 15 children who are between 18 and 42 years old. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy additional goods for her business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Merlinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Mrs. Khan T., 61, has been married since 1976 and has 8 children  – 6 sons and 2 daughters. Four are married, two are garment factory workers, one assists his parents in the business, and another one is in school. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Khan and her husband are lotus farmers. They want to start a new business raising fish to generate more income to better support their family. Hence Khan is asking for her first loan of $1,000.  She will also use a part of the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her lotus farm.

loans.use: To start fish raising business and maintain lotus farm

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en:
Griselda is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and buying and selling charcoal. Her husband Gerardo, who is 45 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living.  They have two children who are 14 and 21 years old. Griselda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Griselda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and improvement of her business. Griselda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy H., 58, is a widow with five children – three sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a soldier, two assist their mother in the business, and one is a cell phone vendor. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chanthy is a jasmine farmer. She hopes to supplement her income with a new business raising chickens, so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchasing chickens and chicken feed, and to build a chicken coop.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feeds, and build a chicken coop

loans.name: Koemleng

texts.en:
Mr. Koemleng P. is 53 years old.  He and his wife, Mrs. Ly Seang, live in a suburb approximately 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children – one son and two daughters. Two are in school and one is still too young for school.

Koemleng is a commissioner. He also rents space in his house to garment factory workers because his house is located near a garment factory. His wife is a garment factory worker at the site as well.

He is asking for his first loan of $500 to repair his house because it is broken down in some parts.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhim P. (in the photo with his young daughter) and his wife, Mrs. Sreypov Vun, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They just had a young son. 

Mr. Sokhim P. is a cell phone vendor.  He also repairs phones and install cell phone applications. His wife is a garment factory worker.  The couple also started a new business growing rice, hiring fellow villagers to do the work.

Sokhim is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a neighboring plot of land to expand his property.

loans.use: To purchase land

loans.name: Faamanu

texts.en:
Age:                            32
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      5
Business:                    Catching & selling farm-raised fish 
Loan purpose:              To purchase additional fish to raise
Weekly profit:               400 Samoan talas (WST)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                             1.5 out of 3
Level of Total Household Income:        1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.65 out of 3

F. owns and operates a business venture catching and selling farm-raised fish.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  F. needs a loan of 2000 WST to purchase additional fish to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

F. joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is F.'s 4th loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded South Pacific Business Development to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive updates on SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale up to 3--the higher the number, the better off the person.  The metrics are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

Children:                      5 (ages 6 - 21)
Business:                    Planting and harvesting taro for sale
Loan purpose:              To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise
Weekly profit:               450 Samoan talas (WST)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                             1.6 out of 3
Level of Total Household Income:        1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.65 out of 3

U. owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  U. needs a loan of 2500.00 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

In 2007, U. joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is U.'s 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en:
Sisi, 26, plants and harvests taro for sale.  Married with one child, she has two years of business experience.    Sisi needs a loan of $650 to purchase farm supplies and equipment.  This will be Sisi's second loan with SPBD.  She plans to use the profit from her business, averaging about $250 per week, to improve her family's living conditions.

Sisi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  

---------------------------------------------------

loans.use: Purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerelmaa is 40 years old and lives with her two daughters in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a plot of land that they own.  Her older daughter attends college while her younger daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Gerelmaa began selling a variety of wall coverings at a rented stall in a nearby market in 2007.  She wants to expand her business and increase her income.  She is a hardworking and polite person. Her older daughter helps her with the business. Gerelmaa is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more wall coverings for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more wall coverings

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a single woman who lives in the municipality of Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  motorcycle transport and farming. Avelina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Avelina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 to buy new tools and equipment to maintain her motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Avelina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a pig-fattening business.  She lives in the municipality of Oslob, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,500. Prudencia is now borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase feed for her pigs.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Prudencia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
N. Rose, 46, has seven years of experience in the pub business, in Kyefume-Mukono. The happily married mother of six says it's a business she began out of self-interest.  At her pub she sells all kinds of beverages both soft and hard. 

Rose belongs to the Zibula Atudde Women's group-Mukono.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more beverages to sell at her pub.  Two of the group members are not clearly seen in the photo, so they are marked them as un-pictured. These are Fred L. and Roseti N..

loans.use: The purchase of more beverages to resell at her pub

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia R. is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  vegetable and fruit vending and fish vending. Her husband Leonardo, who is 45 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 2 and 24 years old. Amelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy fruits and vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and the education of her children. Amelia R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a food production sales business, a sari-sari (general) store and a charcoal sales business. Her husband Nasir, who is 49 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 13 and 26 years old. Sitti Hawa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sitti Hawa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,500 to buy stocks for her store and food products so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of her business. Sitti Hawa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store and for her food production

loans.name: Jamalbubu

texts.en:
Jamalbubu T., 51, lives with her young son.  She was born in a large, low-income family where she spent most of her time helping her family with farming and looking after siblings.

In 1980, Jamalbubu got married and became the mother of three children. They moved to Kadzhysay, where she started to work as a pharmacist.  In 1993, her husband left her family and Jamalbubu became the only bread-winner for her children.  She had to find employment as a nurse with overtime hours.  But her wage was too low to cover her family’s expenses.  So she started a cattle breeding business. 

She has worked hard and managed to develop her farm with three cows, five bull-calves, one horse and eight other calves.  With her profit, Jamalbubu was able to hold her son’s wedding and give a good dowry to her daughter.
    
Jamalbubu plans to use the loan of 80,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing cattle.  With the revenues from this investment, she plans to hold her younger son’s wedding. 

------------------------------------------------------------------
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy meat for her business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Letecia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fishing business. In addition to her business, she serves as reflexologist/midwife in their community to earn additional income. Her husband Gil, who is 57 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 11 children who are between 16 and 36 years old. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy fishing net and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Wilma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Her husband Rufino, who is 48 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between 11 and 28 years old. Gilda is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  farming, livestock and a general store. Her husband Abraham, who is 53 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 23 and 32 years old. Gilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund the farm.  She makes an income from the sales of products from her farm.  She also has an inventory of livestock so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her business. loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma R. is from the village of Disimuray Cauayan City, Isabela.  She is 36 years old.  Norma is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Norma is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Norma owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Norma from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital.

With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gloria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her 22nd loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund the operation of her businesses so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and the education of her children. Gloria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fruits and vegetables vending business. She lives in Quezon, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fruits and vegetables vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,800. Genita is borrowing PHP 14,000 to fund the operation of her business. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Genita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is currently in the business of selling bread and bedsheets.  She is 31 years old and is married to a policeman.   They have 7 children, 5 of them are in school.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bread and bedsheets to sell.  Finda hopes to pay her children's school tuition with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more bread and bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Servillana

texts.en:
Servillana is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a firewood sales business. She lives in Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,500. Servillana is borrowing PHP 10,000 to so that she could stock up on more firewood to sell.  This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Servillana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

The accompanying photo shows Servillana posing beside a stack of firewood that she sells.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon, born in 1945, is a farmer who owns a rice field plot where she grows rice to earn a living. Currently, she wants to grow rice in the dry season but doesn’t have enough money to do this. She has therefore asked for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm workers in order to support her crop.

Mrs. Suon is a widow with one child, who helps her with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm workers.

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Mrs. Len, born in 1981, is married and she and her husband, Mr. Hul, are farmers who own a rice field plot where they grow rice to earn a living. Currently, they want to grow rice in the dry season but do not have enough money to do this. Mrs. Len is therefore asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop. Aside from their rice field, the couple also cultivate mushrooms and run a watermill to support their family. They have two children, who attend the local school. Mrs. Len is in this photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine P., 23, lives in Tsaghkunk village, an area of Sevan, with her husband, her two children, aged two and four, and her parents-in-law. She and her family have been running an animal breeding and land cultivation business since 2007. They raise cows, sheep and horses on their farm and grow oats to use as fodder for the animals.

Arpine is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy oat seeds and fodder for her farm animals. This is her second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy oat seeds and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Mr. Penh, born in 1983, is married. He and his wife, Mrs. Soknang, are farmers who own a rice field plot which they use to grow rice. Currently, they want to grow rice in the dry season but do not have enough money to do this. Mr. Penh has thus asked for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire laborers to support the farm crop. Aside from farming, the couple also earned a living by fishing in the local village. They have two children, who are currently too young for school. He appears in this photo with his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to support his farm crop.

loans.name: Nayanjin

texts.en:
Nayanjin, a 30-year-old hardworking young woman, is married and has a three-year-old son who attends kindergarten. The family lives in a ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband operate a business selling plastic barrels and containers at the local market called Khar Khorin.

Nayanjin started her business in 2005 with working capital of 200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). She sells plastic barrels and other kind of containers imported from Ereen or she buys products from a wholesale supplier at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Over the past few years, Nayanjin expanded her business into two stalls, one operated by her, the other by her husband, and today she has 3,000,000 MNT in working capital. With their business profits, they have managed to rebuild their stalls and buy a new yard for their father. They are also planning to buy a car this year.

Nayanjin is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase more products for spring and summer. She wants to establish an industry and grow to be a plastic barrel manufacturer in the future.

loans.use: To puchase plastic barrels for the upcoming seasons

loans.name: Chuk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuk V., born in 1954, sells groceries in her local village, earning a small income to support her family. Additionally, she sells fruit and, as sales are doing well, she wants to expand this business. For this reason, she has requested a loan to buy more fruit for resale. 

Her husband, Mr. Chea, is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to grow vegetables for a living. He also helps his wife with her business. The couple have six children: two are laborers and the others are students who also help in their parents' businesses. Mrs. V. appears in this photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina H. is a 26-year-old single lady who has been operating a retail shop in Takaye, Malindi for the last nine years. Out of this business Elvina earns a monthly income of about $188.

She has applied for a 3rd loan, after successfully paying her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan to add more stock to her retail shop, such as food stuff, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpaste and many other commodities. She also wants to renovate the business premises with a view of growing her business so as to serve more customers from her place of work.

Elvina hopes to plow her anticipated profits back into the business, and in the future to buy a piece of land to set up a larger shop.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to sell and to renovate her shop.

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma C. is from the village of Union Kalinga, Luna, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Norma is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Norma is married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $69 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. Pich, a married woman who was born in 1980, is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members.

She is a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mao, is a security guard in a private company. With their jobs they are able to earn small salaries to support their family living. This couple has a child who is attending a local school. 

Currently they do not have their own house, so they rent a house to live in. They want to build their own house, but they do not have enough money to build. Therefore, Pich would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a house.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a house.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc T. P. is a 57-year-old widow with two children. Every day she goes to the market to sell chickens for meat. Her business started when she received her first loan in 2006, and it has developed quickly and created a stable income for her to use in managing her life. 

Regarding her attitude to the micro-credit program, she is never late in repayment. Therefore, she hopes to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more chickens. Part of this amount will be used to improve her shop.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell and to improve her shop.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating an abaca weaving business and a general store. Her husband Nillard, who is 32 years old, works as a miner to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 3 and 9 years old. Divina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Divina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,400 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000  to buy abaca and stock for her store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of children. Divina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Fidelin joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fidelin has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy livestock supplies so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and renovation of her house. Fidelin is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase livestock supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan T. C. is 39 years old and has four small children. Being a farmer,her main activity to earn money to growing rice, and vegetable. All these agricultural products are use to meet her family food. To have daily income, she goes to some household to buy chicken eggs and sell them at local market. Her small business  provide a  considerable profit that helps her improve her living standard. Participate in credit project of Center of small enterprise development assistance in 2004, she  has been a good re payer. Now, she is requiring a new loan of 8,502,000  Vietnamese dong to buy more eggs to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Guayabal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old and the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresita is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $58 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher Y. operates motorcycle transport in Malindi town. He has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly profit of about $150. He is 50 years old, married, and the father of six children.

He has never borrowed from any other micro-finance institution (MFI), and he is applying for a third loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He plans to use the entire loan amount to service his motorbike and to set up a new business of selling charcoal and firewood for his wife.  

Christopher intends to use the anticipated profit to save for paying school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business, and in the future to venture into crop farming.

loans.use: to service his motorbike and to start a new business for his wife

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan. The members hope to increase their income to improve their familys' standard of living through these loans. Pen, who was born in 1965, is the group leader selected by the other members. 

Her husband, Phann, is an iron welder who is able to earn a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children who are all students.

Pen earns her living by tailoring at home. In order to support this business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a sewing machine for supporting her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for supporting her business activities.

loans.name: Ma. Aileen

texts.en:
Ma. Aileen is a widow who lives in the municipality of Carmen, Cebu . She earns her living by operating a general store. Ma.Aileen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma.Aileen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,500,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to buy products for the store to sell to customers. In addition to her business, she serves in her community as the Barangay Kagawad of their Barangay near to her home.  Ma. Aileen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members. Man was born in 1962 and is the group leader selected by the other members. 

Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has five children, two of are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other three are attending school in the local village. 

Man earns her living by making fish nets for selling. In order to support and expand her business, she is asking for a loan to buy more supplies for making fish nets to sell.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for making fish nets to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store, an electronic loading business and a welding shop. Her husband Ariel, who is 37 years old, works as a welder to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 3 and 10 years old. Mercy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her business. Mercy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Sokh's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan. The members selected Sokh to be the group leader. She is a married woman and was born in 1975. 

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice. She would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. The rest of the loan she would use to support her husband's business. Her husband, Roeun, is a cow middleman who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. 

This couple has four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the other three are students who also help with their mother's farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice.

loans.name: Soem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, comprised of four members, is led by Mrs. Soem, selected by the other members. Soem and her husband are farmers who own a field upon which they grow rice to earn a living. They also earn money by fishing in the local village.

This couple has four children, two of whom are iron welders, another a labourer, and the last one a student in a local school. One of her children has obtained a job in Thailand, so Soem is requesting a loan to obtain a passport for him.

loans.use: To obtain a passport for her child going to Thailand.

loans.name: Nayme

texts.en:
Nayme is a 27-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  sawali making (woven bamboo mats used for walls), fish vending and a general store.  She lives in the municipality of Quezon, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sawali making, fish vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,800. Nayme is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund the operation of her business.  This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nayme aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Celestine Nzasu

texts.en:
Celestine Nzasu N. has been selling second-hand clothes in Tala Kangundo for one year, earning a monthly profit of KES.12,000. She is 31 years old, married to N., and they have five school-going children.

Celestine, who has never borrowed from any other MFI, is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to it by a registered group member. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more used clothes to sell.  Celestine intends to save some of the anticipated profit and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her  business and in the future become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothes for her business

loans.name: Kmoung

texts.en:
Mrs. Kmoung, who was born in 1969, and her husband, Mr. Pich, are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they grow peanuts to earn a living. They also sell fruit juices in the local village. In order to support the farm, Kmoung is requesting a loan to hire laborers and to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a big ice box for selling juice.

This couple has two children, one a student and the other just three years old.

loans.use: To hire farming laborers and to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Thuan's Group

texts.en:
Thuan T. N. is 52 year old.  She is living with her family in Ngoai Village.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising pigs for meat. Her business has lasted for many years and she gets stable income from these activaties. She used her previous loan to buy more fertilizer and food for her pigs. In this cycle she is asking for a loan of 7,194,000 VND to  buy  more pigs to raise.
 
T. T. N.  is  45 years old with 2 children.  She is running a shop that provides motor repair services. She is requesting a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy a motor washing machine.
 
Lieu T. N. is 46 years old with 2 children . She has a shop that sells shoes.  She is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in  the shop. 
 
Ha T. T. T.  is 35 years old with two children. She  has a shop that sells motor parts.   She is requesting a loan of 9,374,000 VND to expand her business.

loans.use: To  buy  more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao, who was born in 1964, is a fruit seller who is able to earn a small income to help support her family.  Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to enlarge her business.  Mao’s husband owns a motorbike used to transport his wife‘s fruit to the market to sell.  He is also a taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to add to his wife's savings to improve his family's living situation.  This couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is attending a local school.  She is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Chuch

texts.en: Mrs. Chuch was born in 1954 and earns her living by selling vegetables in the local market.  Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, in order to support and expand her business, she is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell.  Chuch’s husband is a laborer who is able to earn a small salary to help support his family.  This couple has two children: one is a furniture maker and one is a laborer.  Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  charcoal sales, vegetable vending and farming. Her husband Orlando, who is 38 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 10 and 11 years old. Mercelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy more stock so that she can continue to save up for her children’s education & household improvements. Mercelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Zainab C

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Zainab.  She is married, and has 3 children ages 13, 7 and 3 years old.  She has 3 additional dependents who live with her because they are her nieces and nephew.  

In 2009, Zainab established her pharmacy business.  She began her business because she wants to take care of herself and family.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,009,200 SLL every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  Zainab requires a loan in order to buy additional medicines for her pharmacy.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 601,840 SLL.  In the future, Zainab plans to open another outlet.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy medical drugs.

loans.name: Farrux

texts.ru: Farrux jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Farrux G. rodilsya v 1959 qodu. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmetse so svoimi detmi i lubimoy jenoy. Rarrux uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. On u sebya doma prodayet yogurt i sir kotoriy delayet yeqo jena.
texts.en: Farrux is married and has two children.  Farrux G. was born in 1959.  Farrux is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his children and his beloved wife live in the Fuzuli region.  Farrux has been a herdsman for nine years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy another cow to develop his business.  From his house, he sells yogurt and cheese made by his wife.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. operates a local café in the Takaye area in Malindi town.  She earns a monthly profit of 26,000 KES.  She is 41 years old and a single mother of two children who are below 18 years of age. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who has also gained from the services that KADET offers.  She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more equipment like cups, glasses, plates, and chairs and to also renovate the business premises.    

Esther intends to use the anticipated profit to save and pay school fees for her children.  She hopes to grow her business, and in the future to establish a retail shop beside the café.

loans.use: To buy utensils like plates, glasses, cups, spoons and to add more chairs and to renovate the business premises.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
There are fourteen people who make up this village bank loan. Mr. Lay, who was born in 1952, is the village bank president.  He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to grow rice for a living.  His wife, Mrs. Nhoem is a grocery seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. 

Since his wife's business is doing well, he wants to expand it.  In order to enlarge his wife's business, he is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her business.  This couple has four children: one is a laborer, one stays at home, and the others two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for his wife's grocery business.

loans.name: Baindu

texts.en:
This is 47 year-old Baindu.  She is married and has 5 children ages 20,17,15,11 and 8 years old.  She has 3 additional dependents who live with her because they are her family members from the provinces where educational facilities are poor.  

In 1999, Baindu established her restaurant business.  She began her business after the war as a means of generating income for their livelihood.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,216,400 SLL every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Baindu needs a new loan to help her buy rice and other ingredients in large quantities.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 242,880 SLL.  In the future, Baindu plans to get another restaurant.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional food items.

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen members.  Mr. Sam, who was born in 1952, is the village bank president.  He was selected to be the group leader by the other members.  He and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice for supporting their family living. 

With this farm, they do not have enough money to grow rice on it.  Thus, Mr. Sam would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay laborers to grow rice.  Aside from farming, he is also a commune clerk who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. This couple has two children: one is a farmer and one is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers for growing rice.

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.ru:
Ilgar A. 39 let. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Ilgar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet vmeste so svoyey semyoy v Fuzuli regione. 
Ilgar uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Etomu biznessu on uchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy toje bil skotovodom. Ilgar ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i on vseqda xochet imet razvitiye v svayom biznesse. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit yeshe korov. Ilgar v osnovnom iz moloka delayet Kefir i prodayet yeqo v magazini.
texts.en: Ilgar A. is 39 years old.  He is married and has a child.  Ilgar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his family live in the Fuzuli region. Ilgar has been a herdsman for ten years.  He learned this business from his father who was also a herdsman.  Ilgar loves his work and is always looking for ways to develop his business.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy another cow.  Ilgar makes kefir from the milk and then sells it in shops.

loans.use: buy a cow to expand his business

loans.name: Sarina

texts.en:
Sarina is a married woman who lives in Quezon, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a farming business. Her husband Emeniano, who is 78 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 14 and 34 years old. Sarina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sarina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy additional stocks for store and for vegetables to sell to her customers so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Sarina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Shadrack Chigiri

texts.en: Shadrack Chigiri M. operates a motorcycle transport in Shanzu, Mombasa town. He has been in this business for two years and earns a good income.  He is 30 years old. He has never borrowed from any other MFI and is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase another motorbike.  Shadrack intends to use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a food vending business.  She lives in Rizal, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Menchie is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Menchie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating dried fish vending and food vending businesses.  She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Violeta is borrowing PHP 21,000 to fund operations. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Violeta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Sedi

texts.ru:
Sedi I. 42 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Sedi yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli gorode vmeste so svoyey jenoy i sinom. Sedi ochen lubit svoyu semyu i svoyu rabotu. 6 let tamu Sedi stal taksistom , on ochen lubil vodit mashini i poeotmu reshil zanatsya etim delom. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini.
texts.en:
Sedi I. is 42 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Sedi is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).
