He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his wife and son live in the Fuzuli region.  Sedi loves his family and his work very much.  Sedi has driven a taxi for six years.  He loved driving cars, and therefore decided to do it professionally.

Sedi now needs 2000 AZN to buy repair parts for his car.

loans.use: buy repair parts for a car

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu B. is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  In 2006, Isatu established her caustic soda, maggi, and water plastic business. She started her business after gaining experience from her mother who is engaged in  the same business. This business is very special to Isatu as it is the only business she knows. Working seven days a week, 12 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL a month. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to purchase caustic soda and oil. She has a very good loan repayment history.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 240,000 SLL. In the future, Isatu plans to get another bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase caustic soda and oil

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband Roger, who is 42 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 4 to 20 years old. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,900, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to buy more fish to sell in the market so that she can continue to save up for her children's education & household improvements. Josephine is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Galib

texts.ru: Galib yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione  vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Galib E. 33 qoda. On ranshe rabotal prodavcom v magazine no potom on reshil zanyatsya druqim biznessom i uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Galib etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi. Galib seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya toqo chtobi uvelichit kolichestva produkta. On prodayet moloko i kefir po zakazu , tak kak on imeyet mnoqo zakazov yemu nujni yeshe korovi.
texts.en: Galib is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his family live in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has one child.  Galib E. is 33 years old.  He used to work as a salesman in a store, but then he decided to change businesses.  He has been working as a herdsman for three years now.  Galib started this business with his uncle.  Galib now needs 2000 AZN to buy cows in order to increase production.  He takes orders to sell milk and kefir.  Currently he has so many orders he needs more cows to fill them.

loans.use: buying cows

loans.name: Maharoumba

texts.fr: Dame  Maharoumba  est mariée  avec  2  enfants  à   charge.   Elle a  50 ans  et  habite  quartier  Wessomé.   Elle  est  revendeuse  d’une  boisson locale  communément  appelé  dans  la langue maternelle au Togo  Tchoukoutchou.  Elle a commencé  cette  activité  en  2000  et  s’approvisionne au  marché d’assiyéyé  à  adidogomé.    Ensuite elle  revend  la  boisson  à  son domicile.   Elle  sollicite  un  prêt  pour  acheter  6  sacs  de mil. Mais actuellement elle n'a pas de stock.
texts.en:
Maharoumba is a married woman with two children in her care. She is 50 years old and lives in the Wessomé neighbourhood. She sells a millet-based beverage locally called Tchoukoutchou. She started this activity in 2000. She gets her supplies at the market of Assiyéyé, in Adidogomé, and then sells the beverage from her home. 

She is seeking a loan to buy six sacks of millet as her stocks are currently depleted.

loans.use: To buy millet

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lolo sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et de poissons.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Lolo sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                         
DJENEBA SIDIBÉ compte acheter des poissons avec les pêcheurs pour ensuite les revendeurs de Dioïla, quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Lolo solidarity group are all married women who average 38 years of age and six children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the city of Dioïla, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell fish and condiments.

The Lolo group members are on their third group loan. Djeneba SIDIBÉ plans to use her loan to buy fish from the fishermen for resale in Dioïla every day from her home, but also at the market, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 17,500 FCFA that will be used to make loan repayments and contribute to social ceremonies, the remainder to be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, d’habillements, de savons et de pâte d’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
CHITAN T. compte acheter des habillements avec les grossistes du marché de Dioïla presque à chaque foire hebdomadaire. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Tiessiri group, all married women, are on the average 39 years old, with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioïla, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as friends, relatives and neighbors. They sell condiments, clothing, soap and peanut paste.

The Tiessiri group members are on their third solidarity loan. Chitan T. plans to  be buying clothing from wholesalers at the Dioïla market, almost every week. She sells daily, out of her home and at the market, for cash and in credit to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 20,000 West African Francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her contributions to big social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mamie I.. She is married and has three children aged 2, 3, and 7. 

In 2005, Mamie established her fabric business. Her business is located in the busy commercial district of Bo city. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,411,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of  4,000,000 SLL in order to buy additional bails of wax cotton, satin and lace. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 282,200 SLL. 

In the future, Mamie plans to open a new business in another location and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional bails of cloth for her business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de chaussures, de charbon de bois, de tiéké, de savons et d’habillements.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des chaussures, des habits, des savons, du tiéké et du charbon de bois.                                                                         
Korotoumou C. compte acheter des chaussures avec les grossistes du marché de Dioïla, hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married 32 year olds with three children each. They all live in traditional extended families in a town called Dioïla, located in the municipality of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through family and friendship ties. They sell shoes, firewood, soap and clothes. 
The women are on their sixth loan which they will use to purchase shoes, dresses, soaps and firewood.                                                              
Korotoumou C. aims to purchase shoes from wholesalers at the Dioïla market every week.  She will sell her goods every day from home and at the market, for cash or credit and to a customer base made up of men and women.
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to pay back her loan, to pay for social ceremonies and some will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes

loans.name: Revayet

texts.ru: Revayet H. 20 let. On ne jenat. Revayet yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Yeqo mama boleyet i poeotmu krome raboti on yeshe i delayet domashniye raboti chtobi mama nene ustavala. Revayet uje 2 qoda kak imeyet magazin qde prodayet vrukti i ovoshi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit frukti i ovoshi dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Revayet H. is 20 years old.  He is single.  Revayet is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his parents live in the Fuzuli region.  His mother is ill, and therefore Revayet also does all of the housework so his mother does not become too tired.  For two years, Revayet has had a shop where he sells fruit and vegetables.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sirablekoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de pâte d’arachide, de galettes, d’habillements et d’oignons.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, de l’arachide, des céréales, d’habillements et d’oignons.                                                                          
SITAN KALIDI D. compte acheter des sacs d’oignons avec les grossistes des villages environnants presque hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village et au marché de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married 40 year-olds with five children each.  They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Sirablekoro, in the municipality of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro (in the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through family and friendship links.  The women sell condiments, peanut butter, biscuits, clothes and onions.                                                                                      
The women of the Benkadi group are on their fourth loan which will be used to purchase more of these goods. 
Sitan Kalidi D. aims to purchase bags of onions weekly from the wholesalers of the neighbouring villages. She sells her wares daily from the market at Dioïla, for cash or credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 16 000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, pay for social ceremonies, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing onions

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sirablekoro, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de pâte d’arachide, de poissons et de la restauration.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                         
AMINATA D., qui est la présidente du groupe, compte acheter un sac de 50Kg de riz pour la restauration au niveau du village. Elle effectue la restauration dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala group are all married and 36 years old, with five children each. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Sirablekoro, in the municipality of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family and friendship links.  They sell condiments, peanut butter, fish and other food products. 
The women of the Kotognontala are on their fourth loan. 
Aminata D., the group's president, aims to purchase a 50kg bag of rice for food preparation. She sells prepared food in the village, for cash or credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women.
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 15.000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to pay for social ceremonies and to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing rice

loans.name: Siguidiale Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIALE, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36  ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sirablekoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de pâte d’arachide, d’oignons, de céréales, du bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIALE sont à leur quatrième prêt. 
KADIA D. compte acheter une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires avec les grossistes des villages environnants. Elle effectue les ventes dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Siguidiale group are all married 39 year olds with five children each. They all live in large traditional extended families in the village of Sirablekoro, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through family and friendship links. They sell condiments, peanut butter, onions, firewood and charcoal. 
The women of the Siguidiale are on their fourth loan. 
Kadia D. aims to purchase a large quantity of condiments from the wholesalers of the nearby villages. She sells her wares for cash and credit sales in the nearby village, to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75 000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, for social ceremonies and to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Ramatu C.. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 10 and 3. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they were given to her by her in-law.  

In 2006, Ramatu started selling food like bulgur, rice, corn meal and oil. She began her business because she learned it from her mother. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,800,000 SLL every month. 

She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy bags of bulgur, rice and salt. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 360,000 SLL. 

In the future, Ramatu plans to get a house of her own, and she is very excited as she knows the loan will help. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of bulgur rice and salt

loans.name: Lawrence Ndiritu

texts.en:
Lawrence Ndiritu K. owns a retail shop in Bamburi, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last two years, and he earns a good income. He is 28 years old, married and the father of one child. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd., with which he plans to purchase more stock of rice, flour and sugar and packets of sweets for sale.        

Lawrence intends to use the anticipated profit to save and plough back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, flour and sugar and packets of sweets

loans.name: O'yah

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old O'yah B.. She is married, and has two children, aged 6 and 4. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her nieces and nephews.  

In 2009, O'yah established her sport shoe, T-shirt and vest business. She began her business because she wants to get a means of caring for her family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000 in order to expand her product offerings. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 730,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing phone top-up cards

loans.name: Daniel Parkipoi

texts.en:
Daniel Parkipoi S. is a farmer and works on his own piece of land. He has been in this business for the last ten years and earns a good income.  He is 32 years old, married, and supports eight people. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he learned about KADET Ltd. from a member of a group registered with KADET. He is applying for his second loan from KADET, with which he plans to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer.        

Daniel intends to use the anticipated profit to save and re-invest in the farm. In the future, he plans to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret Wangui

texts.en: Margaret K. is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for 10 years with an income of about 27,000 KES per month. This is Margaret's third loan from KADET LTD; she has successfully repaid her previous loans. She intends to use this loan to buy more pigs to rear and sell later at a profit. Margaret plans to use the anticipated profit to build a greenhouse. She hopes to be a leading greenhouse farmer and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Parsoloi

texts.en:
Parsoloi O. T. is 34 years old. He is married to Nalutuesha and a father of four children. Parsoloi is a farmer and has been farming for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for land farming.


He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting and also to hire manpower during preparation of the farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children.


His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. Parsoloi is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for planting

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Dame  Adjowavi    a  3 enfants et  est   mariée.     Elle  a  54  ans.  Pour   améliorer  les  conditions  de  vie  de  ses  enfants,  elle fait  la vente  de produits  d’alimentation et sodabi une boisson locale du  Togo.  Elle a débuté  son  activité  en  1981 et s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé.   Elle  a reçu   4 crédits  qui  ont  été  bien remboursé.   Elle  sollicite   un  prêt  pour  acheter  25 fûts  de sodabi.
texts.en: Adjowavi is a married 54 year old, with three children. In order to improve her standard of living, she sells food products, and sodabi (a locally produced drink from the Togo). She entered this field in 1981 and sources her wares from the large market in Lomé.   She has received four loans which she has paid back successfully, and is seeking a new loan in order to buy 25 containers of sodabi.

loans.use: purchasing containers of sodabi (a locally produced drink)

loans.name: Sirere

texts.en:
Sirere O. S. is 26 years old, married to Nariku S., and supports four people in the family. Sirere is a farmer who grows maize on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET from credit officers in their marketing. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to spend on the purchase farm inputs. He paid the previous loans well and in good time. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming and also to pay school fees for his children.

Sirere's dream is to practice large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a conscientious man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. M. is 46 years old, married to Naipanoi M., and the father of seven children. For the last 11 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.


He learned about KADET LTD through posters. This will be his second loan. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.


His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land

loans.name: Ntiati

texts.en:
Ntiati O. K. is 38 years old, married and a father of six children. He practices mixed farming, which he has been doing for 15 years in Narok town.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second  loan with which he is planning to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build new house and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises and buy livestock which he can later sell to generate other income. Ntiati is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba O. K. is 39 years old, married to Naisoi K., and blessed with five children; all are schooling. He is a farmer and he does the farming activity on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his third loan with which he is planning to spend to buy eight bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and eight bags of fertilizer. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity.

Kumba's dream is construct rental houses and educate his children in order for them to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and eight bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Riamet

texts.en:
Riamet M.  is 24 years old, single, and a hard-working man. He supports his mother and his six siblings.

Riamet is a livestock trader: he buys the cattle,  rears them,  and sells them later at a profit in Narok town. He has done this  for the last four years and earns a good income.  

He learned about KADET LTD from KADET staff. He is applying for his second loan, with which he intends to more animals for resale. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standards of his family and for business expansion.

Riamet's dream is to prosper in the business of livestock trading.

loans.use: to buy more animals for resale

loans.name: Vusal

texts.ru:
Vusal K. 25 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Vusal yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas provivayer v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Vusal uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Yeqo mama delayet doma  iz moloka sir, yogurt, kefir i oni prodayut ix v magazini. 
Seychas Vusal nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit yeshe korovi dlya uvilicheniya kolichestva molochnoqo produkta.
texts.en:
Vusal K. is 25 years old.  He is single and does not have any children.  Vusal is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his family live in Fuzuli region.  Vusal has been working as a herdsman for three years.  His mother makes cheese, yogurt, and kefir from the milk and sells them to stores.

Currently, Vusal needs 2000 AZN to buy another cow so that he can increase milk production.

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Marrir Ole Tiapuke

texts.en:
Marrir Ole Tiapuke K. is 38 years old, married to Jane K., and they have six children.Marrir is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to repay the loan and expand his farming.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build rental houses. Marrir is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine O. M. is 61 years old, married and blessed with twelve children. M. is a farmer and he has been in this line of work for the last twenty-five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. M. is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kaituai Ole Kashu

texts.en:
Kaituai ole Kashu N.  is 43 years old. He is  married and supports eight people in the family. Kaituai is a farmer and he does farming on his piece of land as he has been doing for the last ten years.  

He learned about KADET LTD from a staff member. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the family's living standards.

Kaituai's dream is to prosper in farming and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Haja.  She is married and has three children aged 16, 11, and 9. In the year 2001, Haja established her clothing and food items business. She began her business because she wants to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,500,000 every month from this business. 

Haja would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Haja has a very good loan repayment history. She requires a new loan in order to buy rolls of clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Haja plans to build a house and educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing for her business

loans.name: Kipema Ole

texts.en:
Kipema ole M. N. is 44 years old. He is married and supports six people. Kipema is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land as he has been doing for the last fourteen years.

He learned about KADET LTD from credit officers in their local marketing. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to purchase farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kipema's dream is to practise large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Kateken

texts.en:
Kateken O. T. is 33 years old, married, blessed with three children and supports four other people from his family. Kateken is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land as he has been doing for the last six years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other men in a group already registered with KADET LTD in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is plans to use to buy bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity.

Kateken's dream is to construct rental houses and educate his children in order for them to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and fertilizers

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is Mohamed.  He is married and has 8 children. He has four additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives. In 1996, Mohamed established his provisions, rice, flour and sugar business. He began his business because he wanted to use the income to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 768,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. He requires a loan in order to buy more of his business stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 150,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to get another outlet and to build a house.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  provisions, rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Kesu Ole Metian

texts.en:
Kesu ole Metian N. is 31 years old . He is married and a father of two children. Metian is a farmer and he has been doing this work for the last thirteen years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to prepare his wheat farm which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children with the proceeds.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land, and build a permanent house. Metian is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farm

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Sarah.  She is married and has three children aged 14, 9, and 7.  In 2005, Sarah established her foodstuffs business. She began her business because her mother introduced her to it. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,112,000 every month from this business. 

Sarah would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She wants a loan to help her buy Maggi, groundnut oil, and tinned tomatoes in large quantities. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 220,000. In the future, Sarah plans to get a new Victor motorbike and to help her children with their school fees.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has three children aged 15, 12 and 10. In the year 2001, Mohamed established his cloth business. He began in his business because he took it over from his late father and this is the only business he can manage well to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business.

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy additional wax cotton, "Brillion", and lace. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to get another outlet and also to buy a motorbike for business purposes.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional cloth for resale

loans.name: Ntipapa

texts.en:
Ntipapa O. M.  is 55 years old. He is married and supports ten people. Ntipapa is a farmer and he does the farming activity on his own piece of land as he has been doing for the last eleven years. 
  
He learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan and he repaid the previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to buy maize seeds and also buy fertilizer. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of maize.

His hope and dream is to educate his children and grandchildren to higher level of education. Ntipapa is an industrious man who struggles to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and also buy fertilizer

loans.name: Le'ontine

texts.en:
Le'ontine was born in 1966, and now has three children with her husband Mathieu. Although she is uneducated, her children have had the chance of an education.

Le'ontine runs a small hardware store out of her home, which she supplies from the Tokpa market, the largest in Benin. It is now 10 years since she started this store.

With this loan, her fourth from ALIDE, she will purchase new stock to resell at her store. Her aim is to develop her business further in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing new stock for her little store

loans.name: G.s. Los Cocos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Cocos están conformados por Maria Isidora y Cristiana De La Concepción. Cristina se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de costura, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho de su actividad, la mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su vivienda pues ellos conocen la buena calidad de sus prendas de vestir. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta es que tiene 2 hijos que son enfermos, pues siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante. Maria se dedica a la venta de leche, hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy productivo para mantener a su familia. Ellas se han unido para realizar este financiamiento que es destinado para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: The group named Los Cocos is made up of Maria Isidora and Cristiana De La Conception. Cristiana has a tailoring business. She is a very enterprising individual and she greatly enjoys her occupation. The majority of her clients come to her house, knowing the good quality clothing she makes. One of the challenges that she faces is that she has 2 children who are ill. So she is always looking for a way to come out ahead. Maria has been selling milk for the past 6 years. It has been very helpful in supporting her family. They came together to access a loan.  The loan will be used to purchase materials.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Fifamé

texts.en:
Fifamé is 35 years old and lives in the Sèmè-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She shares her home with her husband Dieudonné and their three children, who have all been educated. For the last 15 years, Fifamé has sold containers and miscellaneous items as a travelling salesperson. She sources these from Tokpa, the country's largest market.

This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful repayments, and Fifamé hopes to purchase more stock for her business. Her goal is to strengthen and grow her business.

loans.use: New stock of plastic containers

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 43 years old and lives in the district of Sèmè-Podji in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She shares her home with her husband Dèhoumon, a teacher, and together they look after four children, two of whom are their own.

Chantal has been selling sewing equipment for 12 years, and has been developing her own tailoring business. With this loan from ALIDE she hopes to buy her own sewing machine and supplies to drive her business.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine and various materials

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno, ella siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, se siente muy satisfecha con este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy satisfecha por la ayuda que le brindan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como maíz, bolsas, harina entre otros productos. Para el futuro le gustaría realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, pues siempre ha trabajado para mantenerse.
texts.en: Juana Francisca sells baked goods. She is always in search for a way to improve her income. She is very satisfied with her business. This is not the first time she requests a loan. She is very satisfied with the support these loans provide. The loan that she requests will be used to purchase goods such as corn, plastic bags, baking flour and other products. In the future she would like to make improvements to her house. She has always worked to support herself.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married with two daughters – Victoria and Olga. Alexei lives and runs his agricultural venture in the small town of Gladkovka, Kherson region. He owns greenhouses where he grows tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes and cucumbers for further sale. Alexei has been in this business for 17 years. He has invested over 100,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. His net profit is about 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Alexei is requesting a 12,000 Grivnya loan to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood, and fertilizers to improve conditions in his greenhouses and grow seedlings for upcoming farming season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood and fertilizers

loans.name: Liliya

texts.en:
Liliya is married with two sons. She lives in Gladkovka. Liliya is a farming entrepreneur. She grows early spring vegetables, i.e., tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, carrots, and peppers in her greenhouses. Liliya sells her produce retail and wholesale to vendors from other regions of Ukraine.  

Liliya has been in the trade for 6 years. She has invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. Her monthly net profit amounts to 5,400 Grivnyas. Currently, Liliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood, and fertilizers for her greenhouses. She loves running this business and is hoping to continue see it flourish and develop even further.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for greenhouse maintenance

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El Sr M. labora como conductor  es acompañado, tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece  la oportunidad que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales de tubería para instalación de servicio higiénico, mano de obra.
texts.en: Sr. M. works as a driver and lives with two dependent children.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for the opportunity being given to him.  The funds will be used to make an improvement to his home.  He will buy materials, such as pipes, so that sewage service can be installed.  In addition, he will pay for labor.

loans.use: Purchase materials & pay for labor so that his home can receive sewage service

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es:
La Señora María Adela L. R., es madre de tres hijos de los que tiene a su  cargo actualmente se dedica a brindar consulta odontológica en una clínica particular, cabe mencionar que lleva 2 años dedicados a esta labor, anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio (Venta de granos básicos).

La Señora  L. R., solicita este crédito para compra de cerámica, cemento y puerta los que utilizara para acondicionar una clínica en su casa de habitación y así obtener más utilidad para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia.
Con los créditos que Ceprodel  le ha brindado ha logrado hacerle muchas mejoras a vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. María Adela L. R. is the mother of three children who are in her care. She currently provides dental consultations from a private clinic. It should be mentioned that she has been in this business for two years. She previously had a business selling basic grains.

Sra. L. R. is requesting this loan in order to buy ceramic, cement, and a door so that she can remodel the clinic in her home. The space will be more useful so that she can improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

With the loans from CEPRODEL, she has been able to make many improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase materials to remodel her dental clinic

loans.name: Lucia Consuelo

texts.es: La Sra U. labora como operadora de fotocopiadora  es acompañada, tiene una persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece  la oportunidad que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción como arena, cemento madera cinz, mano de obra, para hacer anexo .
texts.en:
Sra. U. works as photocopy machine operator. She lives with one person who is a dependent.

This is the first loan she has received from CEPRODEL. She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her. The funds will be used to make an improvement to her home. She will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, wood, and zinc in order to build an extension. In addition, she will pay for labor.

loans.use: Purchase materials & pay for labor to build an extension to her house

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcia Argentina Martínez Munguía, es madre soltera de ocho  hijos de los cuales solo uno  tiene a su  cargo actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mercado la estación de la ciudad de León, cabe mencionar que lleva 12 años dedicados a esta labor, lo que ha venido ayudarle a mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
Con los créditos que Ceprodel  le ha brindado ella compra por  pacas la ropa usada anteriormente realizaba  sus compras por piezas y así  obtiene mayor ganancia lo que   ha logrado a incrementar su capital,  lo cual le ha ayudado realizar  mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcia Argentina Martínez Munguía is a single mother of eight children, but only one is still in her care. She sells used clothing at the station market in the city of León. It should be mentioned that she has devoted twelve years to this business, which has helped her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

With the loans from CEPRODEL, Marcia has been able to buy used clothing in bales. She previously bought individual pieces. Now she has more income as a result of increased capital. This has helped her make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase two bales of used clothing

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El señor Abraham cuenta con 39 años de edad y es originario de la localidad de San Felipe de los Alzati perteneciente al Estado de Michoacán, en este pueblo su actividad económica son las  artesanías ya que muy cerca de la población se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca y en el mes de  diciembre se dedican al cultivo de la flor de Noche Buena. Don Abraham se dedica a la venta de jitomates, cebollas, aguacate, chiles, papas, diferentes tipos de verduras y frutas de temporada como naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, piñas, etc., el vende su producto en los tianguis de diferentes pueblos de la región como son Zirahuato, Melchor Ocampo, Laureles, Angangueo y Tuxpan. Comenta que casi toda la semana se pasa fuera de  casa él y su esposa y que los días sábados es cuando va a surtir su mercancía en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro. Dice que comenzó con su negocio hace aproximadamente 15 años, empezó con este negocio por que los papas de su esposa se dedicaban a ese tipo de negocio, y cuando se caso con ella, lo animo a que invirtieran en el negocio de la fruta y verdura. Su necesidad de seguir en este negocio son sus hijos él quiere darles estudios comenta don Abraham “son muy pequeños pero quiero que el día de mañana no les falte nada, que tengan una carrera ya que por falta de recursos mis padres no me la pudieron dar a mí”. El señor Abraham comenta que una de sus metas es poder Hacerle  un negocio estable de frutas y verduras a su esposa, porque ya no quiere que salga tan temprano a ayudarlo ya que se levantan a las tres de la mañana él, su esposa e hijos para poder irse a los tianguis. Comenta que le va a beneficiar en mucho este préstamo ya que invertirá en su verdura y podrá comprarle sus útiles escolares a su niña que estudia el jardín de niños, y podrá ahorrar un poco más para poder comprar su camioneta que tanta falta le hace. Don Abraham está casado con la Señora Teodora de Jesús hace 15 años ellos procrearon 3 hijos de nombres Concepción de 5 años que estudia el jardín de niños, Abraham de tres años y Jovana de 8 meses de edad.
texts.en:
Sr. Abraham is 39 years old and a native of the town of San Felipe de Los Alzati in the State of Michoacán. The main business activity in this town is the production and sale of handicrafts. Nearby is a monarch butterfly sanctuary and the month of December is dedicated to the cultivation of poinsettias (known locally as the “Christmas Eve flower”).

Don Abraham sells tomatoes, onions, avocados, chili peppers, and different types of seasonal fruits and vegetables such as oranges, tangerines, bananas, pineapples, and other items. He sells his products at the local markets in different towns of the region such as Zirahuato, Melcho Ocampo, Laureles, Angangueo, and Tuxpan. Abraham says that he and his wife spend most of the week away from home. Every Saturday, he restocks his inventory with merchandise from the central supply depot in Zitacuaro. He started his business approximately fifteen years ago because his wife’s parents were in the same type of business. When they got married, Abraham was encouraged to invest in the business of fruits and vegetables. He needs to continue his business because he wants to provide his children an education. Don Abraham says, “My children are very young, but I want them to live each day lacking nothing. They should earn a degree and not lack the resources my parents were not able to provide for me.” One of his goals is to have a stable produce business because his wife does not want to leave so early in order to help him. Abraham, his wife, and his children currently wake up at 3am in order to get to the local markets. He says he will benefit greatly from this loan because he can invest in vegetables and purchase school supplies for his daughter who is in kindergarten. In addition, he will be able to save up some money in order to buy a truck that he needs for his business.

Don Abraham has been married to Sra. Teodora de Jesús for fifteen years. They have three children named Concepción (age 5 and in kindergarten), Abraham (age 3), and Jovana (age 8 months).

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor Hugo tiene 25 años D. edad es originario D. la población D. San Felipe D. los Alzati una localidad muy bonita y pintoresca donD. la principal fuente D. empleo son las artesanías ya que muy cerca D. la localidad se encuentra el santuario D. la mariposa monarca y la zona arqueológica D. Zirahuato. Don Hugo tiene un puesto D. frutas y verduras en el tianguis D. diferentes poblaciones, comenta que el pidió el préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en fruta y verduras D. temporada jitomate, chiles, cebollas, manzanas, papayas, plátanos, sandias, etc. Tiene trabajando con su negocio hace aproximadamente 5años, comenta que él empezó a trabajar con sus papas y luego se fue a trabajar con su hermana y después tuvo que emprender sus propio negocio por que no le alcanzaba con lo que ganaba con su hermana ya que se había casado y no alcanzaba el dinero para mantener a su esposa, dice que con lo que ganaba fue poco a poco ahorrando para surtir su puesto. El surte en la central D. abastos D. Toluca estado D. México, ya que en ese lugar le dan mejores precios, y así le gana un poquito más a sus productos, los días que surte son los sábados y toda la semana restante trabaja en diferentes tianguis. El está contento porque Fundación Realidad le hizo el préstamo y además se le hace muy poco lo que da D. intereses y está agradecido por la confianza que depositaron en el. Don Hugo es casado desD. hace 4 años con la señora Juana la cual es también comerciante D. frutas, ellos tiene dos niños D. tres y dos años D. edad. Una D. sus metas es comprar una camioneta semi nueva ya que la que tiene se le descompone a cada rato porque es modelo muy antiguo, otro D. sus retos es sacar adelante el pequeño huerto D. aguacates que tiene comenta que es un negocio a largo plazo pero confía en que si le va a ir bien en ese negocio y que más adelante va a comprar plantas D. durazno para hacer un poquito más granD. su huerto. Dice que este préstamo le va ayudar D. mucho porque con las ganancias  podrá solventar gastos que tiene en casa y en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Hugo is 25 years old and originally from the town of San Felipe D. Los Alzati, a beautiful and picturesque locale where artisans are the main source of employment. The nearby attractions incluD. a monarch butterfly sanctuary and the Zirahuato archaeological site.

Don Hugo has a fruit and vegetable stand that he sets up at the local markets in different towns. He says that he requested a loan from Fundación Realidad so that he could invest in seasonal fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, apples, papayas, bananas, watermelons, and other types of produce. Hugo has been in this business for approximately five years. He started working with his parents and later with his sister. Afterwards, he decided to establish his own business because he was not earning enough working with his sister. Hugo was already married and needed to earn enough money to support his wife. He says that with what he earned he was able to save enough money to stock his stand. His merchandise comes from the central supply depot in Toluca in the State of Mexico. Hugo buys at this location because the prices are better, which means he earns a little bit more profit from the sale of his products. He restocks his inventory on Saturdays and works at different markets during the rest of the week.

Hugo is pleased because Fundación Realidad has given him this loan, in addition to the little bit of interest he has earned. He is grateful for the trust that FRAC has demonstrated to him.

Don Hugo has been married for four years to Sra. Juana, who is also a fruit merchant. They have two children, ages 2 and 3. One of his goals is to buy a semi-used truck because he currently drives a very old model that breaks down all the time. He also plans to start a small avocado orchard in the future as a long-term business. He is confident that he will do well in this business. Later on, he will buy peach trees so that he can expand his orchard a little more. Hugo says this loan will be of great help because the income he generates will cover his household and business expenses.

loans.use: Purchase different types of fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula Martínez M. ella es originaria de la localidad del Chirimoyo ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, conocido porque muy cerca de ahí se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca, las pirámides de Zirahuato, también es conocido por su artesanía y por la deliciosa gastronomía. Doña Paula tiene 22 años de edad, comenta que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria porque muy jovencita se caso y por eso no pudo continuar con sus estudios y su esposo también no la dejo estudiar. Doña Paula se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, comenta que ella pidió el préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en la compra frutas y verduras ella comprara naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, manzanas, guayabas, jitomates, cebollas, papas, calabazas etc. Tiene trabajando con su negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus frutas y legumbres para ayudarle a su esposo con el negocio ya que su esposo ya tenía su puesto ambulante. Ella surte en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro y Toluca, los días jueves y lunes desde muy tempranas horas ella y su esposo van a surtir los días jueves y sábados y toda la semana restante trabaja en su puesto, comenta que ella y su esposo tienen una camioneta y van a las localidades aledañas a su población a vender sus frutas. La meta que tiene para su negocio es más adelante abrir un local estable donde venda sus frutas y vender un poco de abarrotes ya que es uno de sus sueños. Doña Paula está casada con el señor Adrián el cual es comerciante de frutas y verduras, ellos tienen 3 hijos de nombres Isaac de 5 años estudiante de preescolar, Valeria de 2 años y Adriana de 1 año de edad. Ella está contenta porque Fundación Realidad le hizo el préstamo y además se le hace muy poco lo que pagara de intereses y está agradecida por la confianza que depositaron en ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Paula Martínez M. is originally from the town of Chirimoyo in the State of Michoacán, which is known for its proximity to a monarch butterfly sanctuary and the pyramids of Zirahuato. Chirimoyo is also known for its handicrafts and delicious cuisine.

Doña Paula is 22 years old. She says she dropped out after completing three years of high school because she got married and was not able to finish her education. Her husband did not finish his schooling as well. Doña Paula sells fruits and legumes. She requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables such as oranges, tangerines, bananas, apples, guavas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, pumpkins, and other types of produce. Paula has worked in this business for approximately five years. She started out selling fruits and legumes by helping her husband with his business since he has a mobile produce stand. Her merchandise comes from the central supply depots in Zitacuaro and Toluca. On Mondays and Thursdays, she and her husband wake up early to restock with more merchandise. On Fridays, Saturdays, and the remainder of the week they work at their stand. Paula says that she and her husband have a truck that they use for traveling to the neighboring towns to sell fruit. Her goal for her business is to open a stable location in the future where she can sell fruit as well as a few groceries.

Doña Paula is married to Sr. Adrián, who is also a fruit and vegetable merchant. They have three children named Isaac (age 5 and attends pre-school), Valeria (age 2), and Adriana (age 1). Paula is pleased because Fundación Realidad has given her this loan for which she will pay very little interest. She is also grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to her.

loans.use: Purchase legumes & seasonal fruits

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señorita Lupita como D. cariño le dicen sus amigos y familiares, ella es originaria D. la localidad D. San Felipe D. los Alzati que se encuentra ubicado en el Estado D. Michoacán. Cuenta con 24 años D. edad,  le ha echado ganas para surtir su negocio D. abarrotes ambulante ya que venD. sus productos como son jabón, frijol, papel higiénico, azúcar, aceite, harina, chiles, shampoo  y otros productos D. primera necesidad en los tianguis D. diferentes pueblos D. la región como son Angangueo, El Rosario, Zirahuato, Melchor Ocampo entre otros. Comenta que ella empezó con este tipo D. negocio porque sus papas le enseñaron desD. muy pequeña ya que ellos tenían su puesto ambulante D. abarrotes y D. frutas y verduras. Comenta que su negocio lo tiene aproximadamente hace 10 años, ella se surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas en el municipio D. Zitacuaro, Michoacán y en Toluca  Estado D. México. Ella quiere mejorar su casa ya que en tiempo D. lluvias se le mete el agua porque es D. lámina. Ella es soltera y vive con sus padres a quienes ayuda con la manutención por que dice: “Ellos ya son grandes a hora me toca a mí y a mis hermanos ayudarlos como alguna vez lo hicieron con nosotros”. Una D. sus metas es poder comprar una camioneta para poder trasladarse a los diferentes tianguis a donD. va a vender sus productos, otro D. sus sueños es poder tener aparte del negocio ambulante tener un negocio estable para ayudar a sus papas para que ellos lo atiendan y no salgan D. su casa porque dice que andar vendiendo en los tianguis es muy pesado por que se tienen que levantar a las dos o tres D. la mañana para trasladarse al lugar donD. venden su mercancía. Dice que con sus ganancias va a invertir en fruta D. temporada y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Srta. Lupita, as she is affectionately called by her friends and relatives, is originally from the town of San Felipe D. Los Alzati in the State of Michoacán. She is 24 years old. Lupita is able to keep her mobile grocery business stocked with products such as soap, beans, toilet paper, sugar, oil, flour, chili peppers, shampoos, and other basic necessities. Lupita sets up her business at the local markets in different towns within the region such as Angangueo, El Rosario, Zirahuato, Melchor Ocampo, and other locations. She says she started this type of business because her parents taught her at a young age since they operated mobile grocery stores and sold fruits and vegetables. Lupita has been in business for approximately ten years. She acquires her products from different stores in the towns of Zitacuaro, Michoacán, and Toluca in the State of Mexico.

Lupita wants to improve her home because water seeps in during the rainy season since the structure is maD. of laminate sheeting. She is single and lives with her parents who help with the expenses. Lupita says, “Now that my parents are older, my siblings and I want to support them in the same manner as they did with us.” One of her goals is to buy a truck so that she can travel to the different markets where she sells her products. She also dreams of helping her parents by starting another mobile business that they can manage near their home because traveling to the different markets can be tiring since one must wake up at 2 or 3am in order to get to the place where the merchandise is being sold. Lupita says she will use her earnings to invest in seasonal fruits and make improvements to her living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her mobile grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build a porch

loans.name: Mirna Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirna María O. M., es madre soltera de tres  hijos de los cuales todos están a su cargo, actualmente se dedica a la venta de plástico  en el mercado la estación de la ciudad de León, cabe mencionar que lleva 12 años dedicados a esta labor, lo que ha venido ayudarle a mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia,  realiza su compra de platicos dos veces por semana en la ciudad de Managua y las piñata  las elabora personalmente ella. 
Cabe mencionar que con los créditos que Ceprodel  le ha brindado a  logrado a incrementar su inventario con productos de mejor calidad y así  tiene mayores venta lo que le ayudado tener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirna María O. M. is a single mother of three children, all of whom are in her care. She currently sells plastics at the station market in the city of León. It should be mentioned that she has devoted twelve years to this business, which has helped improve the living conditions for herself and her family. Mirna buys plastics twice a week in the city of Managua. She personally makes piñatas, which she also sells.

The loans from CEPRODEL have allowed her to increase her inventory by acquiring products of better quality. As a result, she has generated better sales which means she has more income.

loans.use: Purchase plastic goods & supplies for making piñatas

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 41 años, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En su pequeño Paucarmarca Julia a pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de choclo, papa y arveja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener ella sola a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal pues es muy activa y muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus chacras.
texts.en: Julia, 41, is a hardworking and loving single mother.  She lives in her own home with her 4 beloved children, and what she wants most is to improve their quality of life.  Julia has lived in small Paucarmarca for most of her life.  When she was a small girl she learned farming from her family, and so now she cultivates corn, potatoes and peas.  This work has given her the income she needs to support her family on her own.  She sells everything that she harvests in the wholesale market of Tarma, which is where she can get the best prices for her products.  What she likes most about her work is sowing her fields, which she does with a lot of care.  She has been farming for 21 years, and what she considers most difficult is transporting her products to the wholesale market, since means of transportation are scarce in her area.  Over time, she wants to buy new land so that she can increase her production.  This is her 6th loan with MFP, and she has been very punctual with her payments and expects to continue to do so now.  In her communal bank, she is very active and is well-liked by her fellow group members.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy organic and chemical fertilizers for her farmlands.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es: Vida Luz esta señora tiene una pulpería, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su familia, a pesar de los diferentes desafíos como es el aumento de los precios de algunos productos. Su deseo es que su negocio salga adelante para que sea auto sostenible además le gustaría que su negocio aumentara. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para comprar jabón, detergente, granos básicos, golosinas, y otros productos para el hogar.
texts.en: Vida Luz has a small general store.  She is a very hardworking woman who has had this business for more than 3 years.  She started the business because she needed to cover the household expenses, and she was facing a challenge in this regard because of rising prices.  She hopes that her business can continue to move forward and become self-sustaining, and in addition, she would like for her business to grow.  The financing that she requests is for working capital that she will use to buy soap, detergent, staple grains, candy, and other household products.

loans.use: working capital to buy soap, detergent, staple grains, candy, and other household products

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Alonso de 43 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Para ella la crianza de ganado es una actividad que ha ido aprendiendo a lo largo de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió este trabajo de sus padres, quienes se esforzaron mucho para darle una buena vida. Sus animales los lleva a vender a la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Tarma, donde consigue unos buenos precios, ya que sus reses son las más grandes y fuertes de toda la feria, debido a los buenos cuidados que ella les brinda. Lleva 26 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, espera más adelante poder incrementar el numero de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria, ya que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, igual como hizo con sus anteriores créditos, ella es una socia muy alegre y querida en su banco comunal y espera poder seguir trabajando bien con todas sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una ternera para criarla y alimentarla y con lo que sobre comprará forraje para su ganado.
texts.en:
Wilma, 39, is a loving and hardworking mother.  She lives in her parent's house along with her husband Alonso, 43, and her 4 beloved children, who are the main motivation for all of her efforts.  For her, raising livestock is an activity that she has been learning throughout her life.  From the time that she was very young she learned this trade from her parents, who worked hard to give her a good life.  She takes her animals to sell in the livestock market in the city of Tarma.  There she gets good prices, since her cows are the biggest and strongest in the whole market as a result of the care that she gives them.  

She has been doing this type of work for 26 years, and what she likes most is feeding the animals.  In the future, she hopes to increase the number of cows that she has and in this way increase her income.  What she considers most difficult is transporting her livestock to the market, since this is very tiring, but she knows she has to do it and she is ready to work very hard to reach her goals.  This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she has a strong desire to make her payments on time, just as she did with her previous loans.  She is a cheerful and well-liked member of her communal bank, and she hopes to continue to work well with all of the other members.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy a calf to raise and to feed, and with the rest of the money she will buy fodder for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo R. C. de 25 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Veronica Perez Garzon quien se dedica al hogar, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad que se llama Leandro. El señor Abelardo es de la localidad del Paso de la Reyna esta situado en el municipio de Santigo Jamiltepec en el estado de Oaxaca.
El señor Abelardo se dedica a la compra de cerditos para engordar para despues venderlos a las carnicerias o las personas que necesiten alguno de estos animales. 
El tiene cuatro años realizando esta actividad ya anteriormente se dedciaba a la agricultura a la cosecha de maiz.
Abelardo solicito el prestamo para poder comprar mas cerditos y engrandecer su criadero y asi vender mas y tener mas ganancias para que asi pueda mantener a su esposa y a su hijo ya que el sueña que su hijo tenga una profesion para que pueda tener mas oportunidades de trabajo no sufra tanto como el que ahi ocasiones en que no ahi ventas y tienen que abstenerse a muchas cosas.
El agradece a Dios por todas las bendiciones que le dá y tambien a las personas que apoyan a FRAC para que sigan realizando prestamos a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Mr. Abelardo R. C. is 25 years old and married to Mrs. Veronica Perez Garzon who works in the home. They have a 1 year old son named Leandro. Mr. Abelardo is from Paso de la Reyna in the city of Santiago Jamiltepec in the state of Oaxaca.

Mr. Abelardo works buying piglets to fatten and later sell to butchers or other people who want them. He has been doing this work for four years and previously worked harvesting corn.

Abelardo is asking for a loan to be able to buy more piglets to increase his numbers and be able to sell more and earn more money. In this way, he will be able to support his wife and their son. He dreams that his son will someday be a professional so that he will have more opportunities for employment and not struggle as he sometimes has when sales are down and they have had to do without many things.

He is thankful to God for all of the blessings He gives him and also to the people who support FRAC so that they can keep loaning money to those who need it.

loans.use: To buy pigs for sale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria B. es de la poblacion del Paso de la Reyna tiene 28 años ella vive en union libre con el señor Julio Cesar Magadan Torres. Tiene dos hijos uno de 8 años de edad que estudia la primaria y otro de 6 meses. Rosa comenta que su pareja se fue a los Estados Unidos hace 4 meses debido a la necesidad de la falta de empleo en su poblacion, ya que anteriormente el se dedicaba al campo y casi no obtenia ganancias es por ello que se fue de su poblacion para poderles dar una mejor vida a su familia. Rosa tiene una tienda de Abarrotes que inicio cuando su esposo le mando dinero desde los Estados Unidos en su tienda ela vende: azucar, arroz , frijol, jabon, papel higienico, galletas, aceite, veladoras, entre otros productos de consumo diario. Rosa solicito el prestamo para comprar mas productos para surtir su tienda. Ella comenta que sus ventas son muy buenas ya que es la unica tienda de abarrotes que esta en su colonia ademas de que son muy pocas las tiendas que existen en su poblacion, es por ello que la mayoria de sus vecinos les van a comprar.
Ella quisiera tener mas capital para poder comprar mas productos y tener un local mas grande para que asi las personas de su poblacion no tengan que ir a otra poblacion a realizar sus compras de productos de su consumo diario. Ademas de ayudar con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Maria B. is from the village of Paso de la Reyna. She is 28 and has a common law marriage to Julio Cesar Magadan Torres. She has two children, one is 8 years old and goes to school and the other is 6 months old. Rosa says her husband went to the United States 4 months ago because he had to, since there were no jobs in their town. Before that he worked the land and earned almost nothing, so he left the town to be able to give his family a better life. Rosa has a grocery store that she started when her husband sent her money from the United States. In her store she sells sugar, rice, beans, soap, toilet paper, cookies, oil, candles, and other basic necessities. Rosa is requesting the loan in order to purchase more products to stock her store. She says that her sales are very good since hers is the only grocery store in her neighborhood, and besides there are very few stores in the town, so the majority of her neighbors buy from her. She would like more capital so she can purchase more products and have a larger location so that the people in her town don't have to go to another town to shop for their basic necessities. Additionally this allows her to help with her family's expenses.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to sell, including oil, beans, rice, soap, sugar, toilet paper, and cookies, among other items.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
El señor Calixto J. T. de 79 años de edad es un señor viudo desde hace 9 años, tiene 7 hijos los cuales todos ya estan casados; el pertenece a la poblacion del paso de la reyna en el estado de Oaxaca.
Claixto se dedica al campo, siembra maiz, frijol, calabaza, ajonjoli, chile. Ademas se dedica a la compra de cerdos para la venta. El solicito el prestamo para poder comprar mas cerditos y poderlos criar para despues venderlos. Calixto comenta que le ah ido muy bien en sus cosechas sobre todo cuando la epoca de lluvia es muy buena  porque asi toda su cosecha dda buenos frutos, así tiene para comer y vender.
A Calixto le gusta mucho el campo pero casi no le deja mucha ganacia es por eso que el decidio invertir en la compra de cerdos. Para que asi pueda mantenerse ya que el vive solo. Sus hijos de vez en cuando le mandan un poco de dinero es por ello que el tiene que trabajar para poder sobrevivir.
Calixto quisiera tener un gran establo para poder criar mas cerditos y así poder tener mas ganancias y poder sobrevivir economicamente.
texts.en: Calixto J. T., 79, has been widowed for 9 years, and has 7 children who are all married. He lives in the village of Paso de la Reyna in Oaxaca. Calixto works the land, growing corn, beans, pumpkins, sesame seeds, and chiles. He also buys pigs to resell them. He requests the loan in order to purchase more piglets to raise and then sell. Calixto says that he has had very good harvests, especially when the rainy season is very good, because then all his crops have a good yield for him to eat and to sell. Calixto likes farming very much but he doesn't make much profit, which is why he decided to invest in buying pigs. He can support himself this way since he lives alone. His children occasionally send him a little money but he still needs to work in order to survive. Calixto would like to have a big stable so he could raise more piglets and make more money and be able to make ends meet.

loans.use: Purchase pigs to sell

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: El Sr L.  labora como conductor  es casado, tiene dos persona a su cargo,  es el primer  crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece  el apoyo que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción como  cemento madera cinz, cemento, mano de obra, para hacer una cocina para darle mejor condicion y ampliar la sala, esta institucion esta mejorando el nivel de vida de muchas persona nicaraguense y se le agradece porque si esta ayuda no podria realizar su sueño de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. L. works as a driver. He is married and has two people under his care. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, and he is very grateful for the support that they have given him with this loan, which he will use for home improvement.
