Esquipula is the name of this group and it is located in the colony named 5 de Mayo, in the city of Pinotepa Nacional in the state of Oaxaca. The group is made up of 10 members, of whom 8 are women and 2 are men. Each member has their own unique business. They all known each other because they are neighbors in the same colony. 

They chose the name for the group because the majority of the members are devoted to Cristo Negro de Esquipulas, very well known in Central America and southern Mexico.

The representative of this group is Epifania T. P.. She is 45 years old and she is a single mother of 2 children, 15 and 13 years of age. They are both in high school. She has been a professional stylist for 20 years. To start her business she took a course in the city of Acapulco. this business has been a great financial support and she has been able to make a modest living through it, supporting her children and in their schooling. In addition to this business she also sells snacks in the mornings, such as: toasted tortillas, enchiladas, tacos, and quesadillas at the 5 de Mayo high school, the same school where her children go.

Epifania requested a loan to purchase beauty supplies for her business. 

Another of the members of the group is Evodia P. H.. She is 67 years old and she is married to Elias T. Sanchez. He has been a farmer since he was a boy and this was the knowledge inherited to him by his parents. Evodia never went to school because her parents did not have the ability to give her an education. They were very humble people who only worked in the fields and in the home. She has 9 children and they are all married.

Evodia requests a loan to purchase ingredients to make and sell tamales, including: banana leaves, corn, lard, flour, cinnamon, and other ingredients. She makes various kinds of tamales including sweet tamales, delicacy tamales, chicken and sauce tamales, pork tamales, and other types. To make her sales she goes to the public market, located about 10 minutes from her house. she says that she has more sales in the month of December and many people place orders for the holidays when they have parties and observe Christmas Eve. Evodia learned the business when she was 15 years old from her mother. She has been learning new things with the passage of time. Her sales are very good and she is well known in the colony for the delicious tamales she makes. 

In addition to her tamales sales she also has a small enclosure where she raises chickens and cows. It is located 45 minutes from the place where she lives and she visits them every weekend. During the week her husband is who takes care of them and he also harvests various types of products, including corn, beans, watermelons, gourds, and chilies, products that they use for their personal consumption. It is the first time Evodia requests a loan from FRAC (Kiva Field Partner) but she has had loans with other organizations in the past. 

The members of the Esquipulas group are the following: 

Gudelia Agustina C. L.: she is 69 years old and she buys and sells fish. 
Evodia P. H.: she is 67 years old and she will buy ingredients to make tamales.
Jorge Banos R.: he is 57 years old and he will purchase motor fluids for his public transport van.
Adriana Estela H. T.: she is 30 years old and she will purchase ingredients to make snack foods.
Nabor Nazario Banos R.: he is 56 years old and he will purchase spare parts for his transport service.
Epifania T. P.: she is 45 years old and she will purchase beauty supplies for her beauty parlor. 
Angela R. L.: she is 21 years old and she will purchase ingredients to make traditional hot drinks for sale.
Maria Felipa V. L.: she is 39 years old and she will purchase corn to prepare foods for sale.
Rosa P. H.: she is 30 years old and she will purchase ingredients to prepare and sell tamales.
Aura Luz T.: she is 31 years old and she will purchase ingredients to make and sell tamales.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: David Miguel

texts.es:
DAVID MIGUEL F. G., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA EN MANTENIMIENTO,  PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON DAVID ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR UN MURO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA SU FAMILIA.
AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR LOS PRESTAMOS OTORGADOS YA QUE ESTOS HANSIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA.
texts.en:
David Miguel F. G. is from Managua. He is employed as a janitor. He has three children and they are school aged. 

David approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a new loan to be used for home improvements. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, and construction blocks. He will build a wall in his house. These home improvements are done to provide his family with better living conditions. 

He is thankful to Ceprodel for the loans that have been granted. They have been a used to carry out home improvements

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Las Guadalupes De San Jose Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Las Guadalupes D. San José” denominado así porque todas las mujeres que lo integran son muy devotas D. L. virgen D. Guadalupe y porque todas pertenecen a L. población D. San José del Progreso. San José del Progreso llamado así en honor al padre D. Jesucristo, posteriormente se le añadió el apellido D. “Progreso” en virtud D. que en épocas pasadas existió un gran auge económico en el municipio a causa D. los excedentes agrícolas que eran extraídos en L. región. Esta población está situada en el Municipio D. VilL. D. Tututepec D. Melchor Ocampo (en el Estado D. Oaxaca). Las principales actividades económicas D. esta población son L. Agricultura y Ganaderia. Este  es el primer grupo que L. Fundacion forma en esta localidad y esta conformado por 11 mujeres con diferentes actividades economicas.
L. representante D. este grupo es L. señora EsteL. E. M. D. 32 años D. edad, estudio hasta L. preparatoria, quien vive en unión libre con el señor Gerardo Sanabia M. quien es operador D. escavadoras ambos tienen 4 hijos: Tania D. 13 años, EsteL. D. 10 años, Gerardo D. 8 años y Luis D. 3 años, Tania estudia L. Secundaria, EsteL. y Gerardo L. Primaria. L. Señora EsteL. solicito el préstamo para L. compra D. calzado y compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales; ya que elL. se dedica en L. mañana a L. venta D. calzado por catalogos y en L. tarD. a L. venta D. tamales. EsteL. dice que le ah ido muy bien en sus negocios ya que tiene varios clientes, para vender sus productos los ofrece D. casa en casa.
L. señora Paulina Gazga López es integrante del grupo elL. tiene 59 años vive en unión libre con el señor Sebastian H. Zaguilan  D. oficio campesino ambos tienen 9 hijos  todos ya están casados solo tienen a una nieta a su cargo, Paulina es campesina se dedica a L. cosecha D. limones, papayas, chicozapote, maíz, frijol, entre otros, elL. comenta que L. cosecha que mas se venD. es el limón ya que en población existe una fabrica que procesa estos productos para hacer diferentes derivados es por lo cual elL. tiene ventas todo el año ya que su cosecha se los venD. a los dueños D. L. fabrica. ElL. solicito el préstamo para comprar liquido para fumigar sus tierras D. igual manera para comprar agua para el riego D. sus cosechas, es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que elL. y su esposo cosechan diferentes productos para venderlos, elL. sueña con engrandecer mas sus cosechas y que D. igual manera todas sus cosechas estén libres D. plagas ya que esta actividad es el sustento D. su familia. D. las ganancias que obtiene D. su negocio es para mantener a su familia y sobre todo a su nieta quien quedo a su cargo desD. que era una recién nacida.
ElL. esta contenta por pertenecer a L. Fundacion y que le hayan otorgado el préstamo  y agradece L. confianza que han depositado en ellas.
Las mujeres que integran este grupo son las siguientes: 
Paulina G. L.: D. 59 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. semillas y venta D. frutas.
Emiliana M. M.: D. 56 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. ropa para L. venta.
Maria Cleofas C. X: D. 58 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. pescados y mariscos para L. venta. 
Elva P. R.: D. 60 años D. edad se dedica a al compra D. insumos para L. venta D. antojitos, tamales y tacos.
Jesus H. H.: D. 46 años D. edad se dedica a al compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales.
EsteL. E. M.: D. 32 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. calzado y compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales.
Cristina C. H.: D. 61 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. antojitos.
Florinda H. D. L. R.: D. 73 años D. edad se dedica  a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. D. tortillas y antojitos. 
Gumercinda C. C.: D. 37 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales y antojitos.
Maria Remedios C. C.: D. 28 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. antojitos.
Clemencia C. A.: D. 22 años D. edad se dedica a L. compra D. insumos para L. elaboración y venta D. tamales y compra D. pescado y limón para L. venta.
texts.en:
The Las Guadalupes D. San José group is named this way because all of the women who make up the group are very devoted to the Virgin of Guadalupe.  Also, they all live in San José del Progreso.  San José del Progresso is named in honor of the father of Jesus Christ.  The name Progreso was added later because in the past there existed a great period of economic growth in the municipality because of the abundant agricultural production in the region. 

This town is in the VilL. D. Tutuepec D. Melchor Ocampo municipality (in the state of Oaxaca).  The town’s principal economic activities are farming and raising livestock.  This is the first group that the Fundación formed in this area.  It is comprised of 11 women with different business activities.

EsteL. E. M., age 32, is the representative of the group.  She attended school until high school.  She is in a common-law marriage with Gerardo Sanabia M., an excavations operator.  They have four children.  Tania is 13, EsteL. is 10, Gerardo is 8, and Luis is 3.  Tania attends high school, and EsteL. and Gerardo are in elementary school.

EsteL. requested the loan to buy footwear and to buy supplies to make and sell tamales.  In the morning she works selling shoes by catalogs.  In the afternoon she sells tamales.  EsteL. says that her businesses have gone very well for her.  She has various customers.  She sells her products door to door.

Paulina Gazga López is a member of the group.  She is 59 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Sebastian H. Zaguilan, a farmer.  They have nine children; all of them are married.  They only have one granddaughter under their care.  

Paulina is a farmer, and she grows lemons, papayas, “chio zapote” (an exotic tropical fruit), corn, and beans, among others.  She says that she sells lemons the most because there is a factory in the area that processes these products to make different lemon derivatives.  That is why she has sales all year round; she sells her harvest to the factory owners. She requested the loan to buy liquid to fumigate her land and to buy water to irrigate her crops.  

She is a very hard-working woman.  She and her husband grow different crops to sell.  She dreams of increasing her crops and that her crops are free from pests because this business activity feeds her family.  The earnings from her business are to support her family, especially her granddaughter.  Her granddaughter has been under her care since she was a newborn. 

She is happy to belong to the Fundación and that they have granted the loan.  She is grateful for the trust that they have shown in the members.

The following are the women who make up this group:

Paulina G. L., age 59, buys seeds and sells fruit

Emiliana M. M., age 56, buys clothing to sell 

Maria Cleofas C. X, age 58, buys fish and seafood to sell 

Elva P. R., age 60 buys supplies to sell snacks, tamales, and tacos

Jesus H. H., age 46, buys supplies to make and sell tamales 

EsteL. E. M., age 32, buys footwear and supplies to make and sell tamales 

Cristina C. H., age 61, buy supplies to make and sell snacks 

Florinda H. D. L. R., age 73, buys supplies to make and sell tortillas and snacks 

Gumercinda C. C., age 37, buy supplies to make and sell tamales and snacks

Maria Remedios C. C., age 28, buy supplies to make and sell snacks 

Clemencia C. A., age 22, buys supplies to make and sell tamales - also buy seafood and lemon to sell

loans.use: To buy footwear and supplies to make and sell tamales

loans.name: Leslie Alberto

texts.es: El Sr L. labora como ayudante de transporte  es  soltero,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar materiales bloque ,cemento ,estribo, clavo, hierro y mano de obra, para construir  muro de  su vivienda y darle mas segurida a su casa y su familia y espera que le siguen apoyando para  ir mejora mas.
texts.en: Mr. L. works as a transportation assistant. He is single and this is the first loan that CEPRODEL has given him. He is thankful for the opportunity they have offered with this expenditure to buy materials such as blocks, cement, supports, nails, iron and labor costs. This is to build a wall around his property and give his house and family more security. He hopes they will continue supporting him for more improvement.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el limoncito, está ubicado en el municipio de tecoanapa, los integrantes de este grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque así se llama la comunidad de donde la mayoría son originarios, esta historia es acerca de la señora María Lourdes L. R., puesto que es una de las integrante de este grupo, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada, tiene 4 hijos, José Luis, miguel Ángel, adelma y Erika de los cuales solo la menor estudia, está cursando el tercer año de secundaria, ya que los demás todos están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de carne, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio.

María eligió esta actividad, puesto que es lo que mejor se vende en su comunidad, también porque dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, que le ayuda para continuar apoyando la economía de su familia, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas marranos y carne para continuar con sus ventas. 

Dice que su negocio le está beneficiando muchísimo, ya que está mejorando su calidad y la de su familia, al igual que ahora podrá apoyar más y mejor a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, también empezara a tener una buena solvencia económica.

La meta que dice tener doña María para su negocio, es la de continuar invirtiéndole mucho mas, ya que lo quiere hacer crecer, puesto que está pensando en construir un local, para poner una carnicería, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias y así continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional y un mejor futuro.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen perfectamente y son personas muy responsables con sus pagos y sobre todo bien trabajadores.

Estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada uno de los integrantes del grupo el limoncito.
Luciana R. M.-fruteria
Marcelina R. G.-frutería
Audifa J. R.-venta de refrescos
Elideth V. B.-venta de semillas
Eloísa C. R.-venta de perfumes
Vianey G. M.-venta de antojitos
Honorina G. S.-carniceria
Miriam S. R.-venta de calzado
María de Lourdes L. R.-carnicería
Odilia M. R.-abarrotes
Leonor C. R.-venta de maíz
Sulpicia B. L.-venta de pescados
Clara B. R.- venta de frijol
texts.en:
This group is called 'El Limoncito' (The Little Lemon), and is located in the Tecoanapa municipality. The group members decided to give the group this name because the community where most of them are from is called El Limoncito as well. This description is about Mrs María Lourdes L. R., who is one of the group members. She is 40, married and has 4 children - José Luis, Miguel Ángel, Adelma and Erika. Only the youngest studies (in the third year of secondary school), as the rest are married. María sells meat, and has had her business for more than 10 years. 

María chose this activity as it is the best thing to sell in her community, and also because she says it is a very good source of income which helps her to continue supporting her family. María will invest her loan in the purchase of more pigs and meat to continue her sales. 

She says that her business has benefitted her a lot, as she is improving the quality of life for her and her family, and she can now support her husband more with the household costs and her childrens' education. She is also starting to establish a good economic situation.  

María's goal for her business is that she continues to invest in it, as she wants it to grow. She is thinking about constructing premises to establish a butcher's shop, to improve her earnings and in this way continue supporting her children with their studies, so that they can gave a good professional career and a better future. 

She tells us that the group works very well, as all the members know each other perfectly well and are very reponsible with their repayments, and above all, are hard workers. 

These are the names of the members of El Limonicito and their associated activities:

Luciana R. M arin - fruit shop
Marcelina R. G. - fruit shop
Audifa J. R. - drink sales
Elideth V. B. - seed sales
Eloísa C. R. - perfume sales
Vianey G. M. - snack sales
Honorina G. S. - butchery
Miriam S. R. - shoe sales
María de Lourdes L. R. - butchery
OdiliaM. R. - grocery sales
Leonor C. R. - maize sales
Sulpicia B. L. - fish sales
Clara B. R. - lentil sales

loans.use: Invest loan in purchasing pigs and meat to continue business

loans.name: Wilmer Manual

texts.es: El Sr S. labora como ayudante fontanero  es  casado, tiene tres hijos a su cargo,   es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar materiales bloque ,cemento ,estribo, clavo, hierro y mano de obra, para construir  un cuarto de  su vivienda para darle una mejor condicion de vida a mi familiares ya que esta creciendo.
texts.en: Mr S. works as a plumber's helper. He is married and has 3 children in his care. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL and he is thankful for the support he has been given. With this loan he will purchase cement blocks, cement, supports, nails, iron and labour hours, to construct another room in his house to give his family better living conditions as they are growing.

loans.use: Improve house

loans.name: Lomita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama lomita esta ubicado en la localidad de las animas, perteneciente al municipio de tecoanapa guerrero, los integrantes del grupo decidieron  ponerle este nombre puesto que asi se llama la colonia donde viven y todas pertenecen a esta misma.
La historia es acerca de la señora Elena V. M., ya que es la representante del grupo, ella es casada su esposo se llama Felipe, cuenta con 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos anelis y maricela, de los cuales los dos estudian, la mayor esta en primer año de primaria y la otra esta  en primer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la repostería,(venta de pasteles, flanes, gelatinas y postres).

Elena se decidió por ese negocio ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda, puesto que únicamente vende en su casa y le deja muy buenas ganancias, además tiene muchos clientes, ella ya lleva mas de 5 años con su  negocio, e invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes y materia prima como son: mantequilla, moldes, grenetina, polvo para hornear, harina, huevos, levadura y algunas frutas, para continuar con la elaboración de sus productos.

Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio, ella esta ahorrando para construir una barda a su casa y también esta apoyando a su esposo con el sustento de la casa aunque no son muchos los gastos ya que sus hijos todavía están pequeños.

Comenta que su negocio está beneficiando mucho a los vecinos de su colonia, ya que no hay muchas personas que vendan estos productos ahí cerca, puesto que todas las tiendas están hasta el municipio y ella aprovecha por que algunos de sus vecinos no les gusta salir hasta el centro y así que como esta mas cerca van a comprar ahí, también por la atención y servicio que les brinda. 

El sueño que tiene doña Elena y espera algún día poder cumplirlo es el de construir un local ahí mismo en su casa para poner una pastelería, ya que es su anhelo mas grande, para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y así continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y asegurar su futuro.

Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables, trabajadoras y puntuales, ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien, puesto que viven en la misma comunidad.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.

Los integrantes de lomita y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes:
Irma G. D.-venta de pollos
Isabel M. ZaM.-venta de pollos
Cipriana M. B.-frutería
Ysmelda G. L.-venta de tamales
Yurivia G. L. -dulceria
Domitila G. G.-frutería
Elena V. M.-reposteria
Ortencia M. ZaM.-venta de perfumes
Metodia G. M.-dulcería
Jeammy G. Rayón-venta de cosméticos
texts.en:
This group is called 'Lomita' and is located in the Las Animas locale, Tecoanapa Guerrero municipality. The group members decided to give the group this name as the district where they live goes by the same name, and all the members are from there. 

This description is about Mrs Elena V. M., who is the group's representative. She is married to Felipe, who is 27, and they have 2 children - Anelis and Maricela, who both study. The oldest is in the first year of primary school and the other is in the first year of preschool. Elena has a cake shop (selling cakes, flans, jellies and desserts). 

Elena decided to start her business as she says that there is a lot of demand. She sells from her home and generates good profits, as she also has many clients. Elena has had her business for more than 5 years. She will invest this loan in purchase more ingredients and primary materials such as butter, moulds, gelatin, baking powder, flour, eggs, yeast and some fruits, to continue making her products. 

With the earnings fro her business she is saving to construct a cement wall in her house and is also helping her husband to maintain the household, although the costs aren't large as their children as still small. 

She tells us that her business is benefitting many of her district's neighbours, as there aren't many people who sells this type of products nearby,  as all the shops are in the town and Elena takes advantage of the fact that some of her neighbours don't like going into the centre. As she is closer, they come to her to buy, and also because of the attention and services that she gives them. 

Elena's dream is to one day build her own shop in her house and install a cake shop. This is her biggestdream, to improve and increase her earnings and continue to support her children with their studies and give them a secure future. 

She tells us that the group members are very responsible, punctual and hard-working people, as she has known them for a long time and they get along well, as they all live in the same community. 

Elena is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the support that this loan has given her, as thanks to this her business is improving a lot. 

The members of Lomita and their respective activities are:

Irma G. D. - chicken sales
Isabel M. ZaM. - chicken sales
Cipriana M. B. - fruit sales
Ysmelda G. L. - tamale sales
Yurivia G. L. - sweet shop
Domitila G. G. - fruit shop
Elena V. M. - cake shop
Ortencia M. ZaM. - perfume sales
Metodia G. M. - sweet shop
Jeammy G. Rayón - cosmetic sales

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients such as butter, moulds, gelatin, baking powder, flour, eggs, yeast and fruit invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes y materia prima como

loans.name: Wilton Jose

texts.es: El Sr S. labora como cajero promotor  es  soltero, tiene un hijos a su cargo,   es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar materiales bloque ,cemento ,estribo, clavo, hierro y mano de obra, para construir  baño y servicio higiénico de  su vivienda para un mejor nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en: Mr S. works as a cashier and salesman.  He is single and has one child in his care.  This is the first loan that he has received from CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for the support that they are giving him with this loan which he will use to buy blocks, cement, braces, nails and iron, and to pay workmen to build a bathroom in his home.  This will improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To improve his home.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es:
RAMON DE JESUS C., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO COLECTOR,  PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON RAMON ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR UN MURO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION. AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR BRINDARLE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE MEJORAR SU CASA.
texts.en: Ramón de Jesús C. is from Managua and works as a collector.  He has three school-age children.  Ramón came to Ceprodel's offices to request a new loan to improve his home.  He will invest his money in buying building supplies such as cement, sand and blocks so that he can finish building a wall in his home.  This will help him to improve his home.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for providing him with the opportunity to improve his house.

loans.use: To buy building supplies

texts.en: Mr A. works as a plumbing assistant.  He is married and has five people in his care.  This is his first loan from Ceprodel and he is grateful for the support that they are giving him with this loan.  He will use the money to buy blocks, cement, braces, nails and iron, and to pay the workers who will build an extension on a room in his home.  This extension will improve his living conditions as he has a lot of children.

With this loan he will buy ceramic tiles, Boom (fast curing expanding foam used in construction), and labor to make improvements to his house.

With this loan she will pay for medical treatments, exams and medications for her father, who is currently in a very delicate state of health.

loans.name: Las Monarcas Recuperadas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Monarcas Recuperadas, porque para las integrantes del grupo la Mariposa Monarca simboliza la "reyna" de las mariposas, en México por su migración anual y su colorido que la diferencia de las demás. El grupo se encuentra en el Estado de Hidalgo, en México. El grupo está conformado por siete integrantes cada una siendo mujeres emprendedoras con un negocio establecido. La señora Leonor R. E.   es la tesorera del grupo. Ella tiene 43 años, estudió hasta la primaria. La señora tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su mismo domicilio, tiene cerca de 3 años con esta actividad. Aparte de la tienda de abarrotes hace unos meses inició con la venta de tamales en su hogar, con el fin de tener ingresos extras aparte de la tienda. La señora Leonor tiene dos hijos; uno de 3 años y otros 15 años, quienes actualmente estudian. La señora Leonor decidió dedicarse por su cuenta a alguna actividad que le ayudará a obtener algunos ingresos para así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida; por tal razón decidió dedicarse a la tienda de abarrotes ya que es una actividad sencilla y le permite tener tiempo disponible para atender sus actividades en el hogar sin dejar de descuidar principalmente a su familia. El crédito que solicito lo utilizará para la compra de mercancía.
texts.en: This group is called "Las Monarcas Recuperadas" (The Restored Monarchs), because for the members of the group, the Monarch butterfly symbolizes the "queen" of the butterflies.  This butterfly passes through Mexico on its annual migration, and its coloring is different from all of the others.  This group is located in the state of Hidalgo, Mexico.  It is made up of 7 members, each of them an enterprising woman with an established business.  Leonor R. is the group's treasurer.  She is 43 years old and has an elementary school education.  She has a store where she sells groceries that is located in her home, and she has had this business for 3 years.  In addition to the store, she also started up a business several months ago selling tamales from her home, with the goal of having an additional source of income.  Leonor has 2 children, aged 3 and 15, who are currently in school.  Leonor decided on her own to devote herself to an activity that would help her to obtain additional income so that she could give her family a better quality of life.  For this reason she decided to have a grocery store, and since this is a simple business it allows her to have the time to attend to her household activities without neglecting her family.  The loan that she requests will be used to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
ROSALIA P., ES DE MANAGUA, TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE GOLOSINAS, GASEOSA, GALLETAS, TIENE MAS DE 4 AÑOS ADE TENER EL NEGOCIO.
ES MADRE DE TRES HIJOS, PERO SOLO UNA DEPENDE DE ELLA Y ESTA SE ENCUENTRA EN EL COLEGIO.
DOÑA ROSALIA ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA  INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU NEGOCIO.
ROSALIA DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL SU NEGOCIO HA CRECIDO Y AHOR APUEDE HACERLE FRENTE A LA COMPETENCIA.
texts.en:
Rosalia P. is from Managua.  She has a business selling candy, soft drinks and cookies.  She has had this business for more than 4 years.

Rosalia is the mother of 3 children, but only one of them is still in school and dependent upon her.  

Rosalia came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan to invest in merchandise for her business.  

Rosalia says that thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL, her business has grown and now she can keep up with the competition.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy and cookies.

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada  Concepcion De Tambocucho Group

texts.en:
The rural community bank “Virgin of the Immaculate Conception” is in Tambocucho, where many people raise animals and work in agriculture. The group is in its 3rd loan cycle, and has 11 members with different businesses, such as selling goods such as animals, grains, and groceries, raising animals, and working in agriculture.

One of the bank's members, Maria, is married, and has 6 children aged 12 to 18 who are all in school. For 15 years she has had a business transporting cheese to sell in the markets in Ayacucho. She will be using her current loan of 200 PEN to buy more cheese from her community to sell in Ayacucho. She is grateful to FINCA Peru because they gave her loans and taught her to save, which has enabled her to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cheese to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El  Sr A. labora como técnico en sonido es casado tiene  dos persona a su cargo, es el octavo crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia las oportunidad que le  han brinda esta institución porque ha mejorado su nivel de vida,  este  desembolso lo ocupara  para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para hacer pared de su vivienda.
texts.en: This client is married and has 2 dependent children.  This is his 8th loan with CEPRODEL, and he is grateful for the opportunities that this institution has provided him because he has improved his standard of living.  With this loan he will buy construction materials such as: cement blocks, cement, sand, steel, gravel, braces, wire and labor to make a wall around his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
CARMEN MARIA M. T., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO OFICINISTA,  ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y DOS DE ELLOS ESTAN EN EL COLEGIO.
DOÑA CARMEN ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, PIEDRA Y PIEDRIN PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO.
CARMEN DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A BRINDADO MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Carmen Maria Muñoz T. is from Managua. She’s an office worker and the mother of three children, two of whom attend high school. Carmen has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel to ask for a new loan to make improvements to her house. She wishes to buy construction material such as cement, sand, stones and piedrin (a type of building stone) to finish building a room.

Carmen is grateful for the loans that Ceprodel provides. She has been able to improve her house and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: purchase construction material

loans.use: purchase land on which to build a home

loans.name: Ervin Francisco

texts.es:
ERVIN FRANCISCO H., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD,  ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y DOS DE ELLOS ESTAN EN EL COLEGIO.
DON ERVIN ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA DE HABITACION. 
ERVIN H. DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A BRINDADO MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Ervin Francisco H. is from Managua. He works as a security guard and is the father of three children, two of whom attend high school.

Ervin has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel to ask for a new loan to make improvements to his house. He wishes to buy construction material such as cement, sand, stones and piedrin (a type of building stone) to finish building his house.

Ervin is grateful for the loans obtained through Ceprodel. He has been able to improve his house and provide better living conditions for his family.
