loans.name: Sergio Enrique

texts.es:
SERGIO ENRIQUE A. G., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJACOMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD,  ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE CUATRO HIJOS Y TRES DE ELLOS ESTAN EN EL COLEGIO.
DON SERGIO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA DE HABITACION. 
SERGIO DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA.
texts.en:
Sergio is from Managua and works as a security agent.  He is the father of a family with four children, three of whom are in school.

Sergio came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan for improving his home.  He will invest in purchasing construction materials such as cement, sand, and blocks to finish constructing his house of residence.

Sergio says that thanks to the financing received from CEPRODEL he has been able to improve his house.

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO FINISH HIS HOME

loans.name: Lesly De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La señora Lesly de los ángeles es casada tiene dos hijos en edad escolar ella solicita crédito para comprar a sus hijos  los útiles escolares los libros y las mochilas ya que es urgente ya entraron en esta semana.es un crédito nuevo, agradece a CEPRODEL su agilización en el préstamo
texts.en: Lesly de los Angeles is married and she has two school-aged children. She requests a loan to purchase school supplies for her children, including books and school bags. It is urgent because they have already been in school for a week. This is a new loan and she is thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for granting this loan to her.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Aurelia Lucia

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de san Jacinto,  es casada con 2 hijos, los que estudian en colegios de león, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de primaria, ubicada en el colegio Sara maría parrales, con el cual se firmo convenio de financiamiento, esta señora tiene 25 años de desempeñar dicha actividad, en cuanto a los financiamientos es el segundo que obtiene atraves del convenio, el cual le han venido ayudar a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: She is originally from the community of San Jacinto. She is married and she has 2 children, both of whom are in school in Leon. She works as a primary school teacher at the Sara Maria Parrales schools and it is how she is able to take on this loan. She has had her business for 25 years and this second loan will help her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Gloria", porque así se llama una flor de la región, la señora Ofelia Ortiz Cabañas es una integrante del grupo, tiene 52 años, 6 hijos; 2 mujeres y 4 hombres. Ella vive en el Estado de México. Solicitó su prestamo para su negocio de barbacoa ya que tiene muchos clientes, ellos comentan que la barbacoa que vende es muy rica y tiene siempre muy limpio. La señora Ofelia comenta que aveces no se da a basto y necesita invertir más en los insumos y en un futuro con las ganancias poder tener un local estable. Se siente feliz de poder contribuir con el gasto familar. Además de sentirse afortunada de tener la oportunidad de tener un credito para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: This group chose the name Gloria for a kind of flower that is common to the region.  Sra. Ofelia Ortiz Cabanas, 52, is a member of the group.  She has 6 children, 2 girls and 4 boys and lives in Mexico.  She will use this loan to support her barbecue business.  She has a lot of customers and they say that her barbecue is especially good.  Sra. Ofelia says that she can't always handle the demand for her barbecue and that she needs to buy more supplies to keep up.  She hopes that her earnings from the business will provide her with a stable future.  Sra. Ofelia is pleased that she can contribute to the family's income.  She is also grateful to lenders for giving her a chance to build a better future.

loans.use: Stock supplies for food business.

loans.name: Magda Simona

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca el jicarito, es casada, solo tiene una  hija la que estudia en la universidad en león, esta señora actualmente esta laborando en el colegio del jicarito desempeñándose como secretaria de dicho colegio, del cual tiene 11 años de laborar, además esta señora ha sido clienta desde el 2002 con los créditos convencionales, este es el segundo que obtiene atraves del convenio firmado con dicho colegio, ya que en total son 8 financiamientos los cuales le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: She is originally from the community of Jicarito. She is married and she has only one daughter and she is in university at Leon. She is currently employed at the school in Jicarito, working as a secretary. She has 11 years in the position and she has also been the recipient of loans since 2002. This is the second loan she has access from Convenio through the school, and in total there have been 8 loans. They have helped her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Aleida Del Carmen

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la cuidad de león, es madre soltera solo tiene un hijo , el cual estudia en los colegios de león, actualmente ella trabaja como maestro en el colegio Sara maría parrales del poblado de san Jacinto jurisdicción de telica, esta señora es el segundo crédito obtenido atraves del convenio de financiamientos con él antes mencionado, el cual le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en: She is originally from the city of Leon. She is a single mother and she has only one son and he is attending school in Leon. She works as a teacher in the Sara Maria Parrales school in the community of San Jancinto, of the Telica jurisdiction. This is the second loan she has obtained through Convenio. The loans have helped her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Etanislada Norma

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca el jicarito, soltera con 2 hijos los que estudian en el colegio de la localidad, actualmente está trabajando como maestro en el colegio sara maría parrales del poblado de san Jacinto, del cual tiene 26 años de desempeñar dicha labor, este cliente es el segundo crédito que obtiene con la empresa, lo ha efectuado atraves del convenio de financiamiento con dicho colegio, ya que dichos créditos le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y el nivel de vida.
texts.en: She is originally from the community of Jicarito. She is single and she has 2 children who are in school in the community. She works as a teacher in the Sara Maria Parrales school in the community of San Jancinto. She has 26 years in the business and it is the second loan she has accessed through the organization. She has accessed them through Convenio at the school. These loans have helped her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca el ojochal kilometro  112 carretera león san Isidro, es soltera tiene un hijo, actualmente se desempeña como  maestra de primaria en el colegio del poblado de san Jacinto Sara maría parrales, este cliente es el segundo crédito con la empresa atraves del convenio de financiamiento con dicho colegio, esta señora tiene de laborar en esta area 26 años , los financiamientos les han ayudado a mejorar su condición y nivel de vida
texts.en: This client comes from the Ojochal area, kilometer 112 on the León San Isidro Road. She is single and has one son. Right now she works as a primary school teacher at the Sara María Parrales school in  San Jacinto. This is her second loan with the organization through the financial agreement with the school. She has worked in this area for 26 years. The loans have helped her improve her quality of life and living conditions.

loans.use: Housing improvements - purchase doors and clay bricks

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca el jicarito, jurisdicción de telica, es casada con 2 hijos mayores los cuales estudian en las universidades de león, su esposo es también cliente de la empresa en el rubro agrícola ya que él es pequeño agricultor, ella actualmente se desempeña como Director del centro escolar el jicarito, ella siempre ha sido fiel en sus solicitudes desde el 2002 y actualmente tiene un nuevo financiamiento atravez de convenio firmado por ella misma para beneficiar a los maestros del colegio que ella dirige, ya que los financiamientos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y el nivel de vida
texts.en: This client is originally from the Nicaraguan town of Jicarito in Telica.  She is married with 2 grown children, both studying at universities in Leon.  Her husband is also a client of the bank.  He operates a small farming operation.  She is currently working as director of a school in Jicarito.  She has a long history, from 2002, of working with the bank and she has now signed a new loan agreement to benefit the teachers at the school that she heads.  This loan will help help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Construction materials for repairs to house.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a widow who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a tricycle business. She has two children who are 22 and 26 years old. Amada joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amada has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 22nd loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to use as funds for her business operation so that she can continue to save up for the future, house repair and household expenses. Amada is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en:
Mariel is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fishing business.  Her husband Raul, who is 36 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have two children who are 2 and 4 years old. Mariel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mariel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy fishing nets and other equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and house repairs. Mariel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and equipment

loans.name: Bethzaida Anabell

texts.es: La Sra. Bethzaida Anabell S. E. ella es trabajadora activa de una Entidad estatal desempeñándose como Conserje  tiene cuatro años  de trabajar para esta institución es Casada actualmente, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Bethzaida Anabell S. E. currently works as a custodian for a government organization and has done so for four years. She is married and has three school-aged children. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc., to improve and enlarge the house where she lives. The loans with CEPRODEL have been of great help to her since through them she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials - sand, cement, stone, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Somreang

texts.en: Mrs. Somreang S. is a widow with seven children - five sons and two daughters. Three of them are married; one is a motorcycle repairman, one sells grocery items, one is a weaver and one is a garment factory worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Somroeung is a weaver. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help with her daughter’s grocery store by purchasing more grocery items and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy items for her daughter’s grocery store and to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim H., 39 years old, and her husband, Mr. Theng Voch, 38 years old, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have four sons, three of whom attend school and one who is still young. 

Sim is a garment factory worker. Her husband sells fruit (mango and guava); he buys it from fellow villagers under contract and transports it to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Sim is asking for her first loan of $500 to help her husband purchase mango under contract for resale.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase mango under contract for resale

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a bakery and a fishing business. Her husband Pedrito, who is 62 years old, works as a baker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have 11 children who are between 18 and 39 years old. Quirina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Quirina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 16,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund the operation of her bakery and fishing businesses so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and family needs. Quirina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund the operation of her bakery

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina del Carmen C. G. ella es trabajadora activa de una Empresa estatal desempeñándose como Asistente Fiscal tiene ocho años  de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Carolina del Carmen C. G. currently works for a government agency as a Financial Assistant, and has done so for eight years. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc., to improve and enlarge the house where she lives. These loans with CEPRODEL have been of great help to her since through them she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials - sand, cement, stone, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fishing business and ""Pawid or nipa"" making. Her husband Jesus, who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 11 and 30 years old. Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alicia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,300, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy fishing nets and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Alicia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina K. and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn Sann, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter. 

Dina sells roasted fish, and her husband is a construction worker who also drives a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) taxi. Dina has already asked for a Kiva loan. She is now requesting another loan of $600 to expand the space of the shop where she sells roasted fish.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en:
Mr. Chreng Y. and his wife, Mrs. Kheang Oum, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They and have five sons and one daughter. 

Chreng and his wife produce rice wine and have raised pigs for 15 years. He applied for a Kiva loan once before; he hopes to continue expanding his business so he is applying for his second loan of $1,000.

loans.use: Producing rice wine and raising pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman who lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari store, electronic reloading and a food vending business. Her husband Carlito, who is 49 years old, works as an electrician and plumber to earn his living. She has five children who are between 20 and 28 years old. Susan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Susan has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 to use as funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future household expenses and savings. Susan is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsan S., 55, is a widow. She has no children and lives with her elderly mother, a nephew and a niece on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Kimsan is a weaver. She also buys finished fabric (silk and cotton) from fellow villagers for resale to a middleman in Phnom Penh. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand her business by purchasing additional silk and cotton products for resale.

loans.use: to purchase silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea C., 46 years old, and her husband, Mr. Ruon Pram, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have two daughters.  

Sothea is a weaver. She also buys finished fabric (silk and cotton) from fellow villagers for resale at a Phnom Penh market or other provinces far away from her home. Sothea is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional silk and cotton products for resale.

loans.use: to purchase additional silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials - sand, cement, stone, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Koemsok

texts.en:
Mrs. Koemsok H. and her husband, Mr. Phann Phuong, have been married since 1985. They have three sons and three daughters; two are married and live on their own and others have full-time employment. The family lives in a village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Koemsok H. stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business as a construction worker. Koemsok is asking for a loan of $800 to build a bathroom for family use and to purchase a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and to purchase a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law

loans.name: Soleman

texts.en:
Soleman, 38 years old, is married to Pudji, 39 years old, and they live in the village of Belo with 3 of their children: Fernando, 10 years old and in 4th grade; Stevan, 5 years old; and Billy, 2 years old.

Soleman runs a public minivan business to generate income for his family. He drives the minivan by himself. Soleman usually works from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. If the minivan works well, Soleman is able to generate about IDR 200,000 daily. However, there are times when the minivan has problems and doesn’t work well as it is quite old. This clearly affects Soleman's income, making him unable to finance his family's needs properly. In addition, since his wife is a housewife, there is no other income source for his family. To maintain his business, Soleman really needs additional capital to replace the old and worn parts of his minivan. The main parts that he needs to replace include 4 socket breakers and machine tools. He is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. Capital assistance will be very meaningful for Soleman in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his minivan

loans.name: Koemsour

texts.en:
Mrs. Koemsour S. and her husband, Mr. Champey Ngann, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1989 and have two daughters. 

Koemsour runs a grocery store in her village. She asked for a Kiva loan once to purchase more grocery items to resell. She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase more grocery items to respond to her customer’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Quezon, Palawan. She earns her living by selling vegetables .Her husband Jose, who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 6 and 19 years old, and all of them are currently going to school.  Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy more stock to sell and to fund farming operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of children and business expansion. Gemma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Lidia P. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia en el negocio de Venta de Granos Básicos  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación tiene quince  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad es casada actualmente, tiene un  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de productos varios como Arroz, Frijoles, Gaseosa, Golosinas, etc. y así   invertirle a su negocio para ampliarlo y mejorar la condición de  su negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ana Lidia P. is self-employed selling basic grains. Her business, which she has had for fifteen years, is run out of her house. She is married and has a school-aged son. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase products for her store such as rice, beans, sodas, sweets, etc., investing in her business in order to improve it and see it grow. These loans with CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to her since in this way she has improved the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase products for her store, such as rice, beans, soda, etc.

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorphorn T. is a widow with one son and two daughters, all of whom are in school. One is in university, one is in high school and one is in primary school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sorphorn T. is a weaver. She is asking for another loan of $1,000 to pay school fees for her daughter so she can continue her bachelor's degree at university. Sorphorn will use part of the loan to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter and to buy weaving materials

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, food vending and fishing. Her husband Godofredo, who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 10 children who are between 7 and 32 years old. Marina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,200, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy stock for the store and a new fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for future improvement of her business. Marina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store and a new fishing boat

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en:
Rosine is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: chicken barbecue, buying and selling charcoal and buying and selling livestock. She lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Rosine is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy more stock to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Aura Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Aura del Socorro  P. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia en el negocio de Venta de Ropa Usada y productos de la AVON ella vende de casa en casa ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes les entrega la mercadería y el producto tiene dos  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Pacas de Ropa  y así   invertirle a su negocio para ampliarlo y mejorar la condición de  su negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: For two years, Aura del Socorro  P. has been self-employed selling used clothing and Avon products. She sells door-to-door and then delivers the merchandise and products to her customers. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase bulk clothing packets, thereby investing in her business in order to improve the business and see it grow. These loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her since in this way she has improved the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase bulk packages of American clothing and Avon products.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon C. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Thy Em, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have one married daughter, who is a garment factory worker.   

Sokhon is a rice farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. She had asked for a Kiva loan once before to purchase a motorcycle which her husband uses to ride to work everyday. Sokhon want to buy one more motorbike for her daughter to ride to work at the factorg, so she is asking for another loan of $1,100.   She will also use a part of the loan to purchase a sugar cane juicing machine to sell sugar cane juice when she is not working on the farm.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike and sugar cane juicing machine

loans.name: Vannra

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannra T. (pictured with her young daughter) is 40 years old. Her husband, Mr. Bunly Kin, is 45 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have five children – one son with a full-time job in a hotel in Phnom Penh, and four daughters. One of their children is married, and the other three are in school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vannra stays at home and takes care of her children. The main source of income for her family comes from her husband’s business. He is a house builder. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Malin

texts.en:
Mrs. Malin K. (in the photo) used to be a cleaner at a restaurant in Phnom Penh. Now she is a chef at the same site. Her husband, Mr. Sopheap Sek, is a security guard. The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Malin is investing with her brother in a construction business. She is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase additional construction materials for her brother to work with.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for her brother construction business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase three pigs, corn and firewood. Compra de Tres cerdos, maíz y leña

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Salde, who is 44 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 10 and 18 years old. Vivian joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 29 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vivian has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 30th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Vivian is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Mrs. Savang P. (in the photo), 43, is a widow with one son. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savang stays at home. Her main source of income is from her son’s salary. He has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, where he is staying with his aunt. He hopes to return home in the evening so he can be near his mother and look after her. Hence Savang is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her son for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Aun S. is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Changly Thong, is 43 year-old (pictured together). They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1994 and have three children – one son and two daughters, all of them are in school.

Srey Aun is a garment factory worker. Her husband is lathe operator. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of auto parts to repair vehicle for transportation business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 31 years old, single and supports her family by operating shell crafting and buying and selling of RTW businesses.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. Arlene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arlene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy raw materials for her crafts business so that she can continue to save up for the future and the improvement of her business. Arlene is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for shell crafting

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mr. Mean U. is 39 yeas old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhan Chum, is 44 years old (pictured together).  They live about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children – three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married, two have full-time employment, one attends school, and one is still too young for school.

Mean is construction contractor. His wife sells Cambodian cakes.  She makes the cakes herself and sells them in the village. Mean is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials for his construction business.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction business

loans.name: Sombat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sombat Roeung (pictured with her husband) is 45 years old.  She and her husband, Mr. Kosal Sean, live in a village off National Road Number 2,  about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have two children – one son and one daughter, both are in school.

Sombat sells fruit and her husband drives a motor taxi. She is asking for a loan of US$1,100 to purchase her neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To purchase her land to expand property

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Miss. Sokhen C. is single and lives with her sister and mother in a village along National Road Number Four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She runs a grocery store from home in her village. In addition, she also rents space out of her house to garment factory workers because her house is located near a garment factory. 

Sokheng is asking for another loan of $1,200 to repair her house because it is broken in some parts.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Yazohara

texts.es: La Sra. Yazohara R. S.  ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia se dedica al negocio de venta de Ropa usa y ropa nueva ella brinda el servicio de casa en casa ella ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes le vende el producto y sus mismos clientes le recomiendan clientes nuevos  tiene seis  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casada actualmente, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  diez créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de paca de ropa  y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición del negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Yazohara R. S.  is hard-working woman who runs her own business selling used and new clothing. She runs her business out of her home, and she has steady clients who buy her merchandise and introduce her to new clients. She has had this business for six years. Yazohara is married with one school-age child. She has received ten loans from CEPRODEL, and she has used each one to purchase packs of clothing for her business. The loans from CEPRODEL have been of great benefit allowing her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of pack of used clothing (shirts, pants)

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha S. is 43 years old and his wife, Mrs. Samoeun Kan, is 45 years old.  They live along National Road Number One, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children – three sons and one daughter.  One of them is married, one attends school, one assists his parents in the business, and one is still too young for work or school.

Chantha and his wife sell mangoes. He also drives a  motor taxi when he is free. He is applying for his first loan of $800 to provide capital to his son-in-law to purchase piglets to raise and to build a pigpen.

loans.use: To provide capital his son-in-law to start pig raising business

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun S. is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Rithy Chey, is 34 years old.  They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have two young sons.    

Soeun is a garment factory worker, while her husband is construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband's work.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband’s construction business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis lives in a historic city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city in Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. She lives there in a 2-room house with her family in the area of Ismail Nagar. She moved here 12 years ago with her family.
 
Nargis is 54 years old and has 3 sons. All of her sons are married and do different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially. Her husband’s name is T. H. and he runs a grocery store in the community. Through his shop he offers daily use items such as sugar, salt, lentils and cold drinks to his clients. He has been operating this business for past 12 years and is well-known among his clients for his good behavior and customer dealings. 

Nargis is a housewife and prefers to stay at home to handle her household responsibilities. She is very good administrator and manages her household expenses very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband's grocery business. With the loan, he will add more groceries to his shop, which will help him making more sales and earn better profits. 

Nargis is a regular loan user of Asasah's.  This is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: La Sra. María Esther B. P. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia se dedica al negocio de venta de tortilla tostadas ella brinda el servicio en su  casa habitación ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes le vende el producto y sus mismos clientes le mandan  clientes nuevos  tiene siete  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Productos como Maíz, Leña  y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición del negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. María Esther B. P. is self-employed and runs a business selling fresh tortillas. She runs this business from her home. She has steady clients who buy her products and bring her new clients too. She has had this business for seven years and has one school-age child. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase corn, firewood, and other goods to help her business. The loans from CEPRODEL have been of great benefit allowing her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira del Carmen S. B. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia se dedica al negocio de venta de Comida ella brinda el servicio en su  casa habitación ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes le vende el producto y sus mismos clientes le mandan  clientes nuevos  tiene Diez años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casada actualmente  tiene dos  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Productos como Arroz, Frijoles, Pollo, Plátanos, Gaseosas  etc. y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición del negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Yadira del Carmen S. B. is self-employed selling food. She offers her services at her house and has a customer base to whom she sells her products and these clients send her new ones. She has done this work for ten years. She is married and currently has two school-aged children. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase products such as rice, beans, chicken, plantains, sodas, etc., thereby investing in and improving her business. These loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly since they have enabled her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase  rice, beans, chicken, plantains, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a very supportive lady by nature. She supports her husband financially by operating a grocery store in the community, through which she offers her clients daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar, cold drinks, spices, etc.  She also runs a clothes selling business, which she operates from her home. 

Shamim's husband is M. B..  He is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to passengers.  Shamim lives with her family in a three-room brick house in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is the 2nd largest city in Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. Shamim has lived there in the area of Asif town for past 25 years.   She is the mother of 1 son and 6 daughters. Her son is a lathe machine operator and her daughters stay at home and do household work. 

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy more variety of clothes, which will help her make more sales and earn better profits.   She has been operating this business for the past 8 years and has full confidence in herself that she will be able to make good changes to her business after investing this loan into it. 

Shamim is a new loan user of Asasah's. She hopes that this will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 55-year-old lady. At this age, she is unable to run any business, so she stays at home and manages her household responsibilities. Her husband’s name is A. A. and he operates a catering business. He offers his services at marriage ceremonies, parties, and other functions. 

Shamim lives in Lahore, Pakistan’s second largest city, known for its history and culture. She lives there in the area of Ismail Nagar with her family in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 22 years ago.  Shamim is the mother of 2 sons, both are married and work with their father in his catering business.  

Their family business is going well and they receive regular orders every month.  Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband’s catering business. With the loan, he will buy tents, crockery, table covers, etc. which will help him fulfill his customers' needs and complete  the orders on time. 

A. A. has been operating this business for past 22 years and Shamim is hopeful that an investment will be more profitable for him and earn him better profits. 

Shamim is a regular loan user of Asasah's.  This is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy tents, crockery, and table covers for catering business

loans.name: Hanifahon's Group

texts.en:
Hanifahon I., 19, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  In order to earn money,  Hanifahon sells fruits and vegetables seasonally with the help of her mom.  She is also engaged in the retail trade of fabrics and materials. Her mother started this activity 15 years ago with the initial investment of 8000 soms, and now the family together earns 27000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Hanifahon would like to increase the variety of fabrics and materials she can offer her customers. In the future, she is planning to celebrate her wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To  purchase fabrics and materials to resell

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis lives in Lahore, which is Pakistan’s second largest city and known for its history and culture. She lives there in the area of Ismail nagar with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved there 14 years ago. She is the mother of a daughter and 2 sons. Two of them study while the youngest one is only 3 years old. Her husband’s name is K. A. and he operates a catering business. He offers his catering services to people at different marriage ceremonies, parties etc.

Nargis is a housewife, who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s catering business. With the loan, he will buy tents, crockery and table covers, etc. which will help him fulfill larger orders on time and make extra income.  K. A. has been operating this business for past 9 years and Nargis is very hopeful that an investment will be more profitable for him and earn him better profits.

loans.use: To buy tents, crockery and table covers for catering business.

loans.name: Nkonge

texts.en:
Nkonge J. is an individual client from Mubende.  He is 40 years old and married with 6 children.  J. has a produce selling business where he buys and sells beans and maize.  He also has a store out of his home from which he sells as a wholesaler.  He is able to make 200,000 UGX in weekly profits and these help in in his other business ventures. 

He also has a milling machine and he is a farmer, providing some of the produce that he sells, as well as being a driver.  He has been in the business for 10 years and he needs a loan to be able purchase more stock.  He started the business using some capital that he had from driving and farming and his hard work has made him successful.  His dream is to be able to expand his business as well as educating his children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for more profitability.

loans.name: Ayatkan's Group

texts.en:
Ayatkan T., 57, is the leader of this group.  She is the resident of Balykchi, a small nice town in Isykul region.  Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension in amount of 2,600 KGS.  Together they bring up three daughters and a son.  The first daughter studies at university and the other children are in school.  

In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses, three years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS, the family started to breed cattle.  Reselling cattle after fattening they earn an additional 3,000 KGS per month.  With money received from the loan Ayatkan wants to purchase a horse for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for breeding.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food stall (native delicacies) and selling vegetables.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,800. Guillerma is borrowing PHP 19,500 to fund the seasonal business operations.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Guillerma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund seasonal business operations

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a home products sales business. Her husband Norman, who is 32 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 9 and 11 years old. Genelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Genelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Genelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her blanket sales business. She started this business 8 years ago to financially support her husband, who is a driver by profession and his income was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. With the loan, she will buy blankets in larger quantity which will allow her to sell to many more customers and make extra income. 

She lives in a 3 room brick house with her family in a small city called Kot radha kishen, which is located in Punjab Pakistan and is famous for its dairy industry. Her house is located in Judgewala, which is a small residential area of the city. She came here with her family 10 years ago. She is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her daughter is only 4 months old. She is hopeful that she will be able to make positive changes to her business by investing loan money into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: To buy blankets for selling.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a member of Maridadi group in Faulu Kenya.  To earn a living, she does tailoring.  She has been in the business for five years. In addition, she also does farming.  

She was previously selling second-hand clothes.  Being a mother of five, she works hard in her business to provide for her children.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been economically empowered.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested a second loan of 80,000 KES to buy fabric and thread.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ceasaria

texts.en:
Ceasaria C. is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by selling vegetables, farming and operating a tricycle transport business. Her husband Warlito, who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 13 and 38 years old. Ceasaria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ceasaria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ceasaria C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Emma is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 35 years old, married and with two children.  He does hair dressing to earn his daily bread.  He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income.   He has been engaged in the business for eleven years.  He runs the business with four employees.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his living standard has improved because his business has improved.  He has also learned how to manage his finances by saving his money.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy hair braids, hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy hair braids, hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 45 years old, married and has four children who go to school.  He runs a cereal shop to earn a living.  He has been running his business for nine years.  

He also works as a mechanic to earn extra income.  He has been able to work well as a mechanic because he bought tools with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to open a garage in the future.  

He has requested 60,000 kes to buy beans, peas and maize.

loans.use: To buy beans, peas and maize

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transport business. Her husband Victor, who is 30 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 4 and 9 years old. Helen Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 to buy an additional unit of motorcycle so that she can earn higher profits. Helen Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase an additional unit of transport vehicle

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 48 years old, married and a father of three.  He sells household goods to earn a living.  He has been running his business for 10 years.  He dreams of expanding his shop into wholesale in the future.  

Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to his family.  This is because he has been able to educate his children with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has requested 60,000 Kes to buy cups, plates, buckets and cooking pots.

loans.use: To buy cups, plates, buckets and cooking pots

loans.name: Basbubu's Group

texts.en:
Basbubu M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 45 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons and two daughters.  The first son went to work in Russia, the daughters are students and the second son is preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn money to meet her family's needs, Basbubu a year ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, started to breed livestock animals. She resells them at the higher price after she has fattened them. In this way, she earns 4,000 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs money to increase the number of livestock. In the future, Basbubu hopes to expand her business and save money to support her children financially. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Salina's Group

texts.en:
Salina D. C. is from the village of District 1. She is 41 years old. Salina is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Salina D. C. group.

Salina is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Salina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Salina has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Salina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Salina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Salina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is 42 years old, married and blessed with three children.  She sells clothes to earn a living for her family.  She has employed two people in her business.  She has engaged in the business for six years.  

She has been able to add business stock through her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  Hence her business has improved.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested 50,000 kes to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by fish vending and fishing. Her husband Mateo, who is 43 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have eight children who are between 2 and 15 years old. Emma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 24 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,700, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 25th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy a freezer for her fish. She is convinced that she can continue building a second story on her house and provide higher education to all her children. Emma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase an additonal freezer for her fish

loans.name: Muhabbathon's Group

texts.en:
Muhabbathon H. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a tractor driver. Together they are bringing up two sons and two daughters. All the children are students, except the youngest daughter; she is only one year old. In order to earn money Muhabbathon and her husband breed livestock. They have been doing it for 25 years. Reselling livestock animals at the higher price they earn 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase five more animals for breeding. In the future Muhabbathon wants to see her first son get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a widow who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by selling vegetables and operating a general store. Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gloria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 to buy additional vegetables and sell to the customer so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Gloria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable).
