loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a regular loan user of Asasah. She has maintained a good credit record in every loan year. This time she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband in expanding his bicycle repair business. Through the loan, her husband will buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools to provide better quality services to his clients. He has been operating this business for the past 7 years and Sakina is confident that an investment will bring more profits to her husband and improve his business conditions. 

She lives with her family in a small city of Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishan. Her home is located in the area of Judgewala, where she has been living for the past 20 years. She has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works in a factory while the remaining 2 stay at home. Sakina couldn’t provide them education due to financial constraints. 

She is hopeful that after the improvement of her husband’s business, she will be able to send her younger children to school soon. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools for bicycle repair business.

loans.name: Augastine

texts.en:
Augastine is a business-lady who runs a retail shop.  She has been operating the business for six years and has employed nine people.  She also sells detergents.  In addition, she does farming for extra income.  She was previously running a salon.  

Augastine has managed to enlarge her shop through Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kes to open another outlet for her business.

loans.use: To open another business outlet

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Mr. Chat T. has been a fisherman on the local river in the province of Siem Reap for over five years. His wife assists him in supporting their family by selling the fish in the busy market. The couple helps each other in order to ensure that their two single children finish high school.

 Mr. Chat T. always uses his old motorbike to pick up products up to sell every day. Unfortunately, the motor broke down during use. He wants to buy another one to replace the broken one, but his savings are insufficient to make this possible. In order to deal with this issue, Mr. Chat T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle in place of his broken one

loans.name: Zavur

texts.ru: Zavur G. rodilsya 1973 qodu. Zavur jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom , pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Zavur uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Seyhcas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupi ovec dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Zavur lubit svoyu rabotu tak kak s etoy rabotoy on mojet bolshe posveshat vremya svoyey semye i detyam.
texts.en: Zavur G. was born in 1973.  Zavur is married and has two children.  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and children.  Zavur has been working as a herdsman for five years. Currently, he needs 2300 AZN to buy sheep to expand his business.  Zavur loves his work because it allows him to spend more time with his family and children.

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 43 years old and married with four children.  He does tailoring and also runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He was previously doing poultry farming for a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business hence his living standards.  He hopes to enlarge his retail shop in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to open a store and another retail shop.

loans.use: To open a store and a retail shop

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul I. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near to Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). She is 49 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband, Ainagul has raised three sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at school, and the two older sons are married and live separately with their families. According to Kyrgyz traditions, the youngest son lives with his parents.

 In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Ainagul sells convenience goods at home. She started this activity seven years ago with the initial investment of 15,000 soms and now she earns 5200 soms per month. With money received from the loan Ainagul wants to increase her turnover and purchase a variety of convenience goods for sale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is a 54-year-old married who supports her family by selling frozen foods and meat.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Arcelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her frozen foods business. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Arcelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a livestock business. Her husband Alfredo, who is 42 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  They have three children who are between 1 and 10 years old. Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,300 uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy additional stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Marilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy M. M. is widowed with two children, aged 3 and 6.  

He supplies bread to earn a living. He has been running the business for six years and has employed two people.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business. He has requested 40,000 KES to open another business, employ two people and obtain a business license.

He aspires to become an international businessman in the future.

loans.use: To open another business, employ two people and obtain a business license

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Yon S. is a 45-year-old mother of four children who are studying in the local school. She is married to Horn, 37,  who owns a barber shop in a busy place in his community, Siem Reap province. 

Yon S. has a grocery store where she sells food and other simple daily use items to her neighbors. To make her business grow and become more successful, she would like to ask for a loan to buy some essential items for resale. 

These are the other borrowers of this group: 
T., who owns a grocery shop and is requesting her loan to buy more products for selling.  
N., who is a barber as well as a grocery seller and is applying for a loan to buy more cooking ingredients for sale. 
T., who runs a boat delivery service and is asking for a loan to repair the boat.

loans.use: To buy some essential items for resale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward O. A. is widowed with two children who are in school.  

He makes and sells clothes to earn a living. He has engaged in the business for five years and he has employed four people. With the income from his business, he is able to educate his children.  

 He has requested 30,000 KES to buy fabric and sewing yarn.

He hopes to open a cloth manufacturing factory in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing yarn

loans.name: Thouch

texts.en:
Thouch S. L. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Her husband shares the responsibility of supporting the family by working as a building worker. 

Thouch S. L. has been in the farming business since 1995. She owns a plot of farmland that she inherited from her parents. She is going to use her loan to add to her current savings to buy a plot of farmland that is in a good location for farming.

loans.use: To buy a new plot of farmland

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack O. O. is 34 years old, married and blessed with two school-going children.  

He sells clothes and bags to earn a living. He also works as a driver. He was previously running a grocery.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business and save his money. He hopes to grow his business more over the next five years. He is asking for 20,000 KES to build a store.

loans.use: To build a store

loans.name: Ulviyye

texts.ru: Ulviyye ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey materyu. Ulviyye A. rodilas v 1977 qodu. Ona vo vsem pomoqayet materi svoyey tak kak ona boleyet. Ulviyye seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit noviy kompyuter dlya raboti. Ulviyye uje 9 let kak rabotayet laborantkoy, tak je ona zanimayetsya narodnoy medicinoy lecheniye pocientov raznimi poleznimi travami.
texts.en: Ulviyye is single and childless.  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her mother.  Ulviyye A. was born in 1977.  She helps her ailing mother.  Ulviyye now needs 2300 AZN to buy a new computer for work.  Ulviyye has been working as a laboratory assistant for nine years now.  She also practices traditional medicine, treating patients with different beneficial herbs.

loans.use: buying a computer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 36-year-old single man.  He sells second-hand clothes so as to earn a living.  He has been running the business for two years.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would easily access loans.  He has also developed a culture of saving.  He hopes to grow his business and sell wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to add to his stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang C. is a 57-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Seang C. is married to Chin Troen, age 66. The couple work together in the farming business and have two children: one of the children is married and the other one is single. 

Recently, Seang C.'s rice hasn't grown well because it needs more fertilizer. So, Seang C. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing many sacks of fertilizer. With the rest of the funds, she will buy gasoline and to pay for transplanting rice seedlings for which she hired a few farm laborers before.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fertilizer, gasoline, and to pay for transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old single man.  He does printing and photocopy so as to earn his daily bread.  It's two years since he started the business.  He also does farming in his rural home to earn extra income.  He hopes to open other business outlets in the future. 

Joseph has requested a first loan of 20,000 Kes from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, he will buy photocopy paper, a machine for laminating and a paper cutter.

loans.use: To buy photocopy paper, a machine for laminating and a paper cutter

loans.name: Sulaika's Group

texts.en:
Sulaika R., 58, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). Unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two daughters; the first daughter works in Russia and the second works in a hospital.

 Five years ago with the initial investment of 20,000 soms, Sulaika started to breed cattle. Reselling cattle at the higher price she makes 4000 soms per month. Sulaika hopes to obtain the loan because she needs funds to cover medical expenses. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment

loans.name: Meti

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i rebonkom. Meti G. 29 let. Meti uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo starsheqo brata kotoriy toje zanimayetsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: This young man is married and has a child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his beloved wife and child.  Meti G. is 29 years old.  He has been working as a herdsman for seven years. Currently, he needs 2300 AZN to buy sheep to expand his business.  He started this business with his older brother who is also a herdsman.

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong N. is good at making meals for morning and evening time. She has a small shop where she sells noodles and gruel in a crowded place in her village in Battambong province. She can earn a profit of around $4 a day to support her family.  She has a life partner in her husband who is a rice farmer. 

Kong N. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. She also faces a problem: her shop is too old and not attractive to the customers. Kong N. would like to request a loan to be used to redecorate her shop which will allow her to add new customers to her clientele. She has seven children, three of whom are single. The remaining four are married. One of them provides phone-repair services.

loans.use: To redecorate her shop in order to attract new customers

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.ru: Sakhavat I. 26 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regiona, Alkhanli. Sakhavat ranshe zanimalsya prodajey fruktov i ovoshey, seychas on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Sakhavat v perviy raz on bral 1200$ , i za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lenderam. So vremeni pervoy ssudi u neqo v jizni proizoshli izmeneniya on jenilsya i seychas imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Seychas Sakhavat nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya biznessa.
texts.en: Sakhavat I. is 26 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region in Alkhanli.  Previously, Sakhavat sold fruit and vegetables, but now he works as a herdsman.  This is his second loan.  The first time, he borrowed $1200 and he is very thankful to the lenders.  His life has changed since he took out the first loan.  He has married and now has a child.  Currently, Sakhavat needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to expand his business.

loans.use: buying cows

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan S., from Phnom Penh, Cambodia,  is a 29-year-old farmer who lives together with her two single children. Yan S. has been doing farming since she was single. She has been married for many years to Kung Nov, 29, a car driver. This couple typically makes around $8.75 in profit each day to ensure that their family has a comfortable life. Yan S. will use her loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to his work place.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to his work place

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira T. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a constructor. Together they are bringing up a daughter and a son.  In order to earn money to meet the family needs Gulmira sells convenience goods, fruit, and vegetables. She started this activity seven years ago with the initial investment of 10,000 soms. She earns about 3000 soms per month.  

Gulmira hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to increase the variety of goods. Gulmira wants to purchase mandarins and lemons for resale. In the future she hopes to save money and start building a sauna at home.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase lemons and mandarins

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye C. est un homme marié de 26 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant chez son père, à Bougouni dans le quartier Massablacoura.
Ayant vite abandonné l’école, il décida d’apprendre le métier de tailleur auprès de son oncle.
De nos jours, Abdoulaye a 12 années d’expérience dans le domaine qu’il maîtrise bien et dans lequel il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Pour renforcer ses activités, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à sa première expérience.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter des tissus pour les coudre et les vendre à des particuliers et aux commerçants.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 35 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il compte améliorer son atelier afin d’attirer plus de clients et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye C. is 26, married and the father of one child.  He lives with his wife and child at his father’s house in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni.
Having left school early, he decided to learn to be a tailor from his uncle. 
At present, Abdoulaye has 12 years of experience with this kind of work which he has mastered well, and he is much in demand. 
To strengthen his business, he decided to take advantage of the credit program through Soro Yiriwaso for the first time. With this loan he plans to buy fabric to sew and sell to individuals and to merchants. 
He gets his supplies from wholesalers.  He plans to earn a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA.  With these earnings, he plans to make improvements to his workshop in order to attract more clients and to contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Mirlan

texts.ru:
Мирлан Беримкулов родился в городе Бишкек (Кыргызская Республика). Ему 41 год.   После 9 го класса, в 1985 году он поступил  в Сельское профессиональное техническое училище, по специальности тракторист механик. Через 3 года окончив училище, был призван в вооруженные силы СССР. В 1990 году окончив службу, переехал с города Бишкек в село Жаны-Алыш (Кеминского района, Кыргызская республика), так как в Бишкеке после распада Советского Союза работы не было, а в колхозе как раз требовались трактористы. Заработная плата была хорошей, ему удалось даже скопить деньги и купить небольшой домик в п. Орловка (Кеминский р-он, Кыргызстан), куда можно было привести молодую жену. Более 10 лет Мирлан работал по найму на тракторах и комбайнах, сам ухаживал и ремонтировал технику, а собрать деньги на собственную сельскохозяйственную машину не удавалось. И Мирлан начал по частям скупать сначала каркас трактора, потом двигатель и детали трактора. Так постепенно в течение 2-х лет мечта его семьи сбылась, настал день, когда трактор собранный руками мужа и отца впервые выехал на поле. Более 10 лет Мирлан оказывает услуги сельчанам по пахоте, боронованию, малованию (рыхление). В связи с ближайшим наступлением весенних работ, Мирлану необходимо подготовить свой старенький трактор к сезону, сделать капительный ремонт двигателя, заменить масло. И Мирлан обратился за кредитом  в сумме 80 000 сом (KGS) в Компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» уже в 3-й раз. 
Самая главная ценность для Мирлана - это его семья: жена и 3 малолетних детей школьников, он хочет дать хорошее образование своим детям, отправить учиться в Бишкек (столица) и еще улучшить свои жилищные условия – построить большой дом.  
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана.  "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Mirlan B. was born in the city of Bishkek (the Kirghiz Republic). He is 41 years old. In 1985 after the ninth grade, he entered the rural professional technical school to study tractor operations.  Three years after he finished school, he was conscripted into the Soviet military.  In 1990 after finishing his service, he moved from the city of Bishkek to the village Jeans-Alysh (in the Keminsky region of the Kirghiz republic).  There was no work in Bishkek after the disintegration of the Soviet Union, but on the collective farms, tractor operators were needed.  The wages were good, and he even managed to save money and buy a small house in Orlovka (in the Keminsky region of Kyrgyzstan) where he was able to bring his young wife. For more than ten years, Mirlan worked as a day laborer working with tractors and combines, and he looked after and repaired them himself.  It was not possible for him to save money to buy his own machine.  So, Mirlan began to buy a tractor in parts: first the tractor body, then the engine and then the tractor parts.  Gradually over two years, his family’s dream came true.  The day came when a tractor collected and built by the husband’s hands drove off for the field for the first time.  For more than ten years now,  Mirlan has rendered services to peasants by plowing land, harrowing, and loosening the soil. Because spring is coming, Mirlan must prepare the old tractor for the season, making large repairs on the engine and replacing the oil. Mirlan has asked for a loan of 80,000 Som (KGS) from Baj-Tushum and Partners for the third time. The most important thing to Mirlan is his family: his wife and three school-aged sons.  He wants to give the children a good foundation, to send them to study in Bishkek (the capital), and to further improve their living conditions by constructing a bigger house. 

The joint-stock company MFK Baj-Tushum and Partners distributes Kiva loans locally to socially-vulnerable populations. The joint-stock company MFK Baj-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-financial organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Baj-Tushum and Partners is a reliable financial partner which is contributing to development of economy in the Kirghiz Republic by granting accessible micro-financial services in the countryside and cities. These services are intended to create new jobs and are expected to be in the interest of both clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Modibo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modibo D. est homme marié de 26 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Niebala de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas pu continuer les études pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Modibo D. s’intéressa tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités  telles la vente de boisson non alcoolisée, mais sans succès. Alors il finit par apprendre auprès de son ami la vente d’habits, de chaussures; de radios, de cosmétiques, de tissus etc.
Avec une expérience de plus de 8 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour renforcer son activité, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  premier prêt, afin  d’acheter des tissus; des chemises, pantalons, parfums et pommades. Il s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et vend à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Modibo D. is married, 26 years old, and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in a nuclear family in the district of Niebala in Bougouni.

Unable to continue schooling because of social circumstances, Mr. Modibo D. became interested in earning money at an early age.  Over the years he tried different types of work such as selling non-alcoholic drinks, but without much success. Then he learned from a friend to trade in clothing, shoes, radios, cosmetics, fabric, etc. 

With over eight years of experience, he has mastered this business.  To strengthen his business, he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and he is now on his first loan.  He plans to buy fabric, shirts, pants, perfumes and hair products.  He gets his supplies in Burkina Faso and sells them to a diverse clientele. 

He plans to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA which will be used to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Ho

texts.en:
Ho S., 29 years old, is a humble villager living in Baray district, in Kompog Tom province. She is married and blessed with a young school-aged child, while her husband is a bed seller in the village. 

To earn a living, Ho S. sells many kinds of cake in the local school, earning an average of $2 per day. Recently, her husband has run out of raw materials from his stock, and now he would like to buy additional planks in order to make beds for resale. In order help support her husband’s business, Ho S. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To buy additional planks for making beds

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Né à Tièfala, préfecture de Bougouni, Monsieur Soumaila Samaké est homme marié de 46 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni.
Très vite il abandonna l’école au profits des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités telle la vente d’articles divers de boutique, mais sans succès.
Il finit par la suite  à apprendre le métier de collage de pneu et de soudure, auprès de son oncle. et depuis plus de 5 ans la vente d’articles divers tels les pièces détachées, les lubrifiants, la pneumatique etc. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’acheter, 4 cartons d’huile moteur, 5 pneus et  25 chambres à-air.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali.) Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent à été correctement remboursé.
Son atelier est situé au bord la route reliant Bougouni à Sikasso. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise.
texts.en:
Born in Tièfala, prefecture of Bougouni, Mr. Soumaila Samaké is married, 46 years old, and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the North Hérémakono district of the city of Bougouni.
He left school early to begin earning money.  Over the years he tried different types of work such as selling various boutique items, but without much success.
In the end, he learned to install tires and how to weld from his uncle, and for more than five years he has been selling various articles such as spare parts, lubricants, tires, etc. 
With a concern for better meeting the demand of his customers, he decided to get involved with Soro Yiriwaso so that he can buy 5 cases of motor oil, 5 tires and 25 inner tubes. 
He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). He is on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with the first loan having been properly repaid. 
His shop is located along the road connecting Bougouni and Sikasso.  His customers come from the local population.  He plans to make a monthly of 70,000 FCFA which will be used to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Badengna (La Parente) Group

texts.fr:
Badengna est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins  3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tel, les condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes (les concentrées de tomates, du maggi, ails, épices, du sel, oignon, piments, Sounbala  etc.), les habillements : des pagnes wax, des bazins et brodés ainsi que des habits pour enfants.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Assan Samaké est un membre du groupe Badengna qui vend exclusivement des condiments.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des condiments de toutes sortes, à Sincina auprès des jardiniers et au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle revend  en détail et au comptant au marché de Hamdallaye à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Badengna comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Assan Samaké compte réaliser 130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Badengna ("kinship") is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala. They live in traditional extened families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on the average 35 years old, are all married and have at least three children each. The group members sell diverse items. such as food condiments of all kinds (tomato concentrate, Maggi bouillion cubes, garlic, spices, salt, onion, peppers, Sounbala [traditional spicy seasoning from fermented seeds or beans]), clothing, wax “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabrics], “basins” [damask-type fabric] and embroidered fabrics as well as children’s outfits. In order to expand their business, two years ago the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. They are on their fourth group loan, having duly repaid all prior loans. 

Assan Samaké is a member of the Badengna group who sells exclusively condiments. She plans to use her loan in order to purchase different condiments from gardeners in Sincina as well as at the big market of Koutiala. She retails her goods for cash at the Hamdallaye market to a highly diverse customer base. While other members of the Badengna group plan to achieve a monthly income of 120,000 West African francs each at the end of the loan cycle, Assan Samaké plans to earn 130,000. Apart from repaying their loan, the group members use part of the revenue to pay for everyday family needs and to build up their working capital.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
In Kompong Tom, Ros K. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year in both rainy and dry seasons. She planted rice over one month ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer and some piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy a few sacks of fertilizer and some piglets to raise

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru:
Айгул Абдылдаева родилась в селе Алмалуу (Кеминский район, Кыргызская Республика).  Ей 48 лет. Она была четвертым ребенком в многодетной, малообеспеченной семье. Родители с раннего детства приучали своих детей к труду. Семья  Айгуль, как и все в селе занималась землей и скотом. Айгуль училась хорошо, у нее было желание учиться дальше, и после окончания средней школы  она приехала в г. Бишкек (столица Кыргызстана) и  поступила в Торговый Техникум в 1981 году. А через год  Айгуль засватали и выдали замуж. После замужества, Айгуль была вынуждена  перевестись на заочное обучение и переехать в село Самансур (Кеминский р-он, Кыргызстан) к мужу.  Муж Айгуль не стал препятствовать ей и помог закончить учебу, несмотря на то, что на руках уже были маленькие дети. В 1986 году, после получения диплома, Айгуль устроилась работать в магазин продавщицей, где проработала около 9 лет. После распадов коллективных хозяйств во время развала Советского Союза,  магазин, в котором работала Айгуль, стал частной собственностью, и она осталась без работы. На семью Айгуль был выделен небольшой участок земли, где муж занимался выращиванием зерновых и кормовых культур, и Айгуль принялась активно помогать мужу. Они вместе пахали землю, сеяли, удобряли. Год на год не приходился, иногда расходы по выращиванию не покрывали доходы после сбора урожая, но надо было поднимать детей, давать им образование. Через несколько лет, Айгуль пригласили в Сельскую консультационную службу Кеминского района предоставлять уроки по выращиванию новых сортов зерновых культур местному населению. Она активно участвует во всех общественных делах своего района и не сидит без дела.  У Айгуль 4 детей, 2 старших дочерей уже  замужем, а младшие дети - сын и дочь учатся в школе, и планируют дальше получить высшее образование в Бишкеке.  
В настоящее время Айгуль имеет небольшое хозяйство и содержит корову и баранов. Айгуль берет кредит в сумме 70, 000 сом (KGS), на который планирует увеличить поголовье скота – купить еще две  коровы и сделать небольшой запас корма до весны. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана.  "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Ajgul A. was born in the village Almaluu (in the Keminsky region of the Kirghiz Republic). She is 48 years old.  She was the fourth child of a large, poor family. Her parents got their children accustomed to work from a very young age.  Ajgul’s family, as well as everyone else in her village, worked in agriculture and animal husbandry.  Ajgul studied well and wanted to continue her education, so when she graduated from high school, she went to Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) and entered the Trading Technical School in 1981.  Within a year Ajgul, married. After her marriage, Ajgul transferred to correspondence courses and moved to the village of Samansur (in the Keminsky region, Kyrgyzstan) to be with her husband.  Ajgul’s husband did not interfere with her studies and helped her to finish her studies in spite of the fact that they already had small children. In 1986, after graduation, Ajgul found work in a shop as a saleswoman where she worked for about nine years. After the disintegration of collective farms during the breakup of the Soviet Union, the shop in which Ajgul worked became private property, and she lost her job. The small plot of land where her husband growing grain and forage crops was allocated to them, and Ajgul began to help her husband.   Together, they ploughed the earth, sowed, and fertilized.  There were some years in which the expense of cultivation was greater than the income derived after harvest, but it was necessary to continue to raise the children and educate them. Some years, Ajgul has been invited to the rural consulting service in the Keminsky region to give lessons on the cultivation of new grades of grain crops to the local population. She actively participates in the public affairs of the area.  Ajgul has four children, her two oldest daughters are already married, and her younger children, a son and a daughter, go to school and plan to study further in Bishkek.

Now Ajgul has a small homestead with a cow and some sheep. Ajgul is taking a loan of 70,000 SOM (KGS) with which she plans to increase her cattle.  She will buy two more cows and to make a small stockpile of a feed which will last until the spring.

The joint-stock company MFK Baj-Tushum and Partners distributes Kiva loans locally to socially-vulnerable populations. The joint-stock company MFK Baj-Tushum and Partners is one of the lead micro-financial organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Baj-Tushum and Partners is a reliable financial partner which is contributing to development of economy in the Kirghiz Republic by granting accessible micro-financial services in the countryside and cities, which provide services to benefit both clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mukafat

texts.ru: Mukafat G. 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, dochku i sina kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Mukafat yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Mukafat uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey jenskoy obuvi i sumok. Seychas Mukafat nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit obuv dlya novoqo sezona i sumki dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Mukafat G. is forty years old.  He is married and has two children, a son and daughter who go to school.  Mukafat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region.  Mukafat has been selling women’s shoes and bags for nine years.  Now, Mukafat needs 2300 AZN to buy and resell shoes and bags appropriate for the new season.

loans.use: Buying goods for resale

loans.name: Rokonka Metian

texts.en:
Rokonka Metian O. N. is 35 years old, married and supports eight people.

Rokonka is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, with which he plans to prepare his wheat farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children.

In the future he hopes to grow his business and practice large-scale farming and also to acquire a pierce of land to build rental houses.

Rokonka is a thorough man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To prepare his wheat farm

loans.name: Kokadje (La Transparence) Group

texts.fr:
Kokadje est un regroupement de femmes de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, Hamdallaye, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe Kokadje fait l’achat et la vente de parures de toutes sortes : (des colliers, des perles, des bracelets, des boucles d’oreille et du nez), des  d’habillements : des pagnes wax, des bazins et  des brodés.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe Kokadje ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 8 ans. Le groupe kokadje est a son seizième prêt de groupe et tous les 15 premiers ont été bien remboursés.
Awa Traoré  qui est un des membres du groupe fait l’achat et la vente des parures et habillements. Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place au bord du marché de Hamdallaye avec un hangar.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de perle pour confectionner toutes sortes de parures. Elle s’approvisionne au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour les  revendre après avoir confectionner  en détail et au comptant à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. En plus elle veut acheter  des pagnes wax à Bamako à un prix abordable pour revendre en détail au comptant et en crédit.
Awa Traoré  elle,  compte réaliser 130 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour remboursement le prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir agrandir  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Kokadje is a group of women from the town of Koutiala who live together in the same neighborhood, Hamdallaye, in large traditional families with their husbands, children and co-spouses. On average they are 40 years old, married and have less than 5 children each. 

This group sells all kinds of jewelry (necklaces, pearls, bracelets, ear and nose rings), as well as clothing (wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), damask fabric and embroidered fabric. To increase their activity, the Kokadje group  members decided 8 years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their sixteenth loan and the previous fifteen have all been properly repaid. 

Awa Traoré, one of the group members, buys and sells jewelry and clothing. She is very much in demand because she has a good spot next to the Hamdallaye market with a warehouse. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of pearls with which she will make all sorts of jewelry. She obtains her supplies wholesale at the Kouiala Grand Market, and re-sells, after having worked on them, on a retail or cash basis to customers who are mostly women. She also wants to buy wax "pagnes" cheaply in Bamako to re-sell on a retail basis for cash or credit . Awa Traoré individually expects to make 130,000 CFA francs, which will be used to re-pay the loan and to meet the family's everyday expenses. The group wants to strengthen its partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase its activity.

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Noone

texts.en:
Noone O. T. 34 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. He has been farming for the last 13 years in Narok town.

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, with which he is planning to buy farm inputs (such as fertilizer). He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. Noone is a punctilious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hakiligouma Group

texts.fr:
HAKILIGOUMA est un  groupement de cinq femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à Sido l’un des villages de la préfecture de  BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe HAKILIGOUMA se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un fonds de commerce suffisante pour satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  pour faire la couture, la restauration, le commerce de banane et Sira C. pour faire le commerce  des tissus et des pagnes.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Sira C., compte acheter, 4 pièces de pagnes ‘’8 mars.’’
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes, et effectue sa vente en détail à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et le reste sera  utilisé dans la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
HAKILIGOUMA is a group of five women, all married, with an average age of 35, and an average of 3 children each. They live in family groups with their husband and children in Sido, one of the villages in the prefecture of Bougouni (Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). The group members met each other through family and neighborhood connections. 

With the goal of finding enough working capital to satisfy their customers, they decided to join micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They plan to use this loan for sewing, food service, trading in bananas and for Sira C., trading in fabric and "pagnes" (colorful African cloth). With this new loan, Sira C. will buy 4 lengths of "March 8 pagnes." She obtains her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and sells the goods at her home and at the market, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women. 

With this new loan, Sira expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, some of which will be re-invested in the business and the rest will be used for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Yankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe YANKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Elles comptent utiliser leurs prêts pour faire la restauration, le commerce de condiments et Chata K. pour faire le commerce  d’articles divers.
Avec ce prêt Chata K. la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 5 pièces de draps de lits Burkinabé, 5 paires de tasses thermos. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à la maison, au marché et en ambulant dans le village, en détail, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles comte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé  familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the YANKADI Group are married women who are on average 38 years old and have four children each.  They live with their spouses and children in nuclear family households in Sido, a prefecture of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They met each other through kinship ties, business and as neighbors.

Concerned about satisfying their clients and expanding the size of their business, they decided to join a loan program with the micofinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time.

They intend to use their loan in order to run small restaurants and sell spices; Chata K. will use it to sell various small items.  With this loan, Chata K., the president of the Group, intends to purchase five bedsheets from Burkina Faso and five pairs of thermos mugs. She stocks-up in Bamako from wholesalers  and carries out her individual sales from her home, at the market, and walking throughout the village for cash or credit to a clientele of women and men.

With this loan they hope to earn monthly profits of 15,000 FCFA, of which part will be reinvested in the business and the other portion will be used to cover medical expenses for their families.

loans.use: Purchasing various items

loans.name: Peterson Mugo

texts.en:
Peterson  Mugo N. is 53 years old and married to Eleminia Wanjiku, who is a farmer and contributes to the family income. 

He is banana farmer and has been running his business for a period of about three years with an income of about KES 10,000 per month.

This is his third loan from KADET Ltd., and he repaid the previous loan without any difficulty. He intends to use the loan to hire laborers to work on the farm. He hopes to give his children a quality education and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the farm

loans.name: Makhira

texts.ru: Makhira K. 28 let. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Makhira jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Ona soderjit sebya i mamu i poeotmu uje 7 ket kak nachala rabotat i prodovat jenskuyu odejdu. Makhira seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit jenskuyu odejdu po sezonu dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Makhira K. is 28 years old.  She is single and does not have children.  Makhira lives in Baku with her mother.  She supports herself and her mother and has been selling women’s clothing for seven years.  Makhira currently needs 2300 AZN to buy seasonal women’s clothing for resale to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying clothing for resale

loans.name: Pailon Nathan

texts.en:
Pailon Nathan N. is 28 years old. He is married and has three school-going children. He is a taxi operator and he has been running a transport business for the last four years with a good income. 

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, with which he plans to service his vehicle. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to save and to pay school fees for his children. 

His hope is to become a large-scale businessman and to educate his children.

Pailon is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To service his vehicle

loans.name: Wicliff

texts.en:
Wicliff is a 43-year-old married man with ten children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in farming and shopkeeping for the last ten years. He started by farming and later expanded to a shop. 

His hardship is poor weather, labor costs and the high cost of pesticides. His vision is to have a good plantation and a good shop and to educate his children.

Wicliff needs the loan to buy pesticides.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with four children living in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for three years. She started with a capital of 500,000 UGX and now has working capital of 1,800,000 UGX. Her hardship is bad debtors. Her vision for the future is to run a wholesale business and have a well educated family.  Rehema needs the loan to renovate her shop.

loans.use: Renovation of her shop

loans.name: Edith Mumbi

texts.en:
Edith Mumbi is 32 years old and married to Dominic Kinga, who contributes to the family's income. They have six children. She is a rice distributor and has been in the business for a period of four years with an income of about $300 a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more bags of rice to sell. She hopes to be a leading distributor of rice in the region and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Faith Naisiae

texts.en:
Faith Naisiae M. is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She has been operating a retail shop in a rental area for the last four years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her 3rd loan, with which she plans to purchase more stock for the shop; e.g. rice, sugar, matchboxes, sodas, etc. She hopes to use the profits from this loan to expand her business by opening more branches.

Faith's dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses and to ensure a good standard of living for her family. She is a punctilious woman who is determined to achieve her set goals if supported financially.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Grace Wambui

texts.en:
Grace Wambui is a 58-year-old widow with seven children between the ages of 35 and 21. She has worked a horticulture farm for a period of about ten years with an income of about $38 per month.

This is her 4th loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans well and on time. She intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers such as manure. She hopes to be a leading horticulture farmer and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: David Kamau

texts.en:
David Kamau N. is 39 years old and married to Esther Mugure, who also contributes to the family's income. He has a carpentry shop that he has been operating for a period of three years with an income of about $244 per month. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI (micro-finance institution) and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the money to buy lumber for his carpentry work. He hopes to own timberland in the future, which will increase his profits and improve his family's standard of living as a result.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry work

loans.name: Josphat Wachira

texts.en:
Josphat Wahira is 52 years old and married to Felister Wachira who helps in a restaurant while Josphat does horticulture farming. He has been running his business for a period of about 28 years with an income of about 8,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his third loan from KADET after successfully repaying the previous loans. He intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs and hire labourers. He hopes to have all his children finish school comfortably.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and hire  labourers

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit H. is 32 years old. She lives in Lchashen village. Lilit is married and she has a 9-year-old son, who is in schooll. 

Lilit used to work as a geography teacher at Lchashen village school, and since 2006 she has worked in village administration as a secretary. Simultaneously with her permanent work, Lilit manages animal husbandry. She breeds cows, sheep, pigs and chickens as well. Her husband helps her a lot and that's how they support their family. 

Lilit intends to increase her farming livestock, so she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan, which she will use to buy some calves or sheep (depending on their cost).

loans.use: To buy some calves or sheep

loans.name: Mpara Abagamba Kamu Traders Group A-Mubende

texts.en: K. Anna is a 36-year-old business lady who has for the past decade been operating a pharmacy in Mpara-Mubende. Anna, a happily married mother of 2, also does some farming. Monthly the drugstore business generates shillings 300,000 as profits. Anna belongs to Mpara  Abagamba Kamu traders group-Mubende and she says with this loan, she is going to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more drugs to resell

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Loice faces the major challenge in her business of the high cost of transporting charcoal. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune H. was born in 1971. She lives in Kapan. Nune is married and has two children, both of whom are students.
 
For about three years Nune has engaged in trading. She rents a place in Kapan market, where she sells tableware, bags, wallets, caps, scarves, small household appliances, etc. She buys merchandise from Yerevan once a month and sells it at her stall in Kapan. She works without free days and thanks to her business she provides part of her family’s needs and pays for her son’s education.

Nune is seeking a $1,400 loan to increase her stall’s assortment. She intends to buy headscarves, umbrellas, bags, wallets and tableware to resell.

loans.use: To buy headscarves, umbrellas, bags, wallets and tableware to resell

loans.name: Gabriel Enrique

texts.es:
Gabriel Enrique es un hombre desplazado por la violencia, sin embargo esto no ha sido una dificultad para el ya que desde que llegó a Medellín monto una legumbrería que ha sido el negocio que le ha permitido mantener el sustento de su familia.

El trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana para brindarles a sus clientes verdura fresca y la mejor atención, por esto Gabriel necesita mantener un excelente surtido en su legumbrería no solo para mantener sus clientes sino para ofrecerles mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Gabriel Enrique was displaced by the violence, however this has not stopped him. Since he arrived in Medellín he set up a vegetable shop, and this business has allowed him to support his family. 

He starts work very early in the morning in order to offer his customers fresh vegetables and the best service. For this reason, Gabriel needs to maintain an excellent stock at his vegetable stand, not only to keep his customers but also to offer them a better variety.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables for his vegetable stand

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen H. was born in 1964 and lives in the town of Kapan. He is married and has two children -- a son who is serving in the Armenian army and a daughter who is a student in Yerevan. His wife is not currently employed. For the last 20 years, he has made a living running his own car-repair business. This has allowed him to support his family and pay for the education of his children. He is applying for this loan for 1,000,000 AMD to buy spare parts. This will be his fourth loan from Nor Horizon, and he has repaid the first three on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for a car-repair business

loans.name: Paul Muchira

texts.en:
Paul Muchira is 45 years old married to Florence Wangui, who contributes to the family income by working as a farmer. For the last 16 years, Paul has made a living by making furniture and other items out of wood, and earns about KES.15,000 a month

He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying three previous loans completely and on time. He intends to use the loan to buy more timber and pay his children's school fees. He also hopes to earn enough money to finish building his home and improve his children's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more timber and pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Ledys Omaria

texts.es: Desde hace un tiempo Ledys Omaria se dedica a la confección y es a través de este trabajo que ha podido mantener el sustento de su familia, es por esto que ella necesita comprar mas máquinas para poder ofrecerle a susu clientes mayor capacidad de producción y de esta manera la calidad de vida de ella y su familia mejorará notablemente,
texts.en: For some time Ledys Omaria has worked making clothing, and it is through this work that she has been able to provide for her family. She needs to purchase more sewing machines so that she can increase the production capacity she offers her clients. This way she can improve her quality of life and her family will make significant strides towards a better life.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pipes to start a water-distribution business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flour and cooking oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mpara Abagamba Kamu Traders Group B-Mubende

texts.en: Anges K. is 41 years old and makes a living selling clothes in her town, Mpara-Mubende. She has been in business for the last 15 years, and she and her husband work hard to support their six children. Agnes also earns additional income by working as a farmer. She earns about 400,000 shillings a month and will use this loan to buy more bales of clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: The buy of more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Mathemo

texts.en:
Mathemo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past nine years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mathemo faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit and the seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Perla Azucena

texts.es: La señora Perla V. es el Segundo crédito que CEPRODEL  le otorga para pagos de aranceles escolares , compra de todos los materiales escolares para preparar a sus tres hijos que comienzan en este mes sus estudios .Es importante en el desarrollo intelectual de sus hijos de ser con los prestamos no se logra comprar lo necesario
texts.en: This will be the second loan Mrs. Perla V. has received from CEPRODEL to pay school fees and purchase all the necessary school supplies for her three children who are starting school this month. Her children's intellectual development is very important to her and without this loan she would be unable to pay for all their necessities.

loans.use: Pay school fees and purchase school supplies for children

loans.name: Caroline Mwende

texts.en:
Caroline Mwende is 42 years old and married to Michael. She runs a retail shop, which has been in operation for a period of four years with an income of KES. 5,000 a month. She also has a farm where she grows maize.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD, and she intends to use it to buy seedlings for the for the next season of planting. She hopes to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

He has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past three years, and neighbours and passersby are his potential customers. In addition, he also operates a posho mills business grinding maize, which contributes to his other source of income. Omar faces a major challenge of seasonality and breakdown of machine in his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to start a vegetable stall, purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for sale. He decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a vegetable stall, purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania es madre soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Desde que era muy joven aprendió a trabajar en el campo, en el sembrado y cosecha de tubérculos y otros alimentos, y esto gracias a las técnicas que su padre le enseñó. Hoy esta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos económicos, desde entonces siembra papa, olluco, maíz y arveja, productos que tiene mucha demanda y que los ofrece también en su tienda. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho cultivar, porque es lo que mejor  que sabe hacer, aunque es algo sacrificado levantarse todos los días al amanecer, y vigilar con dedicación sus campos, sin embargo considera gratificante recoger la gran producción en temporada de cosecha, y vender todo a los mayoristas de la zona que le pagan regular dinero, permitiéndole ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado extender la siembra para así aumentar la producción, asimismo surtir su  tienda con productos variados, según indica, es un negocio muy rentable. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mostradores para su tienda y también más mercadería en menestras como lentejas y fréjoles.
texts.en: Epifania, 28, is a single mother.  She lives with her son in her own house.  She learned farming when she was very young, planting and harvesting potatoes and other crops, all thanks to her father who was a farmer.  Farming has become her main source of income now.  She plants potatoes, olluco, maize and beans because there's a lot of demand for them.  She also sells what she grows in her own shop.  She says that she likes farming because it is what she knows best, even though it requires much sacrifice.  She has to get up at dawn every day to work her fields but it's worth the effort at harvest time.  She takes her crop to market and sells to the wholesalers there who pay her with real money!  She, in turn, uses the money to provide a better quality of life for her child.  Epifania is an enterprising woman and she wants to plant more crops in the future and increase her production.  She also wants to stock her store with various products because, she says, the business is very profitable.  This is Epifania's second MFP loan.  She has a history of replaying past loans on time and she is grateful for your help.  She will use the loan to buy products for her store that she will then resell.

loans.use: Buy products to resell and a display case for retail business.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: La señora Ana Rosa solicita crédito para comprar los útiles escolares de sus hijos ya que tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar y el gasto de zapatos , uniforme, mochilas , cuadernos, libros no se cubre con el salario y es urgente ya que ellos inician en este mes de febrero.
texts.en: Señora Ana Rosa is seeking a loan to buy school supplies for her children. She has three children of school age and the expense of shoes, uniforms, backpacks, notebooks, and books is not covered by her salary. She feels this is urgent since they begin school in the month of February.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia forma parte del banco comunal “Prieto cruz” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. 
Ella vende flores en un carrito, que además le sirve para trasladar sus utensilios. Antonia se dedica a este rubro desde hace 18 años y su horario laboral es de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 17:00 horas.
Antonia  tiene muchos clientes frecuentes y antiguos. En su trabajo le ayudan su esposo e hijo. 
Con este préstamo pretende comprar muchas flores, especialmente para la temporada del día de la madre y semana santa, ya que son estas fechas en las cuales existe más demanda de compra y pedidos de flores. 
El sueño de Antonia es tener un negocio de abarrotes, para atenderlo desde su casa, ya que el rubro en el que se ha desempeñado durante tantos años la tiene agotada. Lo que le permitiría a nivel personal tener una vida más confortable y tranquila. 
Antonia vive junto a su esposo e hijo de 21 años, quien sufre una enfermedad a la vista, a causa de su antiguo trabajo, ya que él se desempeñaba en labores de soldador calificado. Lo que le provocó glaucoma. Es por esto que su hijo cambió de rubro y ahora está estudiando otra carrera. De aquí se genera la motivación de Antonia de continuar su negocio, ya que quiere brindarle a su hijo un mejor futuro.
Para Antonia  los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que con éstos podrá invertir. También disfruta mucho de las reuniones que tiene junto a su grupo y asiste siempre.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Antonia is part of the Communal Bank “Prieto Cruz” (Dark Cross) which is in the city of Concepción. She sells flowers from a small cart that she also uses for moving her tools. Antonia has been in this business for eighteen years and works from 6am to 5pm. She has many regular and long-time customers. Her husband and her son assist her with her work. With this loan she plans to buy more flowers, especially those that are bought for Mother’s Day and Easter. There is more demand around these dates, as indicated by increased purchases and orders.

Antonia dreams of having a grocery store that she can manage from her home because the flower business has run its course over the past few years. On a personal level, this would allow her to have a more comfortable and peaceful life.

Antonia lives with her husband and her 21 year old son who suffers from a disease that affects his vision and was caused by his job. He previously worked as a welder, which resulted in glaucoma. For this reason, he changed jobs and is now studying to pursue another profession. This motivated Antonia to continue her business, since she wants to provide her son a better future.

For Antonia, the loans from Fondo Esperanza have been a great help to her business because they have enabled her to invest. She also enjoys the group meetings and always attends them.

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío River, one of the largest in the country, in Bíobio region in southern Chile. The city played an important role in Chilean history, being the home of important battles and a major settlement, particularly during the Arauco War. Concepción lies on the border next to the Mapuche territory. The city is currently undergoing significant economic and demographic development. It is considered to be one of the major urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers in Chile, just behind Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: Purchase flowers to sell

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha tiene 6 años de experiencia en este negocio el cual posee dos kioscos que están ubicados en dos parques de este municipio, donde vende gaseosas, hamburguesas, jugos  etc.
Este crédito  será para invertirlo en mas capital de trabajo para sus kioscos ya que como inicia el año escolar la mayor parte de sus clientes son estudiantes 
Ella es madre soltera y solo cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres 
Es el tercer crédito que trabaja con ceprodel lo cual dice que gracias a estos préstamos ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y su negocio
texts.en:
Martha has six years of business experience. She owns two kiosks located at two different parks in the city where she sells sodas, hamburgers, juices, and other items.

This loan will be invested as additional operating capital for her kiosks since the school year has started. Most of her customers are students.

Martha is a single mother and only receives support from her parents. This is her third loan with CEPRODEL. She says she is thankful for these loans because she has been able to improve her home and her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell from her kiosks

loans.name: Nordo Omar

texts.es:
NORDO OMAR F. S., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO OFICINISTA,  ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y SOLO UNO  ESTA EN EL COLEGIO.
DON NORDO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, PIEDRA Y PIEDRIN PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO.
NORDO DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A BRINDADO MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Nordo Omar F. S. is from Managua and works as an office clerk. He is the father of three children, one of whom is in high school.

Don Nordo visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a home improvement loan so that he could invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, and gravel in order to finish building a room. He says that he is grateful for the loans CEPRODEL has provided since they have allowed him to improve his home and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of a room

loans.name: Karem Maria

texts.es: La Señora Karem Maria tiene 24 años. Es una joven muy luchadora y tiene un espíritu muy alegre. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es quien se hace cargo de ofrecerle a su familia lo necesario para su hogar y con la ayuda de la familia logro salir adelante con este pequeño negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, detergente, jabón y golosinas en general. Su deseo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos, ya que ella es madre y padre al mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Sra. Karem Maria is 24 years old. This young woman is a fighter and has a cheerful spirit. She has managed a store for more than three years. Karem is responsible for providing for her family’s household needs and helping them move forward through her small business.

The loan she requested will be used as operating capital to purchase basic grains, detergents, soaps, and candy. Her wish is to continue supporting her children because she must play the role of both mother and father.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy basic grains, detergents, soaps, and candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
La señora S. es profesora en este municipio desde hace 25 años en el nivel de primaria este crédito será utilizado para terminar de construir una tapia en su casa para tener mayor seguridad en su vivienda ya que no se encuentra cerrada si no que tiene alrededor de la casa alambres de puas 
Es el tercer crédito que solicita en ceprodel los dos anteriores han sido siempre para mejorar su casa 
Ella es madre soltera con una hija a su cargo que cuando se va para su trabajo la niña queda al cuido de la madre de la Sra. Nelly
Los créditos con ceprodel le han sido de mucha utilidad ya que su vivienda le ha hechos varios cambios con lo que se siente agradecida con la institución
texts.en:
Sra. S. has been an elementary school teacher in this town for 25 years. She will use this loan to finish the construction of a wall outside of her home so that she will have added security. Her property is not closed off, but surrounded by barbed wire.

This is the third loan she has requested from CEPRODEL. Her two previous loans were also used for home improvements.

Sra. Nelly is a single mother of a daughter who is a dependent. When Nelly leaves for work, her daughter is looked after by her grandmother.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been very useful because her home has undergone several changes, so Nelly expresses her appreciation.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of a security wall

loans.name: Marlene Emperatriz

texts.es:
MARLENE EMPERATRIZ A. Z., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO PROFESORA,  ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y SOLO UNO  DEPENDE DE ELLA.
DOÑA MARLENE ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC Y PERLINES PARA TERMINAR DE REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA, YA QUE ESTE EN INVIERNO EL AGUA SE PASA..
MARLENE DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A BRINDADO MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Marlene Emperatriz A. Z. is from Managua and works as a teacher. She is the mother of three children, but only one is a dependent.

Doña Marlene visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new home improvement loan to buy construction materials such as zinc and crossbeams in order to finish the repairs to the roof of her house. Water seeps through during the winter.

Marlene says she is grateful for the loans provided by CEPRODEL because they have helped her improve her home and provide better living conditions for her family.
